story:
Dear reader,

It took 505,753,200 seconds to be able to understand what the word identity meant to me. Though I may only be 16 years old and the beginning of learning about who I am has barely grown itself, I feel that I do have some things I am able to share about myself.

I have lived my entire life in Austin, TX (hook'em horns!) and am the oldest of 4 siblings. I love sports, being active, spending time with my family, going to extracurriculars like football games, and reading books. But really the only important thing you should know about me is that I am Jewish. I have grown from a modern day religious family who greatly impacts the world and everyone they see. My parents have an extreme passion for giving and being able to provide opportunity to me to fulfill what I consider a Jewish life. Being largely involved with the organization USY (United Synagogue Youth), I was able to go on one of their programs offered to Israel this previous summer. On June 30th, 2015 I descended off the plane to the ground of my own holy land, where I was able to feel over 2000 years worth of history in the course of a month. After coming back, Israel has been all the rage of most conversations I will have with people. I wanted to urge many of my friends to go on this program to Israel too, and be able to make their own connections to a place full of millions of passions. Of course though, telling people to magically be able to pull 5000 dollars out of their pockets and go to a foreign country is very hard financially.

What I would like to be able to do with this fundraiser is use the money made to send people to Israel to be able to find their own reflections of themselves within the land. Israel is one of the holiest sites in the world; Islam, Chrisitanity, and Judaism all start their roots here.  I find it my own passion to be able to educate and show people the importance of understanding who we are and where we came from. Hopefully with this fundraiser, I can start doing just that.

What We Need & What You Get

There are 10 people I have on a list that I would like the proceeds to be able to go to for their own trips to Israel this coming summer. I would like to ideally reach $20,000 which I am hoping to give about $500-1000 to each kid that applies for a scholarship through this fund.

Risks & Challenges

I am investing a lot of my time and money myself to be able to fulfill this passion for me. As a way to encourage people to donate, if you donate $15 dollars or more I will send you a bracelet that says “Be the Change.”


Other Ways You Can Help......

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign!!

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to promote this cause!!

story:
Summer isn't fun for everyone.

Across America, kids everywhere, are knee deep into their summer fun. Thoughts of summer break still bring back wonderful memories for me.  Lazy days hanging with friends and riding bikes around town or swimming at the local pool made memories that will be with me for a lifetime.  Whether playing baseball, fishing or hiding out in our fort in the woods across by day and catching lightening bugs at night there was always something fun to do in our small town.
But particularly exciting for me was the freedom to cook and eat what we wanted while our parents were working.  Whether raiding my mothers pantry to make a batch of chocolate chip cookies or riding our bikes down to the local grocery store to buy something to cook up, food was a big part of our summer break. 
Sadly enough summer isn't so much fun for far too many kids across America. Here in Southern California it is particularly rough.  One would think that living in SoCal, so close to the ocean, that summer would be a blast.  That's just not the case for so many.  Summer is a challenging time for so many parents and their kids.  Without the government subsidized school lunch program far too many parents and kids struggle just to eat.  As a child it is pretty hard to enjoy summer when your stomach is so often empty.

  • 49% of all school aged kids in Orange County are on the free and reduced lunch plan. In LA County the figure is 58%.

  • 1 in 5 kids are hungry in Orange County, a problem that is worsened when the government subsidized school lunch programs are not available during the summer months.
  • There are nearly 400,000 people at risk for hunger every month in Orange County, a region known for wealth and opulence.
  • Hunger strikes individuals, families with children, the elderly and the poor.
  • In a county where housing costs are among the highest in the nation, a full-time job does not guarantee that a family will be able to make ends meet.
  • Low income people have to make the difficult choices between food and other life necessities such as rent or health care on a regular basis. 

It is the middle of summer and school is out, what are these children eating tonight?

                               

With so much demand this summer you can help us keep Betsy rolling and our ovens full of food for those who need it most.

Meet Betsy & Bill:

Hello, my name is Bill Bracken, a professional chef with more than 35 years of experience in the hospitality industry.  After graduating with honors from the Culinary Institute of America, I began what was to be a long and successful career with a number of acclaimed luxury hotels and restaurants including the Peninsula Beverly Hills and the Four Seasons Hotel in Newport Beach. 

During the devastating economic recession that began in 2008, I watched a lot of good people lose their jobs at a time when there were no jobs to be found.  In the process I watched honest hardworking people struggle just to put a meal on their table and pay their rent.  

Then the unthinkable happened and in December of 2011 I too lost my job. 

As a man of faith I knew then that I was being called to find a way to leverage my talent and skills to help those who were struggling.

                                    

I got involved in a variety of nonprofit programs, including volunteering at the Orange County Rescue Mission as a regular guest chef.  It was my work at the mission that reconfirmed my concerns about the significant levels of food insecurity that exist in Orange County, and I set about to make a difference and feed the hungry.  It was there that I also realized just how much work is needed in America, to change how we feed and support the poor among us. 


Why Bracken's Kitchen

Surely we can find a better way to feed the hungry and under served in our communities.  How long will we continue to hand out processed, boxed, canned and dry food products that are laden with all the stuff that leads to obesity, diabetes and long term health issues. The warehouse/food bank model of feeding the poor has served us well for decades but surely we can do better.  

"A tasty and nutritious meal should not be a luxury available only to the well off in America in 2016," 

I was determined to open a restaurant to help address the problems and wrote our business plan.  But I quickly realized that hunger in Orange County has its own set of challenges, not the least of which included a primary concern of reaching food insecure families and children distributed over a broad geographic area.  People without resources who are already stretched thin are unable to travel regularly and over distances, even in pursuit of the nutritious meals that I wanted to provide.  I came to the conclusion that the answer could be found in the trendy new rebirth of an age-old business:  mobile food trucks.  If the people could not come to me, I would bring the food to the them.  

And thus in March 2013 Bracken’s Kitchen was born.  It has been almost 2 years since Betsy, our big red food truck showed up in our driveway thanks to Bruce Hecker of Bruce’s Catering and she and I have been very busy ever since.  We travel throughout Orange County regularly feeding tasty and nutritious meals to those who need it most. 

As a professional chef I have always believed in the power of food, however, over the past 18 months that has come to have a whole new meaning.  As humans we all share two of the most fundamental and basic of needs, the need to breath and the need to eat.  The problem is that air is free and food it not.   It is that very fact that gives food such power.  I have seen how food truly brings people together in amazing ways.  I believe there is no better way to intimately get to know a person than by sharing a meal with them.


Our Culinary Trio

While feeding people is a noble and necessary, we quickly realized that we need to find a way to have a more lasting impact on a person's life and help break the cycle of poverty.  And with that our Trio of Services was born. We have expanded on our “Food Truck Feeding Program” and recently launched our “Recovered Food Program” partnering with the “Chefs To End Hunger” initiative introduced by LA Specialty Produce Company.  They have put together a very simple yet effective way to allow hotels and restaurants to donate their high quality left over food items.  We are honored to work with them taking these left over products and turning them into more nutritious and tasty meals.

                                             


"No child should ever have to go to bed hungry in America."  

What's next?

As we move forward we are excited to introduce our culinary training program for at risk youth, especially those who have aged out of the foster system. In offering a foundation of culinary training we will offer young people living in poverty the chance for skilled jobs in our industry and a life outside the grip of poverty.


You can help...

It takes the time, talent and treasures of a lot of caring people to truly make a difference in the lives of those who need us most. We need your help to make that difference.  
We are working towards self sufficiency and to that end have launched "Catering For a Cause".  It is our way of putting our talents to work not only feeding those in need but ensuring we will be able to do so for years to com.  
But we are not there yet and hope that you will help us as we continue to feed the need.  From food supplies, to cleaning and paper supplies as well as gas and oil for Betsy, it all costs money.  We are proud to have achieved an average dinner cost of just under 50 cents.  That's right, just 1 dollar will provide the food for a tasty and nutritious dinner for 2 people. 

Help Us Feed a Family This Summer 

We know that the list of wonderful people and organizations asking  for your support is endless.  With over 30 years of experience in leading and running some of the top hotels in Southern California you can rest assured of the experience that Chef Bracken  brings to the table.  
We take the stewardship of your donations very serious and will do our very best to honor your support in how we run our organization.  We do hope you will consider helping us feed the need here in Southern California and eventually beyond. 
If you are not in a position to help us financially there are many other ways you can be of support.  If you are in the local area you can offer your time and talent to help keep us moving.  If not please help us spread the word through this campaign and our social media outlets.  
We do hope that you will agree with us that nutritious food, one of the basic necessities of life, should not be a luxury only for the wealthy.
Thank You
story_txt:
Summer isn't fun for everyone.
Across America, kids everywhere, are knee deep into their summer fun. Thoughts of summer break still bring back wonderful memories for me.  Lazy days hanging with friends and riding bikes around town or swimming at the local pool made memories that will be with me for a lifetime.  Whether playing baseball, fishing or hiding out in our fort in the woods across by day and catching lightening bugs at night there was always something fun to do in our small town.


But particularly exciting for me was the freedom to cook and eat what we wanted while our parents were working.  Whether raiding my mothers pantry to make a batch of chocolate chip cookies or riding our bikes down to the local grocery store to buy something to cook up, food was a big part of our summer break. 

Sadly enough summer isn't so much fun for far too many kids across America. Here in Southern California it is particularly rough.  One would think that living in SoCal, so close to the ocean, that summer would be a blast.  That's just not the case for so many.  Summer is a challenging time for so many parents and their kids.  Without the government subsidized school lunch program far too many parents and kids struggle just to eat.  As a child it is pretty hard to enjoy summer when your stomach is so often empty.


49% of all school aged kids in Orange County are on the free and reduced lunch plan. In LA County the figure is 58%.

1 in 5 kids are hungry in Orange County, a problem that is worsened when the government subsidized school lunch programs are not available during the summer months.

There are nearly 400,000 people at risk for hunger every month in Orange County, a region known for wealth and opulence.


Hunger strikes individuals, families with children, the elderly and the poor.


In a county where housing costs are among the highest in the nation, a full-time job does not guarantee that a family will be able to make ends meet.


Low income people have to make the difficult choices between food and other life necessities such as rent or health care on a regular basis. 


It is the middle of summer and school is out, what are these children eating tonight?

                               
With so much demand this summer you can help us keep Betsy rolling and our ovens full of food for those who need it most.

Meet Betsy & Bill:
Hello, my name is Bill Bracken, a professional chef with more than 35 years of experience in the hospitality industry.  After graduating with honors from the Culinary Institute of America, I began what was to be a long and successful career with a number of acclaimed luxury hotels and restaurants including the Peninsula Beverly Hills and the Four Seasons Hotel in Newport Beach. 
During the devastating economic recession that began in 2008, I watched a lot of good people lose
their jobs at a time when there were no jobs to be found.  In the process I watched honest hardworking
people struggle just to put a meal on their table and pay
their rent.  
Then the unthinkable happened
and in December of 2011 I too lost my job. 
As a man of faith I knew then that I was being called to find a way to leverage my talent
and skills to help those who were struggling.

                                    
I got involved in
a variety of nonprofit programs, including volunteering at the Orange County Rescue
Mission as a regular guest chef.  It was my
work at the mission that reconfirmed my concerns about the significant levels
of food insecurity that exist in Orange County, and I set about to make a
difference and feed the hungry.  It was there that I also realized just how much work is needed in America, to change how we feed and support the poor among us. 

Why Bracken's Kitchen
Surely we can find a better way to feed the hungry and under served in our communities.  How long will we continue to hand out processed, boxed, canned and dry food products that are laden with all the stuff that leads to obesity, diabetes and long term health issues. The warehouse/food bank model of feeding the poor has served us well for decades but surely we can do better.  
"A tasty and nutritious meal should not be a luxury available only to the well off in America in 2016," 
I was determined to open a
restaurant to help address the problems and wrote our business plan.  But I quickly realized that hunger in Orange County
has its own set of challenges, not the least of which included a primary concern
of reaching food insecure families and children distributed over a broad geographic
area.  People without resources who are already
stretched thin are unable to travel regularly and over distances, even in
pursuit of the nutritious meals that I wanted to provide.  I came to the conclusion that the answer
could be found in the trendy new rebirth of an age-old business:  mobile food trucks.  If the people could not come to me, I would
bring the food to the them.  
And thus in
March 2013 Bracken’s Kitchen was born. 
It has been almost 2 years since Betsy, our big red food truck showed up
in our driveway thanks to Bruce Hecker of Bruce’s Catering and she and I have
been very busy ever since.  We travel

who need it most.

and basic of needs, the need to breath and the need to eat.  The problem is that air is free and food it
not.   It is that very fact that gives food such power.  I have seen how food truly brings people
together in amazing ways.  I believe
there is no better way to intimately get to know a person than by sharing a meal
with them.

have a more lasting impact on a person's life and help break the cycle of
poverty.  And with that our Trio of
Services was born. We have expanded on
our “Food Truck Feeding Program” and recently launched our “Recovered Food
Program” partnering with the “Chefs To End Hunger” initiative introduced by LA
Specialty Produce Company.  They have put
together a very simple yet effective way to allow hotels and restaurants to donate
their high quality left over food items. 
We are honored to work with them taking these left over products and
turning them into more nutritious and tasty meals.
                                             

"No child should ever have to go to bed hungry in America."

If you are not in a position to help us financially there are many other ways you can be of support.  If you are in the local area you can offer your time and talent to help keep us moving.  If not please help us spread the word through this campaign and our social media outlets.  We do hope that you will agree with us that nutritious food, one of the basic necessities of life, should not be a luxury only for the wealthy.

story:
13 years ago, a bunch of charismatic pensioners in Scotland, decided to build a replica WW1 biplane with no money, no previous experience and limited facilities. Despite many difficulties and set-backs...they're nearly there! 

Let's help them finish it!

With great good humour, boundless optimism and a love of craftsmanship, they taught each other long forgotten skills and turned retirement into the greatest challenge of their lives...and they are so close to succeeding.                      

They are all members of the Aircraft Preservation Society, Scotland (APSS) and from their own subscriptions, scraps of money from here and there, a mountain of goodwill and working voluntarily for thousands of hours...the aircraft is 90% complete - but with 90% to go.

They're aiming to complete the aircraft by the end of 2015 to meet the centenary of WW1 and the maiden flight of the original aeroplane...the Sopwith 1 and 1/2 Strutter.

All that stands in the way of the Strutter's first flight is £15,000.

The aircraft has cost around £40,000 to date and the APSS have sold some treasured possessions to get that far. Can we help them get over the line?

WHY SHOULD WE?

Because you can help bring a unique and forgotten slice of history back to life. The Strutter is amazing. It's beautiful. It's inspiring.

The completed aircraft will fly and be exhibited at airshows, inspiring the next generation to find an interest in engineering and aviation.

The Strutter Project is also a tribute to the bravery of the young men who flew these machines and the dedication of the men and women who built the aircraft and kept them flying during the Great War.

The Strutter is living proof of the power of collective, altruistic endeavour. It is proof that retirement does not mean retreat.

In the USA, Canada and New Zealand they have a strong tradition of rescuing or replicating famous aircraft. In Scotland, such projects are rare.

Imagine how you will feel seeing this amazing machine taking to the air thanks to your contribution.

Apart from our eternal gratitude we are offering a unique selection of wonderful rewards for your generosity, with the ultimate opportunity - A FLIGHT IN THE STRUTTER!

You can become a member of the team that will bring this incredible aeroplane to life. We are offering certificates and photographs, graphics and plans for a modest donation. For more generous donations, we are offering everything from unique memorabilia right up to flights in gliders and Jungmann biplanes and of course, the big one...a flight in the Strutter.

The lucky donors who want to take up the flights will also become honorary members of the APSS.

Please come and support this brilliant and exciting project and honour the memory of the young men who fought to keep Scotland from harm.

Your funding will allow for the Strutter to be finished. Any excess raised will go into maintenance, storage and flying.



The Aircraft Preservation Society, Scotland is a registered charity: SC 033307

story:
WHAT IS DIGILIB 3D :

 REVENUE ORIENTED DIGITAL 3D INTERACTIVE LIBRARY  NETWORKS TO DIGITALLY TRANSFORM THE $1.6 TRILLION GLOBAL CREATIVE ECONOMY

Welcome to the Dawn of another Digital Dollar Wave. This one does not begin in Silicon Valley. Here's your chance to CONTRIBUTE to the launching of the world's first Digital Ecosystem designed to empower those creative geniuses such as Musicians, Moviemakers, Fashion Designers and Athletes who always seem to be left out of these Digital Revolutions. According to UNESCO's (United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization) latest Creative Economy Report "the global market value of the creative economy is approximately US$1.6 trillion".

BEST OF BOTH DIGITAL WORLDS

CONTRIBUTE with any of our DIGILIB 3D MEMBERSHIP PERKS (MEMBER, BRONZE, SILVER, GOLD, PLATINUM, BLACK) now and get a chance to upgrade to  our DUAL OS (ANDROID and WINDOWS) DIGITAL TABLET (DIGIPAD TV) that can run all DIGILIB 3D Interactive Visual Applications (DIVA) and over 2 million Android and Windows Apps combined, This includes popular apps such as YOUTUBE, SKYPE, FACEBOOK, TWITTER, INSTAGRAM, NETFLIX, HBO GO and GOOGLE MAPS, plus TV ANYWHERE Channels around the world.. 

DIGIPAD TV UPGRADE PERKs will be offered later on in this Campaign only to  those who Contributed via our various DIGILIB 3D Membership Card PERKS.This will be the best of both digital worlds and free access to DIGILIB 3D for at least 1 year . Enjoy tremendous $avings with  an opportunity to get 2 major OS platforms (Windows and Android) in one convenient Digital Tablet.This is one of our great Innovation of Things working with our DIGILIB 3D Global Partners.

TIMES SQ: The Digital Urban Grand Canyon of Global Creativity.

This Digital Dollar Wave starts right here  in Times SQ, NYC, the Digital Urban Grand Canyon of Global Creativity, as the Ball Drops to usher in a brand New Digital Year! What an incredible event as millions of spectators, dwarfed by humongous hills of Digital Advertising Displays click on their mobile devices to capture Manhattan's Multimedia Magic  bursting into fireworks 25 stories above.  Broadcasters from all over the world capture the moment, especially our excited  DIGILIB 3D Broadcaster from  the Swedish Creative Economy.

 

What's the Global Creative Economy? It's the economy emanating from the making, management, marketing and monetization of books, broadcasting, music, photography, TV programs, advertising, visual arts, culinary arts, live entertainment, theater, movies, magazines, greeting cards, newspapers, fashion, tourism, smart phone design, video game design, 3D Printing, apps, wearables and most "things" our creative minds can conceive or innovate... such as the Internet of Things.

DIGILIB 3D is  the Digital 3D Interactive Library designed to help you and other members of the Global Creative Economy,  MAKE, MANAGE, MARKET and MONETIZE  Creativity or the Digital  Innovation of Things ! In a realistic  simulation of a real life library, DIGILIB 3D uses core Digital Interactive Components such as DIGIBOOKS, DIGIZINES, DIGICARDS, DIGIMUSIC, DIGITV, DIGIMAPS, DIGISPACE  and DIGIMOVIE. DIGIBOOK is the key component of DIGILIB 3D and can be used in all other "DIGI" products and services. More on DIGIBOOK later..

This tsunami treasure chest of technology does NOT start off  in Silicon Valley, even though we strongly support the move by Facebook's Billionaire CEO Mark Zuckerberg to declare 2015  the "Year of  Books" as his New Year's resolution. Our Global DIGILIB 3D Team are the best Innovators of Things and have been involved in the "Decade of the DIGIBOOKS",

to digitally re-engineer and repurpose books, magazines, catalogs, greeting cards, encyclopedias  and newspapers to make them Socially Responsible, Environmentally Friendly, Economically Sustainable and Digitally Interactive (SEED).

This Digital Dollar Wave  does not even begin at the annual Consumer Electronics Show (CES 2015) in Las Vegas  with its entertaining evangelism of the Internet of Things, even though we have already been a few years into our Innovation Of Things such as the Digital Transformation of Encyclopedias into DIGIPEDIAs.

DIGITAL INTERACTIVE MULTIMEDIA TO MATCH THE MAGIC OF YOUR MIND !

It is virtually impossible to contain the excitement of a live event in any form of conventional media, or your ability to create sensational products or services that simply wows people. . But with DIGILIB 3D Innovation of Things, we have been able to build the right cognitive model to allow you to dive into digitally innovative creations such as TIMES SQ DIGIPEDIA  and experience the exhilaration of many of these Times Square monthly events . A DIGIPEDIA is mainly a  collection of DIGIBOOKS.

 

 WHAT IS  A DIGIBOOK 

Now let's explain what a DIGIBOOK really is in the following video. Take a look at the DIGIBOOK animation above before or after  you look at the video and you will see one of the best examples of the Digital Innovation of Things.

Each DIGIBOOK is a simulation of a real book that can be manipulated in 3D space with all degrees of rotation and perspective based on the readers point of view. E-books do not operate in a true 3D space . There are no spines, front edge, top edge,etc like real books. Pages actually turn in all directions and orientations, with the cognitive sound caused by the friction of paper on paper so realistic that the reader treats it like a  real book. But that is where the comparison stops. DIGIBOOKS go way beyond real books and e-Books, combining words, photos, videos, apps, embedded streaming or live video pages (.e.g YouTube and Vimeo), maps. calendars, weather reports,

illustrations, multilingual narrations, closed caption, audio, music, movies, Hollywood style dramatic Foley and Sound Effects, Objects for 3D Printing, Movies, Medical Images such as MRI, Sonograms and X-rays, TV Programs, Games, animations, maps and Business Tables or Graphs, links to other DIGIBOOKS or even to other websites and webpages. It can easily interface with existing social media based on their published API such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Google, etc. 

See the Video of a DIGIBOOK from  the Times Sq DIGIPEDIA in full action later.

 

 

But wait, don't forget the earth we live on. As more and more creative people move into the world's urban areas, the environment becomes even more important. Consequently, when you become a Member of the Digital 3D Interactive Library Network (DIGILIB 3D) you are helping to protect the planet.

For example we deliberately innovated Scratch off Cards like  the above Digital Scratch Off Library Membership Cards that do not use paper, foil or plastic; this is about saving trees and avoiding the use of fossil fuels used to make plastic and foil. At the same time the Digital Scratch Off Surface can be used to promote socially responsible causes, advertisements or charitable organizations. What an environmentally friendly way to advertise. As a DIGILIB 3D Member you are helping to fight Global Warming and the disastrous effects of Climate Change and at the same time promoting economic sustainability..

 Mother Nature says "Thank You" for that "Scratching Quarter" representing the 25 cents DIGILIB 3D will contribute to the development of  Renewable Energy and Wireless Access (Batteries, Solar, Wind, Mini-Hydro, Human Energy, WIFI) to make DIGIBOOKS, DIGIZINE, DIGITV, DIGICARDS, DIGIMED (Medical Services), DEAN (Digital Education Advancement Network),DIGIPEDIA's and other Digital Interactive Products available to communities in developing countries. These are communities  with  limitations in conserving their virgin forests and severe problems powering classrooms and computer networks... and even mobile devices..

You can even elevate your membership to be a DIGIBOOK PUBLISHER and  participate in the next and greatest generation of socio-economic development called Digital Interactive Social Publishing in the $400 Billion Global Publishing Industry. Using Digital Paper instead of printed paper, we can protect our environment even as we move quickly forward and integrate Social Responsibility, Environmental Friendliness, Economic Sustainability and Digital Innovation (SEED) at the core of Digital Product and Services...

A S.E.E.D DIGIBOOK VOLUME OF TIMES SQ DIGIPEDIA IN FULL ACTION.

Watch how the Same Opening Video can now be embedded in a Video Page of this DIGIBOOK Volume. It celebrates  the colorful creative climax of a  jam packed year in Times Square with over 300,000 daily pedestrians and 55 million annual visitors  who come from over 200 countries across the Globe. But we do not have to print 55 million copies of Magazines , Books or Brochures, avoiding the destruction of the rainforest just to create paper. Yes, this Digital Dollar Wave is all about YOU and how you can make, manage, market and monetize your Creativity or Innovation of Things in the Global Creative Economy.... but with sensitivities to the social, environmental and economic impact your participation can have. POSITIVE VIBRATIONS ALWAYS !


 DIGITALLY TRANSFORMING THE PEOPLE POWERED GLOBAL CREATIVE ECONOMY

 This $1.6 Trillion Global Creative Economy (GCE) is the largest and most lucrative untapped people powered industry in the world, stretching across communities, cities, countries, continents and cultures. It is ready for DIGITAL TRANSFORMATION.... not DISRUPTION !

This is mainly because other key global industries depend heavily on this Global Creative Economy  for their growth, our lifestyle and even our survival, such as: the priceless $5.5 Trillion Global Healthcare Industry, the $4.4 Trillion Global Education Industry,  $6 Trillion Global Travel & Tourism Industry,  the $5 Trillion Telecom Industry and the $1 Trillion Global Consumer Electronics Industry.

Therefore if you work in or support any of the following creative industries , you can now MAKE, MANAGE, MARKET and MONETIZE YOUR CREATIVITY with DIGILIB 3D: Digital Media, Publishing, Advertising, Broadcast Media, Print Media, Social Media, Tourism, Education, Game Design, Sports, Performing Arts, Visual Arts, Music, Film, Fashion, Photography, Industrial Design, Smart Phone  and Digital Tablet Design,  App Design,  Cultural Activities, Journalism, Toys, Culinary Arts, etc

Fortunately, you may already be a big part of  this lucrative global industry of innovators who, among other things,  help to produce, promote or profit from any creative combination of the following random examples: art for architecture, ads in apps, books with blogs, cakes and croissants, comics or cartoons,  dance for drama, drones over driveways, energy for education, jokes by  jugglers, jingles for jams, fabrics in fashion, hardware for homes, machines for manufacturing, maps with missions, music in movies, software as a service, sales graphs for sellers, photos by phones, theatre on TV, tourists in Times Square , videos going viral , watches on wrists or X-rays on Expressways.

THE INTERNET OF THINGS versus THE INNOVATION OF THINGS

 The Internet of Things is Device-Driven. The Innovation of Things is People Powered. The Innovators of Things are the ones who create the Internet of Things and know how to apply those things creatively to complement and supplement other Global Industries, including their own Global Creative Industries. .The CES 2015 in Las Vegas was dominated by both large and small companies evangelizing the use of tiny embedded devices with IP addresses that can communicate with other devices over the Internet (e.g. Heart Rate Monitors and Sensors, GPS Drones, Smart Hotel Security Doors). This phenomenon is collectively referred to as the Internet of Things.

In the  $1.6 Global Creative Economy,  incredible human minds can mix, match and merge  any combination of two or more elements of the above random examples to create new Innovations through the enhancement of current products and services provided by Creative Industries or invent millions of brand new ones. This is the transformation  we strategically refer as the Innovation of Things.

Unfortunately, you may also be among the millions of creative geniuses who have no clue as to how to convert that burning creativity in you into a sustainable livelihood, successful social entrepreneurship or DIGITAL CASH ! But there is hope.

DIGILIB 3D: THE NETWORK FOR THE DIGITAL TRANSFORMATION OF THE GLOBAL CREATIVE ECONOMY  To Make, Manage, Market & Monetize Your Creativity

The  Global Creative Economy (GCE) is a utility style economy like Energy, Power and Water  that empowers other multibillion dollar global industries to create jobs and business opportunities across the planet.

If you are like any of the persons or professionals depicted in this diagram below or work in related creative professions, you may already be a CORE CREATIVE CONTRIBUTOR or strategic INNOVATOR OF THINGS in  this money-making global economy which spreads across communities, cities, countries, continents and cultures.  Well, DIGILIB 3D is for YOU !

CORE CREATIVE CONTRIBUTORS AND INNOVATORS OF THINGS

  1. Educators , Students in the $4.4 Trillion Education Industry
  2. Journalists, Writers in the $400 Billion Publishing Industry
  3. Music/TV/Film Producers in the $4 Trillion Entertainment & Media Industry
  4. Fashion Designers in the $1.7 Trillion Fashion Industry
  5. 3D Designers and Modelers in the $10 Trillion Manufacturing Industry
  6. Video Game Designers in the $100 Billion Video Game Industry
  7. Software Developers in the $5 Trillion IT/Telecom Industry
  8. Travelers and Tourists in the $6 Trillion Tourism Industry
  9. Advertising Directors in the $500 Billion Advertising Industry
  10. Photographers in the $400 Billion Publishing Industry
  11. Others? WHAT IS DIGILIB 3D :  REVENUE ORIENTED DIGITAL 3D INTERACTIVE LIBRARY  NETWORKS TO DIGITALLY TRANSFORM THE $1.6 TRILLION GLOBAL CREATIVE ECONOMYWelcome to the Dawn of another Digital Dollar Wave. This one does not begin in Silicon Valley. Here's your chance to CONTRIBUTE to the launching of the world's first Digital Ecosystem designed to empower those creative geniuses such as Musicians, Moviemakers, Fashion Designers and Athletes who always seem to be left out of these Digital Revolutions. According to UNESCO's (United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization) latest Creative Economy Report "the global market value of the creative economy is approximately US$1.6 trillion". BEST OF BOTH DIGITAL WORLDSCONTRIBUTE with any of our DIGILIB 3D MEMBERSHIP PERKS (MEMBER, BRONZE, SILVER, GOLD, PLATINUM, BLACK) now and get a chance to upgrade to  our DUAL OS (ANDROID and WINDOWS) DIGITAL TABLET (DIGIPAD TV) that can run all DIGILIB 3D Interactive Visual Applications (DIVA) and over 2 million Android and Windows Apps combined, This includes popular apps such as YOUTUBE, SKYPE, FACEBOOK, TWITTER, INSTAGRAM, NETFLIX, HBO GO and GOOGLE MAPS, plus TV ANYWHERE Channels around the world.. DIGIPAD TV UPGRADE PERKs will be offered later on in this Campaign only to  those who Contributed via our various DIGILIB 3D Membership Card PERKS.This will be the best of both digital worlds and free access to DIGILIB 3D for at least 1 year . Enjoy tremendous $avings with  an opportunity to get 2 major OS platforms (Windows and Android) in one convenient Digital Tablet.This is one of our great Innovation of Things working with our DIGILIB 3D Global Partners.TIMES SQ: The Digital Urban Grand Canyon of Global Creativity.This Digital Dollar Wave starts right here  in Times SQ, NYC, the Digital Urban Grand Canyon of Global Creativity, as the Ball Drops to usher in a brand New Digital Year! What an incredible event as millions of spectators, dwarfed by humongous hills of Digital Advertising Displays click on their mobile devices to capture Manhattan's Multimedia Magic  bursting into fireworks 25 stories above.  Broadcasters from all over the world capture the moment, especially our excited  DIGILIB 3D Broadcaster from  the Swedish Creative Economy. What's the Global Creative Economy? It's the economy emanating from the making, management, marketing and monetization of books, broadcasting, music, photography, TV programs, advertising, visual arts, culinary arts, live entertainment, theater, movies, magazines, greeting cards, newspapers, fashion, tourism, smart phone design, video game design, 3D Printing, apps, wearables and most "things" our creative minds can conceive or innovate... such as the Internet of Things. DIGILIB 3D is  the Digital 3D Interactive Library designed to help you and other members of the Global Creative Economy,  MAKE, MANAGE, MARKET and MONETIZE  Creativity or the Digital  Innovation of Things ! In a realistic  simulation of a real life library, DIGILIB 3D uses core Digital Interactive Components such as DIGIBOOKS, DIGIZINES, DIGICARDS, DIGIMUSIC, DIGITV, DIGIMAPS, DIGISPACE  and DIGIMOVIE. DIGIBOOK is the key component of DIGILIB 3D and can be used in all other "DIGI" products and services. More on DIGIBOOK later..This tsunami treasure chest of technology does NOT start off  in Silicon Valley, even though we strongly support the move by Facebook's Billionaire CEO Mark Zuckerberg to declare 2015  the "Year of  Books" as his New Year's resolution. Our Global DIGILIB 3D Team are the best Innovators of Things and have been involved in the "Decade of the DIGIBOOKS", to digitally re-engineer and repurpose books, magazines, catalogs, greeting cards, encyclopedias  and newspapers to make them Socially Responsible, Environmentally Friendly, Economically Sustainable and Digitally Interactive (SEED). This Digital Dollar Wave  does not even begin at the annual Consumer Electronics Show (CES 2015) in Las Vegas  with its entertaining evangelism of the Internet of Things, even though we have already been a few years into our Innovation Of Things such as the Digital Transformation of Encyclopedias into DIGIPEDIAs.DIGITAL INTERACTIVE MULTIMEDIA TO MATCH THE MAGIC OF YOUR MIND !It is virtually impossible to contain the excitement of a live event in any form of conventional media, or your ability to create sensational products or services that simply wows people. . But with DIGILIB 3D Innovation of Things, we have been able to build the right cognitive model to allow you to dive into digitally innovative creations such as TIMES SQ DIGIPEDIA  and experience the exhilaration of many of these Times Square monthly events . A DIGIPEDIA is mainly a  collection of DIGIBOOKS.  WHAT IS  A DIGIBOOK Now let's explain what a DIGIBOOK really is in the following video. Take a look at the DIGIBOOK animation above before or after  you look at the video and you will see one of the best examples of the Digital Innovation of Things.Each DIGIBOOK is a simulation of a real book that can be manipulated in 3D space with all degrees of rotation and perspective based on the readers point of view. E-books do not operate in a true 3D space . There are no spines, front edge, top edge,etc like real books. Pages actually turn in all directions and orientations, with the cognitive sound caused by the friction of paper on paper so realistic that the reader treats it like a  real book. But that is where the comparison stops. DIGIBOOKS go way beyond real books and e-Books, combining words, photos, videos, apps, embedded streaming or live video pages (.e.g YouTube and Vimeo), maps. calendars, weather reports,  illustrations, multilingual narrations, closed caption, audio, music, movies, Hollywood style dramatic Foley and Sound Effects, Objects for 3D Printing, Movies, Medical Images such as MRI, Sonograms and X-rays, TV Programs, Games, animations, maps and Business Tables or Graphs, links to other DIGIBOOKS or even to other websites and webpages. It can easily interface with existing social media based on their published API such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Google, etc.  See the Video of a DIGIBOOK from  the Times Sq DIGIPEDIA in full action later.   But wait, don't forget the earth we live on. As more and more creative people move into the world's urban areas, the environment becomes even more important. Consequently, when you become a Member of the Digital 3D Interactive Library Network (DIGILIB 3D) you are helping to protect the planet.For example we deliberately innovated Scratch off Cards like  the above Digital Scratch Off Library Membership Cards that do not use paper, foil or plastic; this is about saving trees and avoiding the use of fossil fuels used to make plastic and foil. At the same time the Digital Scratch Off Surface can be used to promote socially responsible causes, advertisements or charitable organizations. What an environmentally friendly way to advertise. As a DIGILIB 3D Member you are helping to fight Global Warming and the disastrous effects of Climate Change and at the same time promoting economic sustainability.. Mother Nature says "Thank You" for that "Scratching Quarter" representing the 25 cents DIGILIB 3D will contribute to the development of  Renewable Energy and Wireless Access (Batteries, Solar, Wind, Mini-Hydro, Human Energy, WIFI) to make DIGIBOOKS, DIGIZINE, DIGITV, DIGICARDS, DIGIMED (Medical Services), DEAN (Digital Education Advancement Network),DIGIPEDIA's and other Digital Interactive Products available to communities in developing countries. These are communities  with  limitations in conserving their virgin forests and severe problems powering classrooms and computer networks... and even mobile devices..You can even elevate your membership to be a DIGIBOOK PUBLISHER and  participate in the next and greatest generation of socio-economic development called Digital Interactive Social Publishing in the $400 Billion Global Publishing Industry. Using Digital Paper instead of printed paper, we can protect our environment even as we move quickly forward and integrate Social Responsibility, Environmental Friendliness, Economic Sustainability and Digital Innovation (SEED) at the core of Digital Product and Services...A S.E.E.D DIGIBOOK VOLUME OF TIMES SQ DIGIPEDIA IN FULL ACTION.Watch how the Same Opening Video can now be embedded in a Video Page of this DIGIBOOK Volume. It celebrates  the colorful creative climax of a  jam packed year in Times Square with over 300,000 daily pedestrians and 55 million annual visitors  who come from over 200 countries across the Globe. But we do not have to print 55 million copies of Magazines , Books or Brochures, avoiding the destruction of the rainforest just to create paper. Yes, this Digital Dollar Wave is all about YOU and how you can make, manage, market and monetize your Creativity or Innovation of Things in the Global Creative Economy.... but with sensitivities to the social, environmental and economic impact your participation can have. POSITIVE VIBRATIONS ALWAYS ! DIGITALLY TRANSFORMING THE PEOPLE POWERED GLOBAL CREATIVE ECONOMY This $1.6 Trillion Global Creative Economy (GCE) is the largest and most lucrative untapped people powered industry in the world, stretching across communities, cities, countries, continents and cultures. It is ready for DIGITAL TRANSFORMATION.... not DISRUPTION !This is mainly because other key global industries depend heavily on this Global Creative Economy  for their growth, our lifestyle and even our survival, such as: the priceless $5.5 Trillion Global Healthcare Industry, the $4.4 Trillion Global Education Industry,  $6 Trillion Global Travel & Tourism Industry,  the $5 Trillion Telecom Industry and the $1 Trillion Global Consumer Electronics Industry. Therefore if you work in or support any of the following creative industries , you can now MAKE, MANAGE, MARKET and MONETIZE YOUR CREATIVITY with DIGILIB 3D: Digital Media, Publishing, Advertising, Broadcast Media, Print Media, Social Media, Tourism, Education, Game Design, Sports, Performing Arts, Visual Arts, Music, Film, Fashion, Photography, Industrial Design, Smart Phone  and Digital Tablet Design,  App Design,  Cultural Activities, Journalism, Toys, Culinary Arts, etcFortunately, you may already be a big part of  this lucrative global industry of innovators who, among other things,  help to produce, promote or profit from any creative combination of the following random examples: art for architecture, ads in apps, books with blogs, cakes and croissants, comics or cartoons,  dance for drama, drones over driveways, energy for education, jokes by  jugglers, jingles for jams, fabrics in fashion, hardware for homes, machines for manufacturing, maps with missions, music in movies, software as a service, sales graphs for sellers, photos by phones, theatre on TV, tourists in Times Square , videos going viral , watches on wrists or X-rays on Expressways.THE INTERNET OF THINGS versus THE INNOVATION OF THINGS The Internet of Things is Device-Driven. The Innovation of Things is People Powered. The Innovators of Things are the ones who create the Internet of Things and know how to apply those things creatively to complement and supplement other Global Industries, including their own Global Creative Industries. .The CES 2015 in Las Vegas was dominated by both large and small companies evangelizing the use of tiny embedded devices with IP addresses that can communicate with other devices over the Internet (e.g. Heart Rate Monitors and Sensors, GPS Drones, Smart Hotel Security Doors). This phenomenon is collectively referred to as the Internet of Things. In the  $1.6 Global Creative Economy,  incredible human minds can mix, match and merge  any combination of two or more elements of the above random examples to create new Innovations through the enhancement of current products and services provided by Creative Industries or invent millions of brand new ones. This is the transformation  we strategically refer as the Innovation of Things. Unfortunately, you may also be among the millions of creative geniuses who have no clue as to how to convert that burning creativity in you into a sustainable livelihood, successful social entrepreneurship or DIGITAL CASH ! But there is hope.DIGILIB 3D: THE NETWORK FOR THE DIGITAL TRANSFORMATION OF THE GLOBAL CREATIVE ECONOMY  To Make, Manage, Market & Monetize Your Creativity
The  Global Creative Economy (GCE) is a utility style economy like Energy, Power and Water  that empowers other multibillion dollar global industries to create jobs and business opportunities across the planet.
If you are like any of the persons or professionals depicted in this diagram below or work in related creative professions, you may already be a CORE CREATIVE CONTRIBUTOR or strategic INNOVATOR OF THINGS in  this money-making global economy which spreads across communities, cities, countries, continents and cultures.  Well, DIGILIB 3D is for YOU !

HOW TO MAKE MONEY WITH THE DIGITAL DOLLAR WAVE USING DIGILIB 3D. 
To make DIGILIB 3D economically sustainable and allow you to take advantage of this Creative Digital Dollar Wave wherever you are on the planet, our Digital Innovators of Things have deliberately engineered an overload of ways to generate  revenue for everyone involved with DIGILIB 3D, both consumers or providers.. THE DIGITAL DOLLAR WAVE: DRIVEN BY THE DIGITAL INNOVATION OF THINGSThis time the  Digital Dollar Wave is driven by the Digital Innovation of Things  gushing out  from this amazing Digital Urban Grand Canyon of Global Creativity: TIMES SQ , NYC.  It's all in out TIMES SQ DIGIPEDIA... so PERK yourself Up !It will show you how to MONETIZE Your Creativity with DIGILIB 3D, the Digital 3D Interactive Library Network for the Innovation of Things.  It does not matter where in this Digital World you want to innovate. Its actually a big advantage to the Global Creative Economy that DIGILIB 3D Innovation of Things starts right here in Times Square, New York... a world within a city.. To paraphrase Frank Sinatra's famous "New York, New York" song, If you can digitally MAKE it here, you can digitally MAKE it anywhere. Now it's up to YOU to do it quickly and easily by following our many DIGILIB 3D examples of Digital Interactive  Visual Appliances (DIVA) designed to convert your CREATIVITY to CASH ... but with built-in Social Responsibility , Environmental Friendliness, Economic Sustainability and Digital Interactivity. So start "spreading the news".THE BEST EXAMPLES OF GLOBAL CREATIVITY IN THE WORLD The Digital Innovation of Things is based on the timely and tactical application or  customization of information models, examples or patterns to create better and brand new products and services as quickly as possible. From Ball Drop 2014 to Ball Drop 2015, the DIGILIB 3D Production Team took an entire year to capture some of the most exciting digital videos and panoramic photos of entertaining events in this Digital Creative Convergence Zone also known as Times Square, America's #1 Tourist Destination . Times Square is a world within a city with over 55 million visitors a year   and  300,000 pedestrians a day from over 200 countries across the globe. Cultural festivals from China, India, South Korea, Brazil and other parts of the Americas occur regularly to complement daily  National TV Network  morning show productions by VH1 and ABC. A parade  of non-profit promotional events such as Climate Change marches, fight against cancer, summer street fairs, Broadway shows , NASDAQ IPO ceremonies and a host of national sports press events.Now we can use this valuable content  from 1/1/2014 to 1/1/2015 to create living examples of a series of Digitally Innovative  Multimedia Products based on DIGILIB 3D. This includes Digital Interactive Magazines (DIGIZINES), Digital  Interactive Books (DIGIBOOKS),Digital Interactive Encyclopedias (DIGIPEDIA), Digital Interactive Greeting Cards (DIGICARDS) and Digital Interactive TV (e.g.TIMES SQ DIGIPEDIA, TIMES SQ TV and FASHION AVE TV).  BRIDGING THE GAP BETWEEN CREATIVITY AND TECHNOLOGYNow you can bridge that gap between creativity and technology by using these examples to create digital interactive products so impressive the world will think you spent years at MIT after your PhD at Harvard, followed by a few successful start ups in Silicon Valley  and invested a few million dollars to pull it off.Fortunately for the Global Creative Community, the DIGILIB 3D Global Teams have had decades of experience working professionally in  both the Global Creative Economy as well as in the Global Information Technology Industry and understand the tremendous creative output that can be generated with the meeting of those 2 mindsets. That's what DIGILIB 3D does so very well.. DIGITAL SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITYIt is our Digital Social Responsibility  (DSR) to the Creative Community to digitally transform this $1.6 Trillion Global Creative Economy to make it  economically sustainable, environmentally friendly and socially responsible to  empower  new Digital Creative Entrepreneurs, Enterprises and Employees. This is the biggest untapped people powered industry in the world. We want it to be DIGITALLY TRANSFORMED.... NOT DISRUPTED. Too many people at the Bottom of the economic Pyramid (BOP) depend on these creative industries for their livelihood and it would be irresponsible to disrupt their income before elevating them to another level of economic sustainability. We all know what happened to both the Top of the Pyramid Executives of the Recording Music Industry as well those small BOP vendors who  provided so many community sales outlet for both established and unestablished music artists.THE DIGITAL LIBRARY INFORMATION MODEL (LIMO) DIGILIB 3D is based on simple , yet powerful, information management model you and billions of other  people around the world trust and have been using from childhood. Its already embedded in your intellect and memory whether you are "left brain" logical or right brain "creative". Luckily, this model will stay in your head forever and is actually used as an organizational pattern for  past, present and future knowledge acquisition through lifestyle, academic  and business experiences. We call this the Library Information Model  or the LIMO.  It's the one digital vehicle in which both the creative and non-creative people can ride with  the appreciation, if not understanding, of each other's role, responsibilities, risks and rewards. So why not use what you already have to get what you really want?LIMO: RIDING ON A MODEL OF SUCCESSJust think of the power of this simple LIMO model to change the world. It is the same Library Information Model that creative geniuses like Microsoft's Bill Gates and Apple's Steve Jobs depended on for research and knowledge acquisition before the Internet,  Search Engines , Online Databases, Desktops,  Laptops, Tablets or  Smart Phones to feed their hungry pioneering spirits. Not even a "CLOUD" in the Cyber Sky to obscure their nascent digital creativity that will one day change the world. With the type of  design, technical and business information they and their support teams found in public, private, academic and business libraries, they were able to make , manage, market and monetize the early Apple II and the Microsoft Disk Operating System for the IBM PC. So it was this same LIMO or Library Information Model that triggered a technology ripple in the  early 1980's  that has since mushroomed  into wave after wave of innovative consumer digital products and services such as MS Windows, XBOX, Microsoft Surface, Apple MacBook, iPhone, Ipad,iPhones, IOS, Facebook, Twitter, Amazon Kindle, Android, Samsung Galaxy  and many more over the years. LIMO: A FAST COMFORTABLE RIDE BACK TO THE DIGITAL URBAN  FUTURE.That was then. Now it's Back to the Future. Today over 80% of Americans now live in urban areas in cities such as New York City.  So too are urban areas in many countries around the world such as Japan, UK, Brazil and Canada (See report on Global Urbanization by the World Bank later). The oasis of knowledge, facts and information in these urban areas is still the Library: public, private, academic, research, law, business. Same Library Information Model you already understand. DIGILIB 3D: FOR A DYNAMIC NEW DIGITAL URBAN WORLD It is important to note that this latest Creative Digital Dollar Wave is also very URBAN. According to the World Bank over 75% of the respective populations of the USA (81%), UK (82%), Canada (81%), Japan (92%), South Korea (82%), Brazil (85%), Argentina (91%) , Belgium (98%) , Netherlands (89%) , Australia (89%), Mexico (79%), Germany (76%), France (79%) and Spain (79%)  are now living in urban areas (mainly cities, towns and the districts around them). The rest of the world , including China, is now over 53% urban and expanding rapidly  (Source: World Bank).  FROM THE LIMO TO DIGILIB 3D: A DIGITAL TRANSFORMATION OF AN INFORMATION MODEL YOU ALREADY UNDERSTAND AND TRUSTDIGILIB 3D is a realistic digital transformation of that trusted Library Information Model or LIMO. Yes, a Digital Immersive Simulation of the same Library you have been using since High School. DIGILIB 3D  is therefore the best Library Information Model  to handle the constant intellectual inflow and outflow of the Digital Global Creative Economy with multiple levels of local, regional and national customization. Great for Nation Branding  of the Creative Industries for both developed and developing countries.The following diagram shows how DIGILIB 3D can transform the lucrative global industries that depend on contributors from the Global Creative Economy into a formidable Revenue Oriented Digital Interactive Library Network for Everything... by Everyone Anywhere ... at Anytime using a well defined array of innovative Digital Interactive Visual Appliances (DIVA) and applications to MAKE, MANAGE, MARKET and MONETIZE creativity.

The main purpose for demonstrating our Digital Innovation of Things is to provide you with ideas as to what you too can do with DIGILIB 3D S.E.E.D components. Check out more of these PERKS later.CREATIVE CONTENT VALUE CHAIN: NEED FOR A REVENUE ORIENTED  MANAGEMENT METHODOLOGY .Low cost Digital Multimedia Technology fueled by billions of friends and followers  around the world on Social Media Networks fans  a raging fire of creativity in Music, Movies, Fashion, Food, Journalism, TV Production,Entertainment, Video Games, Photography, Desktop 3D Manufacturing, Advertising and  Publishing. Unfortunately, there are  no libraries on the planet (public, private, academic or business) that can contain this massive intellectual output.  Without a well defined  methodology  to move  from points A to B to C to D along the Creative Content Value Chain  it can never be transformed into the Digital Global Creative Economy.
