story:
Deuxième campagne Indiegogo / Second Campaign

Nous donnons suite à notre première campagne Indiegogo en Avril qui avait pour but de poser un plancher à notre nouveau Dojo. Mission accomplie ! Merci pour votre soutien ! Aujourd'hui comme annoncé, nous lançons une deuxième campagne pour financer les travaux restants : construire un vestiaire femme, un vestiaire homme, une douche, un deuxième sanitaire et équiper la salle.

We are pursuing our first Indiegogo campaign (last April), which purpose was to put a wooden floor in our new Dojo. Mission acomplished ! Thank you for your support ! Today, as we advertised, we are launching another campaign to fund the remaining work : building two locker rooms (for men and women), a shower block, a second toilet block, and purchasing furnitures for the main room.

Notre Projet / Our project

Nous ouvrons un Dojo d'arts martiaux internes à Loos, près de Lille (Nord de la France). Un Dojo est un lieu pour "trouver sa propre voie, l'étudier et la pratiquer". De manière originale, notre école réunira dans un même centre :

  • des cours et des stages de Kung-Fu Bagua Zhang, Xing Yi Quan, Qi Gong, Tai Ji Quan et Dao Yin pour enfants, jeunes et adultes.
  • des séances et ateliers de Shiatsu (thérapie manuelle et énergétique japonaise)
  • des stages pluridisciplinaires (calligraphie chinoise, yoga, etc.)
  • une bibliothèque de livres sur les arts énergétiques et martiaux
  • des conférences sur le Shiatsu, le Feng Shui, les médecines naturelles, etc.

  • des rencontres autour d'initiatives alternatives favorisant le respect de la Nature, de l'être humain et de sa santé

We are opening a martial arts Dojo in Loos, near Lille (north of France). A Dojo is a place to "find one's own path, study it and practice it". In an original way, our school will combine in the same place :

  • Classes and workshops about Kung-Fu Bagua Zhang, Xing Yi Quan, Qi Gong, Tai Ji Quan and Dao Yin for children, youngsters and adults.
  • Shiatsu sessions and workshop (hand and energetic japanese technique)
  • Multidisciplinary workshops (chinese calligraphy, yoga...)
  • A library of books about energetic and martial arts
  • Conferences about Shiatsu, Feng Shui, natural medicines...

  • Meetings to discuss alternative initiatives about respecting human beings, their health, and nature


Notre but / Our goal

"Un esprit sain dans un corps sain" !

Depuis 10 ans, notre école donne des clés pour développer un mode de vie plus équilibré et plus harmonieux. C'est essentiel pour les enfants, les jeunes et aussi pour les adultes dans la société actuelle !

Nous proposons une pratique de santé et/ou une pratique martiale. La base est commune : apprendre à habiter correctement son corps (ancrage, respiration, postures, détente), à retrouver une vraie souplesse dans le mouvement et à connaître son énergie pour la canaliser. La pratique permet de se découvrir et de développer certaines qualités (concentration, calme, confiance en soi, etc.).


"A healthy mind in a healthy body"

For 10 years now our school has been giving keys to develop a more balanced and harmonious lifestyle. It is essential for kids, teenagers and also adults in our society!

We propose a health practice as well as a martial one. They have a common basis : to learn to correctly inhabit one's body (rooting, breathing, postures, relaxation), to recover a real fluidity in motion and know one's energy to channel it. The practice allows one to discover oneself and develop some skills (concentration, calm, self-confidence...)


Nos besoins / What We Need

Nous avons trouvé un entrepôt de 200 m2 à louer. Il existe déjà deux pièces pour le Shiatsu et un sanitaire. Nous avons posé un plancher en Avril dans l'espace d'entraînement. Aujourd'hui nous avons besoin de financer la deuxième étape des travaux :

  • construire un vestiaire homme et un vestiaire femme
  • une douche,
  • un deuxième sanitaire
  •  équiper la salle (extincteurs, sac de frappe, etc.)

    Ces travaux sont estimés à 10 000 € et doivent être fait avant la rentrée (septembre 2015). Il restera encore 10 000 € à trouver pour finaliser les aménagements (achat et installation des chauffages, etc).

    We found a 200m² warehouse to rent. There are already two rooms for Shiatsu and a toilet room. In April, we put a wooden floor in the training space. Today we need to fund the second part of works :

    • Build a men's locker room and a women's one.
    • Build a shower block.
    • Build another toilets block.
    • Purchase furnitures for the main room (fire extinguishers, punching bags, etc)

    Those works were estimated at 10 000€ and must be done before september 2015. There will be yet another 10 000€ to find in order to be done with the fitting (purchase and set up the heaters etc.).


    L'école Arkhelios / Arkhelios School

    Notre école est animée depuis 2005 par une équipe de gens passionnés (professeurs, thérapeutes, étudiants). A travers tous nos projets, notre volonté est d'encourager les initiatives et activités qui respectent l'être humain, sa santé et la Nature. Nos fondations reposent sur certaines valeurs : courage, respect, persévérance, goût de l'effort, dépassement de soi, humilité, entraide, honnêteté. Website Arkhelios School

    Pourquoi être présent sur IndieGogo ?

    • Notre équipe est constituée de créatifs qui défendent des valeurs éthiques et l'économie solidaire. Notre vœu est d'être autonome grâce à notre activité et des aides amicales sans passer par des emprunts bancaires.

    • La campagne Indiegogo est un moyen de rencontrer des gens qui portent les mêmes valeurs que nous et de partager cette aventure innovante avec eux.

    • Nous n'avons pas de subventions et notre projet n'est pas commercial. Pour ne pas répercuter le coût des travaux sur les cotisations des pratiquants et garder les cours accessibles à tous, nous cherchons des financements privés et solidaires.


    Our school has been driven on since 2005 by a team of passionate people (professors, therapists, students). Through all our projects, our will is to encourage initiatives and activities which respect human beings, health and Nature. Our school is built on specific values : courage, respect, perseverance, enjoyment of hard work, overcoming of one's limits, humility, helpfulness, honesty.

    Why being on IndieGogo ?

    • Our team is composed of creative people who defend ethic values and solidary economy. Our wish is to be autonomous thanks to our activity and friendly helps, without resorting to bank loans.

    • The IndieGogo campaign is a way to meet people caring about the same values and to share this innovative adventure with them.

    • We have no subvention, and our project isn't a commercial one. In order not to inflate the subscriptions' costs to cover for the expenses and so keep our classes accessible to everyone, we are looking for private and supportive funding.


    Ce que vous recevrez / What you get ?

    En soutenant notre projet, vous contribuez à diffuser des disciplines essentielles qui aident l'être humain à développer sa noblesse, ses forces et à mettre en action ses idées. Elles aident à vivre plus pleinement sa vie ! 

    • En retour, nous vous enverrons nos remerciements personnalisés et des contreparties originales qui apportent de belles énergies et harmonisent !

    • Nous vous tiendrons au courant de chaque étape de cette nouvelle aventure via Indiegogo, Facebook et notre site internet - Website Arkhelios

    • Et nous espérons de tout coeur vous accueillir au Dojo ! Venez vous entraîner avec nous !

    Si nous n'atteignons pas complètement notre objectif, les fonds financeront dans tous les cas une partie du chantier de la création du Dojo et nous aurons le défi de chercher d'autres moyens pour continuer notre projet.

    By helping us, you contribute to spread essential disciplines which help human beings to develop their nobility, their strengths, and to put their ideas into action. They help to live one's life to the fullest !

    • In return, we will send you our personalized thanks and original goodies which brings good energies and harmony !

    • We will give you feedbacks during each step of this new adventure via IndieGogo, Facebook and our website. - Website Arkhelios

    • And with all our heart, we hope to welcome you at the Dojo ! Come and train with us !

    If we do not manage to reach our goal, the money will still be used to finance a part of the makeover and the Dojo creation, and then we will take on the challenge to find other ways to keep on with our project.


    Défis et avenir / Challenges and future

    Depuis des années, notre difficulté était de trouver des salles d'entraînement disponibles, suffisamment grandes et peu onéreuses. Le problème se posait chaque année. Dans notre région lilloise (Nord de la France) il y a un réel manque d'infrastructures par rapport aux besoins. Nous avons été obligé de limiter nos cours par manque de salles et d'espace. Depuis l'année dernière par exemple, nous organisons 5 cours par semaine dans une salle de 20 m2 (sans vestiaire) !

    • Grâce à ce Dojo de 100 m2, nous pourrons accueillir beaucoup plus de gens qui cherchent des activités complètes et enrichissantes
    • Nous pourrons proposer des activités tous les jours
    • Nous animerons des conférences, des discussions et des rencontres pour communiquer davantage sur ces disciplines passionnantes mais peu connues en Europe

    • Et nous offrirons d'excellentes conditions d'entraînement !

    For many years, our difficulty has been to find available training places, large enough and not too expensive. The problem presented itself every year. In our "région lilloise" (north of France), there is a real lack of buildings considering the need. We have been forced to limit our trainings by lack of training room and space. For example, since last year, we organize five classes a week in a 20m² training room (without locker-room).

    • With this 100m² Dojo, we will be able to welcome much more people who are looking for complete and rewarding activities.
    • We will be able to propose many activities every day.
    • We will organize conferences, talks and meetings to communicate more about those fascinating but little known disciplines in Europe.

    • And we will offer excellent training conditions !


    D'autres façons d'aider / Another way to help us

    Merci de parler de notre projet autour de vous ! Pour faire circuler ce message, vous pouvez utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo ou partager nos videos (1ère et 2ème campagne IndieGogo), page Facebook et site Internet.

    Merci ! Que la Force soit avec vous !

    Facebook Arkhelios - Website Arkhelios (french language)

    Make some noise about this campaign ! Please talk about our project around you ! To spread the message, you can use IndieGogo sharing tools, or share our videos (first and second IndieGogo campaign) , Facebook page and website.

    Thank you very much ! May the Force be with you !

    Facebook Arkhelios - Website Arkhelios (french language)
story_txt:
Deuxième campagne Indiegogo / Second Campaign

Nous donnons suite à notre première campagne Indiegogo en Avril qui avait pour but de poser un plancher à notre nouveau Dojo. Mission accomplie ! Merci pour votre soutien ! Aujourd'hui comme annoncé, nous lançons une deuxième campagne pour financer les travaux restants : construire un vestiaire femme, un vestiaire homme, une douche, un deuxième sanitaire et équiper la salle.



We are pursuing our first
Indiegogo campaign (last April), which purpose was to put a wooden
floor in our new Dojo.  Mission acomplished ! Thank you for your
support ! Today, as we advertised, we are launching another
campaign to fund the remaining work : building two locker rooms
(for men and women), a shower block, a second toilet block, and
purchasing furnitures for the main room.


Notre
Projet / Our project
Nous ouvrons un Dojo d'arts martiaux internes à Loos,
près de Lille (Nord de la France). Un Dojo est un lieu pour
"trouver sa propre voie, l'étudier et la pratiquer". De
manière originale, notre école réunira dans un même centre :


des cours et des
	stages de Kung-Fu Bagua Zhang, Xing Yi Quan, Qi Gong, Tai Ji Quan et
	Dao Yin pour enfants, jeunes et adultes.


des séances et
	ateliers de Shiatsu (thérapie manuelle et énergétique
	japonaise) 
	


des stages pluridisciplinaires
	(calligraphie chinoise, yoga, etc.) 


une bibliothèque de livres sur
	les arts énergétiques et martiaux 
	


des conférences sur le Shiatsu,
	le Feng Shui, les médecines naturelles, etc. 
	
	

des rencontres autour d'initiatives
	alternatives favorisant le respect de la Nature, de l'être humain
	et de sa santé






We are opening a martial arts Dojo in Loos, near Lille
(north of France). A Dojo is a place to "find one's own
path, study it and practice it". In an original way, our school
will combine in the same place :


Classes and workshops about
	Kung-Fu Bagua Zhang, Xing Yi Quan, Qi Gong, Tai Ji Quan and Dao Yin for children, youngsters and adults.

 
	


Shiatsu sessions and workshop
	(hand and energetic japanese technique)


Multidisciplinary workshops
	(chinese calligraphy, yoga...) 
	


A library of books about energetic
	and martial arts 
	


Conferences about Shiatsu, Feng
	Shui, natural medicines... 
	


Meetings to discuss alternative initiatives about respecting
	human beings, their health, and nature 
	



Notre but / Our goal
"Un esprit sain dans un corps sain" !

Depuis 10 ans, notre école donne des clés pour
développer un mode de vie plus équilibré et plus harmonieux. C'est
essentiel pour les enfants, les jeunes et aussi pour les adultes dans
la société actuelle !
Nous proposons une pratique de santé et/ou une
pratique martiale. La base est commune : apprendre à habiter
correctement son corps (ancrage, respiration, postures, détente), à
retrouver une vraie souplesse dans le mouvement et à connaître son
énergie pour la canaliser. La pratique permet de se découvrir et de
développer certaines qualités (concentration, calme, confiance en
soi, etc.).



"A healthy mind in a healthy body"

For
10 years now our school has been giving keys to develop a more
balanced and harmonious lifestyle. It is essential for kids,
teenagers and also adults in our society! 

We propose a health practice as well as a martial
one. They have a common basis : to learn to correctly inhabit one's
body (rooting, breathing, postures, relaxation), to recover a real
fluidity in motion and know one's energy to channel it. The practice
allows one to discover oneself and develop some skills
(concentration, calm, self-confidence...)
Nos besoins / What We Need
Nous avons trouvé un entrepôt de 200 m2 à louer.
Il existe déjà deux pièces pour le Shiatsu et un sanitaire.
Nous avons posé un plancher en Avril dans l'espace d'entraînement. Aujourd'hui nous avons besoin de financer la deuxième étape des travaux :

construire un vestiaire homme et un vestiaire femme

une douche, 

un deuxième sanitaire

 équiper la salle (extincteurs, sac de frappe, etc.) 
	





Ces travaux sont estimés à 10 000
€ et doivent être fait avant la rentrée (septembre 2015). Il restera encore 10 000 € à trouver pour finaliser les aménagements (achat et installation des chauffages, etc).





We found a 200m² warehouse to rent. There
are already two rooms for Shiatsu and a toilet room. In April, we put
a wooden floor in the training space. Today we need to fund the
second part of works :

Build a men's locker room and a women's
one.
Build a shower block.

Build another toilets block.
Purchase furnitures for the main room (fire extinguishers, punching bags, etc)


Those works were estimated at 10 000€ and
must be done before september 2015. There will be yet another 10 000€ to find in order to be done with the fitting (purchase and set up the heaters etc.).

L'école Arkhelios / Arkhelios
School
Notre école est animée depuis 2005 par une équipe
de gens passionnés (professeurs, thérapeutes, étudiants). A
travers tous nos projets, notre volonté est d'encourager les
initiatives et activités qui respectent l'être humain, sa santé et
la Nature. Nos fondations reposent sur certaines valeurs : courage,
respect, persévérance, goût de l'effort, dépassement de soi,
humilité, entraide, honnêteté. Website
Arkhelios School

Pourquoi être présent sur IndieGogo ?


Notre équipe est
	constituée de créatifs qui défendent des valeurs éthiques et
	l'économie solidaire. Notre vœu est d'être autonome grâce à
	notre activité et des aides amicales sans passer par des emprunts
	bancaires. 
	




La campagne Indiegogo est un moyen de
	rencontrer des gens qui portent les mêmes valeurs que nous et de
	partager cette aventure innovante avec eux. 
	

Nous n'avons pas de subventions et notre projet n'est pas commercial. Pour ne pas répercuter le coût des travaux sur les cotisations des pratiquants et garder les cours accessibles à tous, nous cherchons des financements privés et solidaires.





Our school has been driven on since 2005 by a team
of passionate people (professors, therapists, students). Through all
our projects, our will is to encourage initiatives and activities
which respect human beings, health and Nature. Our school is built on
specific values : courage, respect, perseverance, enjoyment of hard
work, overcoming of one's limits, humility, helpfulness, honesty.


Why being on IndieGogo ?


Our team is composed
	of creative people who defend ethic values and solidary economy. Our
	wish is to be autonomous thanks to our activity and friendly helps,
	without resorting to bank loans. 
	


The IndieGogo campaign is a way to meet people
	caring about the same values and to share this innovative adventure
	with them.

We have no subvention,
	and our project isn't a commercial one. In order not to inflate the
	subscriptions' costs to cover for the expenses and so keep our
	classes accessible to everyone, we are looking for private and
	supportive funding.


Ce que vous recevrez / What you get
?
En soutenant notre projet, vous contribuez à
diffuser des disciplines essentielles qui aident l'être humain à
développer sa noblesse, ses forces et à mettre en action ses idées.
Elles aident à vivre plus pleinement sa vie ! 


En retour, nous vous
	enverrons nos remerciements personnalisés et des contreparties
	originales qui apportent de belles énergies et harmonisent !


Nous vous tiendrons
	au courant de chaque étape de cette nouvelle aventure via
	Indiegogo, Facebook et notre site internet - Website
	Arkhelios


Et nous espérons de tout coeur vous accueillir
	au Dojo ! Venez vous entraîner avec nous !


Si nous n'atteignons pas complètement notre
objectif, les fonds financeront dans tous les cas une partie du
chantier de la création du Dojo et nous aurons le défi de chercher
d'autres moyens pour continuer notre projet.
By helping us, you contribute to spread
essential disciplines which help human beings to develop their
nobility, their strengths, and to put their ideas into action. They
help to live one's life to the fullest !


In return, we will
	send you our personalized thanks and original goodies which brings
	good energies and harmony ! 
	


We will give you
	feedbacks during each step of this new adventure via IndieGogo,
	Facebook and our website. - Website
	Arkhelios


And with all our heart, we hope to welcome you
	at the Dojo ! Come and train with us ! 
	


If we do not manage to reach our goal, the money
will still be used to finance a part of the makeover and the Dojo
creation, and then we will take on the challenge to find other ways
to keep on with our project.



Défis et avenir / Challenges and future 

Depuis des années, notre difficulté était de
trouver des salles d'entraînement disponibles, suffisamment grandes
et peu onéreuses. Le problème se posait chaque année. Dans notre
région lilloise (Nord de la France) il y a un réel manque
d'infrastructures par rapport aux besoins. Nous avons été obligé
de limiter nos cours par manque de salles et d'espace. Depuis l'année
dernière par exemple, nous organisons 5 cours par semaine dans une
salle de 20 m2 (sans vestiaire) !


Grâce à ce Dojo de 100 m2,
	nous pourrons accueillir beaucoup plus de gens qui cherchent des
	activités complètes et enrichissantes

Nous pourrons proposer des
	activités tous les jours

Nous animerons des
	conférences, des discussions et des rencontres pour communiquer
	davantage sur ces disciplines passionnantes mais peu connues en
	Europe 
	


Et nous offrirons d'excellentes conditions d'entraînement ! 
	







For many years, our difficulty has been to find
available training places, large enough and not too expensive. The
problem presented itself every year. In our "région lilloise"
(north of France), there is a real lack of buildings considering the
need. We have been forced to limit our trainings by lack of training
room and space. For example, since last year, we organize five
classes a week in a 20m² training room (without locker-room).


With this 100m² Dojo, we
	will be able to welcome much more people who are looking for
	complete and rewarding activities. 
	

We will be able to propose many
	activities every day.

We will organize conferences,
	talks and meetings to communicate more about those fascinating but
	little known disciplines in Europe.


And we will offer excellent training conditions !



D'autres façons d'aider / Another way to help us
Merci de parler de notre projet autour de vous !
Pour faire circuler ce message, vous pouvez utiliser les outils
de partage Indiegogo ou partager nos videos (1ère et 2ème campagne IndieGogo), page Facebook et site
Internet.
Merci ! Que la Force soit avec vous !
Facebook
Arkhelios - Website
Arkhelios (french language)

project around you ! To spread the message, you can use IndieGogo
sharing tools, or share our videos (first and second IndieGogo
campaign)
, Facebook page and website.
Thank you very much ! May the Force be with
you !

story:
CAMPAIGN UPDATE: 
Great news! We've raised enough to launch a limited beta version in late October to help this year's seniors with application deadlines in December and January. 

If kids want to get into their first choice college, they need to write really good essays.

That's why we're building Essay Mentors Online.  

Erastus wasn’t going to get into his favorite college until he learned how to write a great essay. 

He’s the kind of kid top colleges are scrambling for. He came to Lynn, a struggling city outside of Boston, from Kenya. His father had died when he was twelve; his mother had cancer. And despite these challenges,  Erastus was a great student, had a positive outlook on life, and cared deeply about  people.  

Yes, he’d faced significant challenges. Yes, he’d overcome adversity and developed a positive, empowering attitude in the process. Yes, it was clear he was an intelligent, capable student. 

But his essay was a bit of a downer. 

In telling his story, he fell into several of the many common essay traps that can keep kids from college.

Using what he learned with Essay Mentors, Erastus found a better way to share his story. Ultimately, in the essay he submitted, his love of art, his role in his community, his creativity and his desire to contribute all shine through.

And because of that essay, Erastus had his choice of some of the most selective colleges in the country. He will be a sophomore this fall at Tufts University. 

We're launching Essay Mentors Online this fall so that every high school student—maybe even yours—can write a great essay. Just like Erastus did.




For some kids, college is a done deal; for many, many more it’s a stretch. A thoughtful, quality personal essay can be the key to college admissions, merit scholarships, and financial aid. 

Over a million kids a year write college essays. Most of those essays don't help; only a handful of fortunate students get effective support or feedback. Erastus got that support through an Essay Mentors pilot program at RAW Art Works..



Essay Mentors helps students from all walks of life write better college essays, essays that help them compete and get accepted into the colleges where they can thrive. 

Last year we mentored 150 students, but with your help, we'll be able to launch our online program this fall and grow the number of schools and nonprofits we can train in our process. 

 


Essay Mentors Online is a virtual mentor that guides kids through our teen-tested, college acceptance-proven process. For the first time, every  high school student will have the opportunity to compete with their best college essay.   

(Don't know what makes a great college essay? We have plenty of them on our website. They're engaging, entertaining and profound short stories that reveal wonderful aspects of these teenagers.)  

Our goal this year is to help 1,000 high school students write better college essays. And, we'll train 60 teachers and volunteers to support kids in schools and nonprofits.  We're laying the foundation to help more than 100,000 kids in the next 5 years. 


Schools and nonprofit organizations from the Northeast to the Northwest are seeking us out. We’ve led free workshops in the Seattle area for more than 1,400 students and parents. This year we're doing a pilot project in Norwalk, Connecticut. Forty of their volunteer mentors and teachers are being trained in our process, and 600 seniors will be writing better essays. We’re also partnering with the Issaquah Schools Foundation and other nonprofits to develop and expand our pilot programs.

In July we're going back to Lynn, Massachusetts for a third year in a row. We'll lead workshops for students from three nonprofits and will train volunteer mentors to support them through the process. 

 


What We Need

In this first stage, we need $25,000 to build the beta version of Essay Mentors Online and to conduct mentor and teacher training in partner locations throughout the country.

When we exceed that goal, we will extend our reach even farther (and we are poised and ready to go).



Why do we need this money?

First, we need to build the online application. The content, the process, our proven system is ready to go, we just need to hire the programmers to build out the back-end, so we can launch the program this fall for the hundreds of kids already lining up for it.

The more funds we bring in, the more we can do. Meeting our $25,000 goal will set us up to expand from 1,000 kids this year to 100,000 in the next 5 years.



We’re a social purpose corporation, and the purpose in our charter is to help kids from at-risk, disadvantaged, or under-served populations get into college. By joining the campaign you’re supporting that mission.

And, we are already working with partners to help us leverage our resources. Your donation will fund staffing, research, and travel to work with our partner organizations, building a powerful nationwide network to bring this work to where the kids need it most.

This is a great way to support your high school student if you have one, and other teenagers if you don’t. Either way, you’re helping build the future of deserving kids.


Beyond money— we need your help spreading the word

At its heart, Essay Mentors is about students exploring who they are, telling their stories, and having more and better options for college and beyond. 

Ways you can help:

  • Let high school students or their parents know about Essay Mentors--they'll thank you for it.

  • Spread the word about this campaign on Facebook.

  • Share our information with a local high school, non-profit, school foundation or PTA.

  • Stay connected. Follow Essay Mentors on Facebook and on Twitter to receive information about the college process, writing and more.


Recognizing your generosity. Thank you!

The work we do touches students’ lives in a meaningful way. Every dollar you give touches student's lives. We thank you, and so do the students.


Perks and Programs for Students and Adults

Class of 2016 Personal Mentoring

Our full program is not available through the campaign, but the three-session Become a Better Writer package could be perfect (the description is below). 

Learn more about the full program for seniors at our website or email Barak.


The eBook Package

  • BRAND U: 4 Steps to the College of Your Dreams . In this excellent book, college admissions adviser David Montesano shows you exactly how to position yourself as the kind of applicant colleges are eager to admit. Learn more about David at College Match.  
  • The Curious Person's Alternative to Time Management. Essay Mentors Barak Rosenbloom and Leisa Ashbaugh co-authored this 74-page ebook because people told us they wanted to do a better job of getting stuff done, to focus on what’s meaningful to them, and to have the freedom to enjoy the things they’re doing now. Perfect for high school and college students as well as adults.

Essay Mentors Online (Beta in fall 2015)

Essay Mentors Online is a virtual mentor, simulating the process we take students through one-on-one. It helps students explore their strengths and stories, and write them in their own voices. The smart wizard asks students questions about where they are, and then gives them the guidance or the activities they need at that moment. Essay Mentors Online also encourages and provides the built-in structure for students to get support and feedback from people in their community--family, friends, teachers or a mentor, all in a fun and easy to use online platform.
The beta version will have all of the guidance students need to write better essays beginning in September 2015. Over the following months we will be adding more functions, including the ability to write in the program; interactivity with mentors, family and friends; essay project tracking; and more.

  • $125  A subscription to Essay Mentors Online.
  • $225  A subscription plus four written milestone reviews by one of our senior mentors. These keep students focused, and make sure they don't progress until they have content or ideas that will result in an effective essay.
  • $500  A subscription and milestone reviews, plus four thirty-minute video or phone mentoring sessions with one of our senior mentors. Usually students have one session for each of the four phases of our process.

College Counseling Session with Bob Sprung (Seattle area)

Bob Sprung has the benefit of having worked with college bound students for nearly 20 years as both a college admission representative and high school college counselor. He was an admissions counselor for nearly 15 years and last served as the senior associate director of admissions at Duquesne University in Pittsburgh, PA. In his first year as an independent college consultant, Bob is one of the most experienced counselors in the Puget Sound region.

Visit Sprung College Counseling to learn more about Bob.


The Become a Better Writer Program (Teens or Adults)

Our college essay students discover that writing becomes easier, more natural and more enjoyable. Plus, they become writers! Whatever kind of writer you are, we can help you discover how to become more effective and efficient, and how to bring the quality of your writing to a new level. This is perfect for anyone in the seventh grade through adulthood. It can also be used by students writing college essays.


Essay Mentors for Grownups 

Over the years we've had adults ask, hey, can I go through your program? Well, now you can! Over the course of eight sessions, you'll go through the process our students use--you'll discover strengths you maybe never realized were there. You'll tell your story, and own your story in a new way. And, you'll become a much better writer in the process. Oh, we'll have a lot of fun as well!

 

Unlimited Essay Mentoring Program for a Student in the Class of 2017 

Our unlimited program includes all the support students needs to write any number of college or scholarship essays. To learn more about our program, please visit our website.


The Claymore 13" Laptop Bag 

We love the Claymore! Made by Combat Flip Flops, another Issaquah company out to do good in the world, the Claymore is perfect for 13" laptops and an amazing amount of other stuff. It seems to be bottomless. Choose your color, and we'll add our logo. This is a very limited edition item! 


Essay Mentors in the Press

Issaquah Press: Honors in excellence — Chamber of commerce pays tribute to top community contributions

Puget Sound Business Journal: The Pitch: Need help writing that college essay? These Mentors can help

The Issaquah Press: Getting students on the ‘write’ path to college

GeekWire: This startup wants to help high schoolers write a great college entrance essay

TechCrunch: Meet The Pitch-Off Winners Of The Austin And Seattle Meetups


Frequently Asked Questions

Are you a non-profit?  Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?
No. Essay Mentors is a for-profit corporation and your contribution is not tax deductible.

How will the funds be used?
After paying the service fee for Indiegogo, we will be putting all of the funds raised up to $25,000 towards building the beta version of Essay Mentors Online. Beyond that, If we go beyond that goal, we will assess how best to use the funds to build out the program and support more students over the coming year.

Can I donate from outside the USA?
Absolutely! Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards, not bank or debit cards. We also accept PayPal which will give you more options.

What payment methods do you accept?
Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.

Is shipping included?
Yup.

Does international shipping cost extra?
Yes, but Indiegogo doesn’t allow us to add any extra shipping to the perks, so it is included in the suggested donation price.

I have more questions. Who do I ask?
Please visit http://www.essaymentors.com/contact-us/ to ask your question. We’ll get back to you as soon as we can.

you don’t. Either way, you’re helping build the future of deserving kids.



Beyond money— we need your help spreading the word
At its heart, Essay Mentors is about students exploring who they are, telling their stories, and having more and better options for college and beyond. 
Ways you can help:

Let high school students or their parents know about Essay Mentors--they'll thank you for it.
Spread the word about this campaign on Facebook.
Share our information with a local high school, non-profit, school foundation or PTA.
Stay connected. Follow Essay Mentors on Facebook and on Twitter to receive information about the college process, writing and more.




Recognizing your generosity. Thank you!

The work we do touches students’ lives in a meaningful way. Every dollar you give touches student's lives. We thank you, and so do the students.



Perks and Programs for Students and Adults



Class of 2016 Personal Mentoring
Our full program is not available through the campaign, but the three-session Become a Better Writer package could be perfect (the description is below). 
Learn more about the full program for seniors at our website or email Barak.

The eBook Package



BRAND U: 4 Steps to the College of Your Dreams . In this excellent book, college admissions adviser David Montesano shows you exactly how to position yourself as the kind of applicant colleges are eager to admit. Learn more about David at College Match.  

The Curious Person's Alternative to Time Management. Essay Mentors Barak Rosenbloom and Leisa Ashbaugh co-authored this 74-page ebook because people told us they wanted to do a better job of getting stuff done, to focus on what’s meaningful to them, and to have the freedom to enjoy the things they’re doing now. Perfect for high school and college students as well as adults.

Essay Mentors Online (Beta in fall 2015)

Essay Mentors Online is a virtual mentor, simulating the process we take students through one-on-one. It helps students explore their strengths and stories, and write them in their own voices. The smart wizard asks students questions about where they are, and then gives them the guidance or the activities they need at that moment. Essay Mentors Online also encourages and provides the built-in structure for students to get support and feedback from people in their community--family, friends, teachers or a mentor, all in a fun and easy to use online platform.
The beta version will have all of the guidance students need to write better essays beginning in September 2015. Over the following months we will be adding more functions, including the ability to write in the program; interactivity with mentors, family and friends; essay project tracking; and more.




$125  A subscription to Essay Mentors Online.

$225  A subscription plus four written milestone reviews by one of our senior mentors. These keep students focused, and make sure they don't progress until they have content or ideas that will result in an effective essay.

$500  A subscription and milestone reviews, plus four thirty-minute video or phone mentoring sessions with one of our senior mentors. Usually students have one session for each of the four phases of our process.




College Counseling Session with Bob Sprung (Seattle area)
Bob Sprung has the benefit of having worked with college bound students for nearly 20 years as both a college admission representative and high school college counselor. He was an admissions counselor for nearly 15 years and last served as the senior associate director of admissions at Duquesne University in Pittsburgh, PA. In his first year as an independent college consultant, Bob is one of the most experienced counselors in the Puget Sound region.


Visit Sprung College Counseling to learn more about Bob.



The Become a Better Writer Program (Teens or Adults)
Our college essay students discover that writing becomes easier, more natural and more enjoyable. Plus, they become writers! Whatever kind of writer you are, we can help you discover how to become more effective and efficient, and how to bring the quality of your writing to a new level. This is perfect for anyone in the seventh grade through adulthood. It can also be used by students writing college essays.


Essay Mentors for Grownups 
Over the years we've had adults ask, hey, can I go through your program? Well, now you can! Over the course of eight sessions, you'll go through the process our students use--you'll discover strengths you maybe never realized were there. You'll tell your story, and own your story in a new way. And, you'll become a much better writer in the process. Oh, we'll have a lot of fun as well!
 
Unlimited Essay Mentoring Program for a Student in the Class of 2017 
Our unlimited program includes all the support students needs to write any number of college or scholarship essays. To learn more about our program, please visit our website.

The Claymore 13" Laptop Bag 
We love the Claymore! Made by Combat Flip Flops, another Issaquah company out to do good in the world, the Claymore is perfect for 13" laptops and an amazing amount of other stuff. It seems to be bottomless. Choose your color, and we'll add our logo. This is a very limited edition item! 



Essay Mentors in the Press

Issaquah Press: Honors in excellence — Chamber of commerce pays tribute to top community contributions
Puget Sound Business Journal: The Pitch: Need help writing that college essay? These Mentors can help
The Issaquah Press: Getting students on the ‘write’ path to college
GeekWire: This startup wants to help high schoolers write a great college entrance essay
TechCrunch: Meet The Pitch-Off Winners Of The Austin And Seattle Meetups

Frequently Asked Questions
Are you a non-profit?  Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?No. Essay Mentors is a for-profit corporation and your contribution is not tax deductible.
How will the funds be used?After paying the service fee for Indiegogo, we will be putting all of the funds raised up to $25,000 towards building the beta version of Essay Mentors Online. Beyond that, If we go beyond that goal, we will assess how best to use the funds to build out the program and support more students over the coming year.

Can I donate from outside the USA?Absolutely! Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards, not bank or debit cards. We also accept PayPal which will give you more options.
What payment methods do you accept?Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.
Is shipping included?Yup.
Does international shipping cost extra?Yes, but Indiegogo doesn’t allow us to add any extra shipping to the perks, so it is included in the suggested donation price.
I have more questions. Who do I ask?Please visit http://www.essaymentors.com/contact-us/ to ask your question. We’ll get back to you as soon as we can.

story:
WHO ARE WE?

We are retired educators with experience teaching in the U.S., Taiwan, and Honduras, specializing in innovative teaching methods. We founded Activiteca in Honduras in 2002, as volunteers.  For 11 years we operated our Activiteca center in temporary locations, specializing in STEM and thinking skills, while growing the materials collection that is at the heart of the operation. We now have Activiteca installed in two vocational schools in the department of Yoro.   

Both these schools are now at risk of closing due to excessive electrical expenses.  We need your help to make them STAY OPEN WITH  SOLAR!

     Archie Gress and Joan  Penzenstadler with local youth volunteers after an Activiteca fair at Funadeh in Chamelecon, San Pedro Sula, in 2008.

ENDANGERED SPECIES: TWO VOCATIONAL SCHOOLS FOR THE UNDERSERVED   

Honduras has some pretty alarming statistics:

  • Half the population lives (!) on less than $4 a day.
  • Half of the students leave school before reaching 6th grade.
  • The major city, San Pedro Sula, is known as the “Murder Capital” of the world.

Along with a corrupt government, a sluggish economy (except for the drug trade), and gangs, it's no wonder a disproportionate number of young Hondurans risk their lives on the dangerous route to the U.S.


Young Hondurans need more opportunities at home in Honduras!  We have located our Activiteca programs in Centro Tecnico Nazaret, in Urraco, and Centro Tecnico Loyola, in El Progreso (see stars on map above). These schools have vocational and academic classes for students who've missed out on other schooling.  Activiteca's STEM materials and activities boost the students' learning, and the Activiteca coordinators organize learning fairs and services for the public, and even offer training to local teachers.

     Children launch paper parachutes from the second floor balcony at Nazaret  technical school, during an Activiteca fair for local public school children.

A DARK FUTURE
Now the schools are threatened with extinction. 

Honduras' government-run power company has been killing the schools' budgets with electric bills, both current and backlog. 

The schools use their workshops to create income, especially from carpentry and welding, both involving major electric equipment.  They're in a Catch-22 situation where reducing electricity use makes it harder to pay for.  

These schools are for the poor, so tuition is low.  Despite the fact that the vocational schools are an antidote to poverty and crime, the national electric utility won't give them reduced rates.  

The international umbrella organization, Fe y Alegria, stretched thin over all of Latin America, provides the schools limited financial support, but nothing for salaries.

Shutting down Loyola and Nazaret would mean turning nearly a thousand students out onto the streets, to face a bleak future with only bad options. 


HERE COMES THE SUN

 The best solution for this emergency is: reduce the bills by GOING SOLAR!

Help is at hand: A U.S.-based solar energy company with branches in Honduras, named Soluz, Inc., is prepared to install at each school a system of rooftop solar panels that can dramatically cut the cost of electricity.  We want to start now to buy the equipment, so most of this campaign is for those funds. When we finish this campaign we will start a second one, to get at least one complete solar energy system into each school this year.  These installations will send electricity into the grid and immediately begin cutting the bills.  We will add more campaigns and panels as needed until electric power is no longer a black hole in the budget!  

   An example of Soluz.inc work: a rooftop solar installation on a school in La Ceiba.


What do We Need  and What do You Get? 

We need: 

For the start-up purchases of solar energy equipment: $16,000

Salary supplements for two Activiteca STEM coordinators:  $4000

(If we reach our goal of $20,000 before the deadline and continue into "In Demand," the added funds will continue in both categories.  We will keep no funds out for ourselves.)

In our next campaign we will focus on finishing for each school at least 1 “block” (a complete solar electric system) with 40 solar panels, generating 10kW per month, reducing the monthly bill by about $325.  One block's total cost is between $32,000 and $35,000.   If a school gets 4 blocks—40kW—their bill is cut by $1,300 per month. You can see that more campaigns will be needed in the future, unless we get a really enormous response in these first two campaigns.

You get:

  • The thrill of helping hundreds, and soon thousands, of kids and adults to broaden their scientific and mathematical understanding of the universe, and enjoy it.
  • The excitement of being a partner in launching pioneer projects in an area of the world that cries out for solutions. These schools will become leaders, not only in their role as STEM promoters, but also as examples of how solar technology creates not only power but jobs.  They can help Honduras move faster to alternative energy.
  • The realization that it's YOU who make it possible for helping these neglected places step forward into the sunlight!
  • And of course there's the perks that give you a chance for more direct encounters with the people you're helping.

How Else Can You Help? 

Urge others to donate to this and our next campaign.

Send us useful information, especially in Spanish, about conserving electricity and maximizing the uses of solar energy, that we can share with the schools.

Send us ideas for ways the schools can create more income locally.

Be a volunteer, or recruit one, to come down and bring interesting skills to the schools and Activiteca programs, or help with the solar project.  Visit our web site for more information.

“Adopt” a program or a class that you or your group will support over a specified period of time.  Especially, we need right away a support group to provide funds during the school year (Feb. to Nov.) for a nutrition program of snacks and lunches for the many students who come to school hungry.  Not much gets learned on an empty stomach.  See our web site for more information.

story:
Love is Blind, at least for a while in a new dating relationship. Just when you think you have met the man or woman of your dreams, the "rose-colored glasses" become clear when you begin to see the "flaws" or "red flags" in your partner; perhaps you are dating and unhealthy partner?  Our program was designed, by Dr. John Van Epp, to educate singles and singles-again on how to avoid dating and marrying an unhealthy partner. This is accomplished by showing singles how to build a relationship in a safe way, and in a way that you can really get to know the key areas of your partner so you won't have any surprises if you marry them. Love engages the Mind as will as the Heart. The overall goals of our partner selection program fall into two categories:  Exploring the crucial areas that predict marital satisfaction and Examining how to pace a growing attachment in a dating relationship.
I am a certified instructor of the PICK-A-Partner program, an empirically validated course for singles to follow in building healthy, safe dating relationships and in choosing a marriage partner. My goal is to make this education, training and equipping material available to singles and single-again through our weekly workshop events.  These are held in the evenings for three consecutive week nights, and are paid for events by each participant. Singles can sign-up online or in person at the session. I am asking everyone viewing this funding page to help me raise the money needed to launch my new business. Thank you for your interest and support in advance. And, check out my business website with these tags:  "love is blind, so engage your mind";  "understanding love and attachment in dating and marriage." Search for pickurpartner.

W Andrew Confer

story:
Namaste,

My name is Apsara Karki and I am Program Director at Punarbal Plus in Kathmandu, Nepal. I come to you today seeking funds to continue our care for HIV-infected children in these trying times for our country.
 
Punarbal Plus, established in February 2007, is a non-government, non partisan and non-profit organization working in the field of HIV & AIDS. It is registered in Kathmandu CDO office and is affiliated to Social Welfare Council. It has attained a membership in NANGAN, a national network of organizations working in HIV to make an effort in bringing out the concerned issues successfully and fruitfully.

Punarbal Plus’s mission is to serve children infected or affected by HIV and orphans who are deprived of education due to their HIV status and poverty. We work in three main areas of need associated with HIV-infected children: child abuse, children’s rights, and education. To support this work Punarbal Plus operates two projects:

  • Punarbal Shikshya Sadan, which started in 2007, is the first educational institution in Nepal to educate children who are infected or affected by HIV/AIDS and to children who do not have the opportunity to attend school due to poverty.
  • Punarbal Home is a care and support center for infected and affected children, which started in November 2009. After opening the Punarbal School, Punarbal Plus realized the necessity of a care and support center for orphaned children who did not have the opportunity to study in traditional schools due to discrimination against the disease.

Currently, we are seeking funds to continue our current work and begin new projects that include a children’s transit home. Punarbal Plus operates on only $30,000 USD a year, therefore every donation goes a long way in supporting our children.  We hope you can make whatever contribution possible to our life-changing cause.

story:
What issues have we seen?

Education is the baseline for economic growth and sustainability. It is the backbone of a growing nation. The establishment of a strong curriculum and the appointment of highly skilled teachers are keys to the development of the education system. The problem is that even the best education system only helps if the children stay in school. To help limit the problem, at least in Marurui, we had to first understand what was going on. That meant research. What that showed is that most kids needed an extra incentive to stay in school. A lack of food was often the issue for them and so the thought was, if we give them food there then they will stay there too. Based on this research our project last year focused on getting kids of the street and back into school, using food as an extra incentive. This resulted in us supporting 15 children through their school year. Of the original 15, 14 have stayed in the program. One of the children never showed up for school, but we are doing everything in our power to track him down. For the time being his place has been taken by another student that required aid.


What is Muyog doing to change it?

In the first run of the education program (then named feeding program) we had an issue with parental involvement and parental responsibility. We came to this realization after the interviews with teachers, parents, and the children as a part of the evaluation of the program. This has made us understand that embarking on the issue from the child’s side alone is not enough. We must also assist the parents. Many parents here have their children at such a young age that they do not really know how to go about raising them. They do the best they can but often resort to the same methods as their parents used. This rarely results in progress. To accommodate the parents we have established parenting lessons to help them learn how they can better support their children, as well as developing better communication with the school, their children and Muyog. We have also brought them on board in the further development of the program with in depth talks about how the program is structured and where the funding comes from. The second addition that we have made to the program is the introduction of a revolving fund. This is an essential development. By offering a micro financial system we can now assist families to grow economically. This would enable them to grow out of our program on a sustainable income. Something that right now none of our families have, as can be seen in the case studies  (these are available upon request). The revolving fund also has the capability of launching the program from donor dependency to a self-sustaining system.


What do we need?

To give these families and this program a brighter future we will need your help and your donations. The goal has been set at 15000 euros. After donating we encourage you to spread the word and record your own give them a chance shout-out to help spread the message as widely as possible. (For more insight into the way the funds will be spent the budget is available upon request).

For any further documentation or questions, feel free to email us at muyogyouthorg@gmail.com.

story:
Clear Minded for Life

Clear Minded for Life is a non-profit foundation developed to bring clarity and focus to children in classrooms everywhere via meditation, breathwork and focus. 

We are after your support right now to teach children in classrooms everywhere simple skills to clear the mind and learn to focus through a variety of breathing and meditation techniques.

How this technique works and how it is different to what we know to be ‘meditation?

The Clear Minded for Life technique engages methodology that opens the aperture for learning so that children are more focused, experience an increase in attention span and an ability to comprehend and learn more easily.

For over 8 years we have been working with children to bring clarity and focus via the breath. Within 15 minutes, the children are connecting with their inner knowing and  displaying calm. After the sessions they experience an increase in attention span and ability to comprehend and learn more easily. They also have tools to use at home or at school and a way to leave stress behind.

What is your contribution for?

Not all schools have budgets for this and in order to reach more children we are asking for donations.  This will go towards funding more teachers to do this work within schools.

The vision is to replicate this program with as many qualified teachers as possible so that children everywhere can quiet the mind and build pathways of clear thought. Creating for all a future with bright minds.

A commitment to the future

We have years of training in the power of the mind, consciousness, neuroscience and deep focus techniques. Clear Minded for Life is committed to constantly researching the most up to date scientific studies and current understandings of the process in which the brain learns and develops.

We are asking for your support. Help us bring this program to more children and give the gift of clear, calm minds and a space of great love. Your contribution will go towards reaching more children and training other people who can work in schools with impeccability, passion and clarity.

For more details please contact vicki@clearmindedforlife.org

Please donate, it is simple.  This is about the future and it is about all of us. 

Many blessings for your support and love from the team at Clear Minded for Life.

Vicki E O'Leary           Maria Hopkins             Dakota Bradshaw          Sharon Byrne



Testimony Principal St Brendan’s Catholic Primary School NSW Australia
‘Staff members and parents alike have commented on the more tolerant and loving atmosphere which is quite tangible in classrooms. Our recent School Improvement survey contains reference to 98.5% of the parent community believing that their child has benefited greatly from these sessions. In addition 96% of students indicated that they look forward to meditation and find themselves much more equipped to deal with any anxiety that may arise.'

‘Meditation is good for school. It helps some kids if they are angry. It helps them to relax more instead of being angry. Also it helps kids to be more quiet in what they do at school and at home. In class if you are thinking hard, meditation is good for that, once you close your eyes it takes all of the hard working out of your head.’

Year 5 student Brittany G.

Clear Minded for Life

 Clear Minded for Life is a non-profit foundation developed to bring clarity and focus to children in classrooms everywhere via meditation, breathwork and focus.  We are 
after your support right now to teach children in classrooms everywhere 
simple skills to clear the mind and learn to focus through a variety of 
breathing and meditation techniques. 

How this technique works and how it is different to what we know to
be ‘meditation?
The Clear Minded for Life technique engages methodology that opens
the aperture for learning so that children are more focused, experience an
increase in attention span and an ability to comprehend and learn more easily.



For over 8 years we have been working with children to bring clarity 
and focus via the breath. Within 15 minutes, the children are connecting
 
with their inner knowing and  displaying calm. After the sessions they 
experience 
an increase in attention span and ability to comprehend and learn more 
easily. They also have tools to use at home or at school and 
a way to leave stress behind.What is your contribution for?Not all schools have budgets for this and in order to reach 
more children we are asking for donations.  
This will go towards funding more teachers to do this work within 
schools.
The vision is to replicate this program with as 
many qualified teachers as possible so that children everywhere can 
quiet the mind and build pathways of clear thought. Creating for all a 
future with bright minds.

neuroscience and deep focus techniques. Clear Minded for Life is committed to

story:
Who are we?

We are a team of students who chose to have the guts to study abroad – that’s how we met in Denmark and started to work on our startup - StudentBlogs.org

Our website is LIVE

Our experience of the struggle of moving abroad to study propelled us to develop a solution that will help millions of students have clear sight and avoid uncertainty that surrounds foreign studies. The students will have access to the experience and blogs of international students, also their internship reviews as well as read relevant news and editorials; subscribe to their favorite bloggers, ask direct questions from the authors, contribute and be part of the community.

We are working on being a central information hub, a supporting community and a unified voice for students across the globe. Everything we do is with the aim of connecting different parts of the world just like the tech giants do, except that we are not gathering blind followers to maximize profit; but forming a self-relying, intelligent community that will change the way we seek education.

What We Need & What You Get

We got selected for the WEB Summit  in Dublin (03-05/11/2015). This means  that our startup got the opportunity to have an exhibition stand - where we can pitch our idea to investors - and admission for the whole 3 days of the summit. Most importantly, we also have the chance to learn from other successful entrepreneurs, who are attending the conference, such as the Founder of Instagram or the CTO of Facebook. As StudentBlogs aims to reach out to students all over the world, our goal also includes creating a great exposure during the conference. The world's leading journalists will be all represented, such BBC, CNN, Wall Street Journal, The Guardian and The New York Times.

Usually, the ticket costs 4750 €/person, however, our startup got 4 tickets, for a discounted price: 1950€ all in all.


Unfortunately, we are all students, therefore we can’t afford to attend the conference without Your help! We ask for help with the following expenses:

  • Entrance fee for the 4 ticket/3days: 2 200 $ (540 $ each)

  • Flight ticket there and back for the team: 600 $ (With Ryanair - From Copenhagen to Dublin) (150$ each)

  • Accommodation, 4 nights for the team 600 $ (We would like to save also on this, so we found cheap offers from Airbnb)

  • Living expenses - Food,transportation: 400 $

(The currency is in USD - otherwise Indiegogo would not accept credit card transfers.)

Why are we doing this?

Studying abroad is an amazing experience. It lets you meet awesome people and learn a lot about different cultures, while it also greatly increases your chances of pursuing an international career in the future. Moving over to a new country is not easy though, and you will face challenges and difficulties, just like we did. Is it worth it? Definitely.
Most of the difficulties arose due to the lack of information. StudentsBlogs' aim is to collect and share the experiences of fellow students, building up a student community where you have the chance to get information and help from someone who has been in the same boat before. After all, we would like to encourage students to take part in the amazing experience of studying abroad!
We worked on this project in the previous two months after our classes and also on every weekends. We are all really passionate about creating this platform. All of our team members have been studying abroad, therefore, we all know, that it would be way better, to start a new foreign education without uncertainty.
 

Who are the team?

                  Máté Péter


Máté is one of the co-founders of StudentBlogs. He is responsible for updating the News and Blog post sections, bringing up-to-date content for the website, and organizing events.


Máté has studied International Business at Budapest Business School and Marketing Management at Business Academy Aarhus. He has also worked for the European Commission as an intern in Brussels.


The motivation behind his work at StudentBlogs is to share both economic and political news and analyses that are of great relevancy for students.


   Balázs Judik 


Balázs is the founder of StudentBlogs. He is responsible for organizing the team and also for the sales processes.


He is currently enrolled in the Bachelor of International Sales and Marketing at Business Academy Aarhus, meanwhile he also studied International Business at Shanghai Jian Qiao University.

 

Studying in different countries and experiencing the lack of information about student life was the main drive in creating StudentBlogs as a platform, however, Balázs has been writing his own blog over 4 years, which was also the reason, why he believes in connecting experienced bloggers with students who lack information.


    Adam Karacsony

He is taking care of the design and interaction at StudentBlogs, he srtive to push the quality of every detail higher to make sure the website will provide the best experience.
He became friends with András years before when we arrived in Denmark, and joined the StudentBlogs team this summer.
He studies web development, focusing on design, frontend and user experience. His passion in this enterprise is to help others and ensure they will have a good time on StudentBlogs.

        Andras Varga

He is the problem-solver technical guy. In the same time a music-lover who enjoys to be with friends. Luckily this new team offers a great opportunity to work with friends as well. His cooperation with Adam has a tradition, where he have always been the back-end guy, who deals with the sphagetti of codes. Our effectiveness can be completed now with the proper marketing-guys: Balazs and Mate


Other Ways You Can Help

In case we do not get the desired funding, and we can not attend Web Summit, we are going spend the collected sum on covering future company expenditures.

Every little help counts, so if you are also a fellow student, who believes in our project, You can also support us with sharing our story with the world!

story:
Summary of Program

Proyecto Atabey intergenerational mentoring program for young mothers provides support to young mothers attending the Lolita Lebron Family Learning Center (FLC) so that they can achieve educational, professional, and personal goals. As part of the program, young mothers are paired with a mentor, themselves former young mothers who are recruited from FLC graduates and other women in the community, and have faced challenges and attained success in certain areas of their lives. Mentors receive training and purvey transformational and authentic mentoring to FLC students; mentoring activities include hosting their mentee at their workplace or school site, helping mentees apply for jobs and fill out college applications, and spending family time together. Goals of the program include not only helping young mothers graduate from high school and transition to post-secondary activities, but also promoting advocacy skills amongst generations of young mothers and challenging negative stereotypes related to young parents. 

The Lolita Lebron Family Learning Center (FLC) is an educational program serving the needs of Puerto Rican/Latina and African American mothers in Humboldt Park, Chicago, a community located about four miles northwest of the downtown loop that has long been associated with the city’s Puerto Rican community. The FLC is a program of the Dr. Pedro Albizu Campos Alternative High School (PACHS), a high school that has been in existence for over 40 years.   

What We Need 

Proyecto Atabey has been accepted to conduct a workshop at the National Association for Multicultural Education conference in New Orleans, to be held October 1-4, 2015. The workshop will provide the opportunity for staff, mentors, and mentees to share their experiences in the program and engage attendees in discussions about how to challenge the stigma often placed on young mothers and work productively and respectfully with young mothers to help them achieve success. The program has limited funds to attend the conference and needs help to be able to attend. We are hoping to raise $2500 to fund the following:

  • Airfare for 1 staff member, 1 mentor, and 1 mentee
  • Hotel room for 3 nights
  • Food costs for 3 days
Every little bit helps!! This is a great opportunity for the program to publicize their emerging model of transformational and intergenerational mentorship, and for mentors and mentees to further develop presenting skills and network with others involved in similar work.


Other Ways You Can Help

And if you can't contribute to this fundraising effort, please consider volunteering for the program, especially if you are/were a young mother. We are always in need of passionate and inspiring individuals to share their experiences with students and discuss how they have faced and overcome various challenges and obstacles.

story:
Escuela Miguel Vasquez

Escuela Miguel Vasquez is a public school located in Zone 14 of Guatemala City. Like most schools in the country, it has endured violent conditions and lack of resources to fund programs and properly maintain its facilities. 

  • Support from the ministry of education is very limited.
  • 1 out of 4 citizens can't read and 1 in every 2 don't have access to secondary school.
  • Teachers are underpaid, buildings are obsolete and kept in bad conditions, and books and teaching aids are outdated or even nonexistent. 

What will we focus on?

Remodeling the current library:

  • Approximately $2000 will be needed to cover the remodeling.
  • New books, shelfs, and teaching aids will be purchased.
  • The remainding funds will go towards structural improvements and additional furniture.

Campaign Impact

  • Over 270 elementary, middle school, and high school students will benefit from the remodeling.

story:
IMAGINE THIS!

CAMPAIGN UPDATE: We just received $5,000 towards Imagine This from the Phoenix One Foundation! THANK YOU FOR THE SUPPORT!! 

Launched in 2008 by the Great Arizona Puppet Theater IMAGINE THIS is a collaborative 2-part annual project with our neighbor, Kenilworth Elementary School, which takes 14 original stories and turns them into professional puppet shows! Stories are turned in on October 2nd with performances in November.

PART I:

Children in 2nd - 8th grades put their creative thinking caps on and write stories about themselves, their communities, aliens, purple sea monsters, you name it!

Volunteers from the community then select 2 stories from each grade level to be converted into professional puppet shows at the Great Arizona Puppet Theater (GAPT). All Kenilworth students can come and see the shows for FREE!

During the run at the theater more than 500 Kenilworth students experience the theater and the work of their classmates, who are always recognized publicly for their accomplishments. In addition, the authors of the selected stories enjoy a special AUTHORS PARTY held on an evening where friends and family are invited to see the stories enacted, and the participating children receive certificates, a commemorative book with pictures of the authors and puppets, and prizes donated by neighborhood businesses. More than 100 children, family, and friends came out to the 2014 Author's Party!

PART II:

The second part of this project was developed when Kenilworth students told us they wanted to learn to make puppets and do shows too. So of course GAPT jumped on board and created YOUNG PUPPETEERS, which targets 20 children enrolled in the PEER After School Program. Initially, they help make puppets and props for the IMAGINE THIS production; next they move on to building their own puppets. They then present puppet shows for other children in the PEER program and their families. YOUNG PUPPETEERS also join us at the special Authors Party with their families to be recognized for their contributions to the production, and of course to have plenty of fun!

These robust workshops are led by professional GAPT puppeteers and the kids get to learn about different styles of puppetry, how puppetry is used and performed in different cultures, and how to make their own puppets and develop a show for performance.

"My favorite day of the year is the field trip to the Great AZ Puppet Theater for this production!  I am completely enthralled with how the stories unfold with the puppetry."

"My heart absolutely soars to see the pride of the authors as they get to stand for their accolade & I am so very proud when it was one of my former students."  

"We don’t get to write the stories, but some of my PEER students get to help with props.  I think that our being able to attend inspires their writing for 2ndgrade & we all dream of having our story performed."

 "We always come back & write what our favorite play was & why.  I am always amazed at the variety  & combinations of puppetry also.  Can NOT wait!"

"It’s wonderful to see some of my former Kindergarten students in the spotlight…they’ve written their own play!"

"Imagine learning provides a wonderful creative outlet for students to do more than just another writing assignment. Having this opportunity to see something you created come to life as a magical puppet show, and to have so many people come see your creation can do more for a child than any field trip or school lesson ever could."

"The students at Kenilworth have enjoyed participating in the Imagine Program for the past few years in both the writing of their stories that get transformed into a puppet show and the viewing of their creation.  As a teacher I love to see the students really blossom and faces gleam when their story has been chosen.  The sense of pride for the students and their  guests, their parents, to the celebration of their story and show that has been created."

- Thank you Mrs. Arnold for gathering these great testimonials from Kenilworth Elementary!

“Part of the theater’s mission is to educate children and families through Puppetry and to enrich Arizona’s cultural climate; this program does exactly that. I cannot express enough the importance and impact of this program! I've had the opportunity to see it grow over the years and am committed to helping ensure it can continue in our community. Join me and show your support today!!”

- Natalia R.C., Vice-Chair, GAPT Board of Directors

Our Need...

At Kenilworth Elementary School, just around the corner from our theater, 79% of the children qualify for free or reduced lunch. The highly motivated staff works hard to provide them the best education possible, but ever increasing cuts to education and the arts have made it more and more difficult to offer meaningful enrichment activities.

Last year, although we applied for funding to numerous sources for IMAGINE THIS, only 8% of the total needed was donated. Since we have been doing this program for a number of years, the community looks forward to it and we couldn’t bear to disappoint them, we did the program anyway. The Board of Directors supplied some of the funding and several puppeteers declined paychecks for their time, yet it still was a budgetary loss for the theater.

This year, it is our hope, as the Board of Directors, and as committed volunteers, that our efforts with this campaign will alleviate the need for the theater to take a loss to continue this very much appreciated and sought-after program.

We are calling upon our greater community to help us reach our goal!!

BREAKDOWN OF COSTS:

Production Puppeteers (5x$18/hr x 100 hrs):              $9,000.00

Theater –space/utilities/insurance/admin –1 week: $2,000.00

Supplies for IMAGINE THIS:                                                 $1,000.00

Marketing for IMAGINE THIS:                                              $300.00

Authors Party w/ Commemorative Book:                      $1,000.00

Awards/Reception:                                                                  $500.00

Preparation/Evaluation for IMAGINE THIS:                    $300.00

Workshop Puppeteers (2x$18/hr x 60 hrs) 15 mtgs:   $2,160.00

Supplies for YOUNG PUPPETEERS workshops:             $500.00

Culminating Event for YOUNG PUPPETEERS:                 $300.00

Rewards for Contributors:                                                       $1,940.00

Indiegogo 5% Campaign Fee:                                                $1,000.00

                                                                         TOTAL: $20,000.00

The Impact

IMAGINE THIS is one of our favorite projects because it makes the puppet theater a part of the life of the neighborhood and builds community relations. Teachers and students smile and wave when we visit Kenilworth or run into them at the grocery store or neighborhood park. During classroom visits, the children tell us about their favorite IMAGINE THIS stories from years past and we love meeting their parents and seeing how proud they are of their children’s creative accomplishments.

At Kenilworth Elementary School, where 27% of the children are English Language Learners, there is an emphasis on developing literacy skills. Teachers tie the IMAGINE THIS program into curriculum and educational standards as it encourages  writing. For instance, in fourth grade, children learn to develop a story draft and make changes before the final version is submitted. Other teachers emphasize vocabulary development, story sequencing, and other key language skills.

This is an exceptionally special and unique experience for so many students. For example, one classroom teacher showed us a handwritten letter from a shy 2nd grade boy who’d taken the time to create an invitation to the Authors’Party for his instructor and school counselor, so they could see his story DINO VILLAGE enacted. Teachers have told us that the field trip to IMAGINE THIS is their favorite activity of the year and YOUNG PUPPETEERS from last year are asking when we are coming back. HELP US COME BACK!

Some facts for the academics out there:

Numerous studies have demonstrated evidence connecting student learning in the arts to academic and social benefits. In Critical Links: Learning in the Arts and Student Social and Academic Development, researcher James Catterall reports of at-risk students, “…a tendency for the arts to promote both certain competencies for children who struggle across the curriculum as well as genuinely grounded feelings of competence and engagement.” A. Helene Robinson’s recent (2013) research-based article, Arts Integration and the Success of Disadvantaged Students: A Research Evaluation, suggests that perceptive thinking skills derived from arts education implementation can become a strategic component for planning instruction that enhances learning for Common Core Standards.

Other Ways You Can Help

•  Be a MATCH SPONSOR: Help us reach our goal faster and sponsor a 24hr period or a whole week of contributions! You’ll commit to matching any donation received in your sponsored period of time helping double every dollar raised!!

•  SHARE SHARE SHARE…our campaign through Social Media, Email, Word of Mouth, and the list goes on!

•  Be an IN KIND sponsor –for example: remembrance t-shirts for the kids and teachers with the winning authors names, refreshments and prizes for the Authors' Party, and so on. Message us for more ideas!

•  Volunteer to help the evening of our grand reception!
