production; next they move on to building their own puppets. They then present
puppet shows for other children in the PEER program and their families. YOUNG PUPPETEERS also join us at the special Authors Party with their
families to be recognized for their contributions to the production, and of
course to have plenty of fun! 
These robust workshops are led by professional GAPT puppeteers and the
kids get to learn about different styles of puppetry, how puppetry is used and
performed in different cultures, and how to make their own puppets and develop
a show for performance.


"My
 favorite day of the year is the field trip to the Great AZ Puppet 
Theater for this production!  I am completely enthralled with how the 
stories unfold with the puppetry."
"My heart absolutely soars to see the 
pride of the authors as they get to stand for their accolade & I am 
so very proud when it was one of my former students."  
"We don’t get to 
write the stories, but some of my PEER students get to help with props. 
 I think that our being able to attend inspires their writing for 2ndgrade
 & we all dream of having our story performed."
 "We always come back 
& write what our favorite play was & why.  I am always amazed at
 the variety  & combinations of puppetry also.  Can NOT wait!"

"It’s wonderful to see some of my former Kindergarten students in the spotlight…they’ve written their own play!" 


"Imagine
 learning provides a wonderful creative outlet for students to do more 
than just another writing assignment. Having this opportunity to see 
something you created come to life as a magical puppet show, and to have
 so many people come see your creation can do more for a child than any 
field trip or school lesson ever could."

"The
 students at Kenilworth have enjoyed participating in the Imagine Program 
for the past few years in both the writing of their stories that get 
transformed into a puppet show and the viewing of their creation.  As a
 teacher I love to see the students really blossom and faces gleam when 
their story has been chosen.  The sense of pride for the students and 
their  guests, their parents, to the celebration of their story and show 
that has been created."


- Thank you Mrs. Arnold for gathering these great testimonials from Kenilworth Elementary!
“Part of the theater’s mission is to educate children and families
through Puppetry and to enrich Arizona’s cultural climate; this program does exactly that. I cannot express
enough the importance and impact of this program! I've had the opportunity to
see it grow over the years and am committed to helping ensure it can continue
in our community. Join me and show your support today!!” 
- Natalia R.C., Vice-Chair, GAPT Board of
Directors

   

Our Need...

At Kenilworth Elementary School, just around the corner from our
theater, 79% of the children qualify for free or reduced lunch. The highly
motivated staff works hard to provide them the best education possible, but
ever increasing cuts to education and the arts have made it more and more
difficult to offer meaningful enrichment activities. 
Last year, although we applied for funding to numerous sources for
IMAGINE THIS, only 8% of the total needed was donated. Since we have been doing
this program for a number of years, the community looks forward to it and we
couldn’t bear to disappoint them, we did the
program anyway. The Board of Directors supplied some of the funding and several
puppeteers declined paychecks for their time, yet it still was a budgetary loss
for the theater. 
This year, it is our hope, as the Board of Directors, and as committed
volunteers, that our efforts with this campaign will alleviate the need for the
theater to take a loss to continue this very much appreciated and sought-after
program. 
We are calling upon our greater community to help us reach our goal!!
BREAKDOWN OF COSTS:
Production Puppeteers (5x$18/hr x 100 hrs):              $9,000.00
Theater –space/utilities/insurance/admin –1 week: $2,000.00
Supplies for IMAGINE THIS:                                                 $1,000.00
Marketing for IMAGINE THIS:                                              $300.00
Authors Party w/ Commemorative Book:                      $1,000.00
Awards/Reception:                                                                  $500.00
Preparation/Evaluation for IMAGINE THIS:                    $300.00
Workshop Puppeteers (2x$18/hr x 60 hrs) 15
mtgs:   $2,160.00
Supplies for YOUNG PUPPETEERS workshops:             $500.00
Culminating Event for YOUNG PUPPETEERS:                 $300.00
Rewards for Contributors:                                                       $1,940.00
Indiegogo 5% Campaign Fee:                                                $1,000.00
                                                                         TOTAL: $20,000.00
  

The Impact

IMAGINE THIS is one of our favorite projects because it makes the
puppet theater a part of the life of the neighborhood and builds community
relations. Teachers and students smile and wave when we visit Kenilworth or run
into them at the grocery store or neighborhood park. During classroom visits,
the children tell us about their favorite IMAGINE THIS stories from years past
and we love meeting their parents and seeing how proud they are of their
children’s creative accomplishments.
At Kenilworth Elementary School, where 27% of the children are English
Language Learners, there is an emphasis on developing literacy skills. Teachers
tie the IMAGINE THIS program into curriculum and educational standards as it
encourages  writing. For instance, in
fourth grade, children learn to develop a story draft and make changes before
the final version is submitted. Other teachers
emphasize vocabulary development, story sequencing, and other key language
skills.
This is an exceptionally special and unique experience for so many
students. For example, one classroom teacher showed us a handwritten letter
from a shy 2nd grade boy who’d taken the time to
create an invitation to the Authors’Party for his
instructor and school counselor, so they could see his story DINO VILLAGE
enacted. Teachers have told us that the field trip to IMAGINE THIS is their
favorite activity of the year and YOUNG PUPPETEERS from last year are asking
when we are coming back. HELP US COME BACK!
Some facts for the academics out there:
Numerous studies have demonstrated evidence connecting student
learning in the arts to academic and social benefits. In Critical Links:
Learning in the Arts and Student Social and Academic Development,
researcher James Catterall reports of at-risk students, “…a tendency for the arts to promote both certain competencies for
children who struggle across the curriculum as well as genuinely grounded
feelings of competence and engagement.” A. Helene Robinson’s recent (2013) research-based article, Arts Integration and the
Success of Disadvantaged Students: A Research Evaluation, suggests that
perceptive thinking skills derived from arts education implementation can
become a strategic component for planning instruction that enhances learning
for Common Core Standards. 
Other Ways You Can Help
• 
Be a MATCH
SPONSOR: Help us reach our goal faster and sponsor a 24hr period or a whole
week of contributions! You’ll commit to matching
any donation received in your sponsored period of time helping double every
dollar raised!!
• 
SHARE SHARE SHARE…our campaign
through Social Media, Email, Word of Mouth, and the list goes on!
• 
Be an IN KIND sponsor –for example: remembrance t-shirts for the kids and teachers with the
winning authors names, refreshments and prizes for the Authors' Party, and so on. Message us for more ideas!
• 
Volunteer to help
the evening of our grand reception!

story:
SHORT SUMMARY
The ISOS Center for Social Responsibility is a non profit corporation that works to advance global commitments for a common, more sustainable future. We first started ISOS with the vision of helping create a more sustainable future through transparency. Education was key to driving the charge. 

We've since laid the foundations for reporting in the U.S. by training non-profits, international and federal agencies, small and large corporations alike. To make an even greater impact, we believe it's time to expand that call by facilitating awareness and skills development within a larger community.


AFRICA
With global recognition and strong partnerships in hand, we're packing our tool kits for an adventure of a lifetime. In Spring of 2016, our experts will fly to Ghana and Kenya to deliver extended Global Reporting Initiative (GRI) and  CDP Trainings to improve disclosure in the region. In reflecting on our initial moves to raise awareness, tapping into the academic community was essential. We're starting fresh in Africa- and making the trainings accessible to African academics will again, serve as the entry point to those who will essentially, create change.

No contribution is too small. Every bit counts! Through this campaign, we aim to provide 10 scholarships in each country. Will you help us achieve our goal?

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

Here's the breakdown....

  • By contributing you will build a scholarship pool of $10,000 - waiving the costs of tuition and materials for 20 African academics to attend the certified sustainability reporting trainings in Ghana and Kenya.
  • Influence the lives of participants directly by giving them an opportunity to enhance their skillset in this space, contribute to larger social-economic development in their communities and meet larger international sustainability objectives.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will award scholarships based on funds received....and hope to increase contributions next year!
  • Contributors will receive an extra 10% off at any of our future in-person or online trainings!
  • Of course, we'll also let you live vicariously through our adventures. We will regularly share blogs, photos and lessons-learned along the way.

THE IMPACT

The case for trainings of this kind stem primarily from international sustainability commitments from U.N. Agencies, implementation measures mandated by national governments and through standards set by major global companies. Credibility stemming from conscious, honest and reliable reporting of environmental, social and governance measures (ESG) according to global standards can result in secured contracts for goods and services that are conducted ethically.

We hope to support efforts in Africa by advancing transparency across global value chains; through impact identification, sound measurement techniques and stakeholder communication. We are not only striving to enhance resiliency, but to spark innovation in the process as well.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

There's always the risk of jumping to the scene prematurely. When we started pounding the pavement in the U.S. to the sustainability tune, we regularly received the "you're crazy" card. Fast forward, 72% of the S&P 500 are now publishing sustainability reports, the government is behind certain measures and the term is part of our general lexicon.

We understand that an effort of this kind will take time and undying determination. We'll have to be creative in our approach and sensitive to local contexts. We'll also have to provide as many tools as possible to reduce the burden of reporting on those who are much more concerned with issues so foreign to most the developed world. We're ready for the challenge and we can't imagine any other group being prepared to take on this role.

We're excited- and humbled by the opportunity. We hope you are too!


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you can't contribute right now, you can still support this campaign in one of the following ways:
  
  • Let us  know if you have subsidiaries or partners on the ground who would be willing to provide guest presentations.
  • Know of other funding source avenues we can apply to help cover costs for African academics.
  • Please circulate information about our trainings, offered in partnership with AMC- Africa: 
      • GHANA // May 2016
      KENYA // May 2016

And that's all there is to it. Don't hesitate to write us with any questions and/or thoughts you might have! info@isoscsr.org


May-Dah-Say!
Oh-Yeh-Rah-Don!
Na-Gooddee!
Asante!
Thank You!

story:
Planes, Trains, and Film School

Nicole comes from California and plans to write movies.  Joshua is from Washington and loves to edit.  Austin just finished a student documentary he shot in Argentina.  And Kitty is bringing her unique voice and compassionate heart to her own brand of filmmaking.

We are the family of students and faculty at The Film School @ NNU -- Northwest Nazarene University -- a small Christian school outside Boise, Idaho where big things happen.  It's where we're learning to tell stories that impact lives.

Each fall we meet together and brainstorm a huge project to film during the year.  In the past we've built a WWII submarine in our studio, produced 60 minute Christmas specials that aired all over the Northwest on NBC affiliates and won a national award, and last year we built an entire subway station -- with working subway car -- to tell a story about the clash between old and new technology.

But this year we've dreamed up a project so big it stretches us far beyond our usual productions, and well beyond the Film School’s usual budget.

You see, we don't make money off our films, we just learn, so there's no income to pay for expenses.  Under the guidance of the faculty,  we use these productions to take the concepts we discuss in the classroom and put them to use in real-world situations.  So this truly is "non profit", which is why your help is tax-deductable, and so important.

In-Flight Movie

Headwinds is a web series in five episodes - a drama about three Hollywood friends creating a sitcom about a startup airline for a major TV network.  Each of them are tired of working on empty shows, and has a dream of creating something special, something of substance.

Of course, other people's ideas often get in the way of their dreams.

As we watch those dreams unravel behind the scenes in the drama, we get to watch the hilarious characters and situations of the sitcom develop in front of the cameras, like the name of their airline.  It's called "Bagle Air" because they painted the name "Eagle Air" on their one plane, then discovered that name was already taken.  So they just filled in the ends of the "E".

Pressure grows in each episode of the drama as day-to-day challenges are faced, and across the entire series as the three friends wait to hear the verdict about their sitcom: will the audience respond to their dream-show, and will the network buy it?

Assembly Line

The Film School provides all the cameras, lights, dollies, and space we need to film most anything.  But the size and shape of Headwinds requires just a little bit more than the usual to produce.

So we're looking for help to buy film equipment we don't have but need for this project. It's called a Steadicam, and will give us the freedom, flexibility,  and network-look necessary for this show.  It's how most of the dramas on TV are shot because it gives a steady look to the picture, but is also a much faster way of shooting.  It's something we need to know and understand if we're going to work in this industry. 

Our goal is $3900, which is the cost of that equipment.

No student or faculty member is paid for this or any other project we do.  In fact, the faculty donate their time to help us learn on these extra-curricular films.

In exchange for your help, we'd like you to be a part of the process -- be an extra on our airliner, name the plane, receive a signed air-sick bag from the cast and crew, or even direct a scene.

You'll have fun, and if you do join us on-set, you'll see exactly how a Hollywood film is made, because our director and his colleagues insist that everything we do is done at the highest level of professionalism, as if we were working on any mega-movie in Hollywood.  That's the work ethic they're instilling in us.

Flight Schedule

Each episode will be shot over a weekend and edited in the following two weeks, then released.  So we'll release a new episode on YouTube and everywhere else every three or four weeks, from October to March or April. 

Even if you can't help us financially, please spread the word about this campaign - and about the premier of Headwinds - through all means possible.  Then watch our Facebook page for news and updates. 

Of course if you can help us out, you'll get our quirky perks, a tax receipt, and all our gratitude!

    Destination

    The Headwinds project is designed to benefit both those who work on it and those who watch it -

    • At its core, Headwinds is a teachable moment - students learning life skills by producing a months-long project under real-world pressures.
    • The DRAMA of the show centers on the theme of living your dreams while sticking to your values.
    • The SITCOM created in the midst of the drama is set in 1999 and centers on the theme of "The Way We Were" -- no Facebook, no smartphones, no crowdfunding!  How did people survive?  And how were we different?

    Flight Risks & Challenges

    There's very little risk in this project.  Unless something catastrophic happens -- like the earth opening up and swallowing our campus (an analogy which could include a death, serious illness, or termination) -- Headwinds WILL be made.  We have more than a decade of huge projects under our belts, and there's nothing in Headwinds we can't achieve.

    So ALL donations received WILL go toward production of the show, or at the very least, toward the education of students at The Film School.

    But the challenges are many -- they are problems to be solved, and phone calls to be made.  For instance, where can we get about 40 used airline seats?

    Some of those challenges are answered with specific equipment, and that's what this campaign is all about: having the right tools for the job.

      Now Boarding . . .

      We take off in just a few short weeks, and this is your chance to be on the inaugural (fake) flight.  Please help us in any way you can!

      • Post, Tweet, Link, and Email this site . . .
      • Visit our YouTube and FaceBook pages to see past projects . . .
      • And of course, if you're able, help us with a donation.

      Thank You!

      Students and Faculty of The Film School @ NNU

 We take off in just a few short weeks, and this is your chance to be on the inaugural (fake) flight.  Please help us in any way you can!  Post, Tweet, Link, and Email this site . . .

Thank You!

story:
The Delegation of Universidad Central de Venezuela to the Harvard World Model United Nations, is an institutional organization attached to the Academic Vice-Chancellor’s office, run by students under the conduction and guidance of a Faculty Advisor. We are aimed at developing both professionals and citizens committed to building a much better world society.

We are getting ready to participate in the 25th edition of the Harvard WorldMUN, the most prestigious and realistic Model of the United Nations in the world, where we will be working with future leaders that will conduct our planet in the near future, both in the private and public sector. This will be our 14th participation in WorldMUN, preceded by the successful and awarded performance of our previous Delegations.  We have been inspired by the search for excellence since our first participation in 2003, with rewards that range from Outstanding Delegation to many Diplomacy Awards. Now, with your patronage, our team will continue its tradition of excellence in Rome 2016.

Your financial assistance, either in US dollars or in Euros, is vital to allow us participate in Harvard WorldMUN and overcome our strict limitations to access foreign currency. Please help us become leaders of the change we all want to see in the world!

For more information, check out our Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram pages:

http://www.ucv.ve/index.php?id=8101

https://www.facebook.com/ucvwmun?ref=br_rs

https://twitter.com/ucvworldmun

https://instagram.com/worldmunucv/

story:
Social Shot

Esta iniciativa nace en 2013 con el objetivo de generar IMPACTO a través de emprendimientos sociales. Llevamos 6 ediciones y con tu ayuda... ¡VAMOS POR MÁS!

Los eventos se dividen en 3 segmentos 

  • Charlas inspiracionales "@Shots":
    Emprendedores experimentados comparten sus experiencias en intervenciones de 5 minutos... un disparo de solidaridad.
     
  • Talleres disruptivos "@Workshops":
    Espacios de aprendizaje interactivo, compuesto por talleres de trabajo, mesas de diálogo y foros para el intercambio de ideas. 

  • Networking de IMPACTO y oportunidades de Voluntariado "@Social Fair":
    Feria de Organizaciones para generar redes de IMPACTO y atracción de voluntarios.  

Esta es una iniciativa colaborativa entre organizaciones, personas e ideales. ¡Nos une la pasión y la motivación por crear un mejor planeta, actuando local y compartiendo globalmente!



¿A quiénes buscamos? 
Inversionistas de IMPACTO.

Un inversionista de impacto promueve iniciativas emprendedoras que junto con la creación de riqueza y empleo se plantean deliberadamente la producción de un beneficio para la sociedad. 

  • Meta: $5000 
    El objetivo de la meta es financiar 7ma y 8va Edición del Social Shot Costa Rica,  las cuales se estarán llevando a cabo en Marzo y Septiembre 2016.



  • Las recompensas están basadas en conocimiento, con el objetivo de promover emprendimientos de alto valor agregado y potencial de crecimiento, lo cuales los estarán impartiendo actores claves del ecosistema nacional. (Felipe Castro Truque, Alejandro Egea, Melissa Monge, Leandro Camacho, Daniel Carranza, Juan Carlos Arce, Juan Carlos Martí, entre muchos otros más). 


  • Todos los fondos recaudados* se utilizarán para las próximas dos ediciones del 2016. 

    *Una vez recaudado el 100% de la meta los fondos extras serán destinados a la creación de un fondo de capital semilla para emprendedores sociales. 

Impacto

Cada dólar genera IMPACTO. 
El emprendimiento social es una prueba mas de cómo la investigación es una herramienta al servicio del conocimiento y del conocimiento para la acción. Confiamos en que esta innovadora vía de resolver las problemáticas sociales amplíe y profundice en el futuro una extraordinaria importancia estratégica en el desarrollo económico y progreso social de las naciones. 

  • ¿En qué contribuye esta iniciativa al planeta?
    En un momento de cambio como el actual , de replanteamientos, de pensar en profundidad y sin dramatismo sobre por qué las cosas no han funcionado como esperábamos, constituye una gran oportunidad para que al mismo tiempo que creamos valor económico también generemos valor social.
     
  • El Equipo: (100% VOLUNTARIOS)
    Somos un equipo de voluntarios multidisciplinario; diseñadores, comunicadores, financieros, economistas, abogados, electrónicos, ingenieros, futboleros, aventureros, apasionados, comprometidos y disruptores.  Gran experiencia en Banca de Inversión, Capital de Riesgo, Emprendimientos Tecnológicos, Fracasos e Innovaciones Sociales.
  • Líderes:
    ~Lourdes Brizuela (Directora RSC, Laureate International Universities)
    ~Felipe Castro Truque (Fundador Centro de Intercambio de Conocimientos)
    ~Leandro Camacho (Co-fundador GoPass)
    ~Alejandro Egea (Director de Inversiones Grupo QT)

    ***Todo el proceso de la campaña será compartido y de libre acceso  en la plataforma de aprendizaje colaborativa WikiCrowd.org

Riesgos & Retos


"El riesgo más grande que podemos asumir es no tomar ningún riesgo." Startup Vitamins. 

"Nunca estamos preparados, el camino nos forma." Leandro Camacho

Nuestro principal reto se encuentra en construir una cultura de colaboración en el país, para la cual planteamos la mejor estrategia, una dosis de EMPODERAMIENTO. 
 
Otras contribuciones de IMPACTO

De nuestras principales experiencias, encontramos que el verdadero poder se encuentra en las personas, vos y yo podemos ser el mejor ejemplo del cambio que queremos ver en el mundo, convertite en un inversionista de impacto: 

  • PARTICIPAR

  • COMPARTIR

  • DIFUNDIR
story_txt:
Social Shot
Esta iniciativa nace en 2013 con el objetivo de generar IMPACTO a través de emprendimientos sociales. Llevamos 6 ediciones y con tu ayuda... ¡VAMOS POR MÁS!Los eventos se dividen en 3 segmentos 

Charlas inspiracionales "@Shots":Emprendedores experimentados comparten sus experiencias en intervenciones de 5 minutos... un disparo de solidaridad.  
Talleres disruptivos "@Workshops":Espacios de aprendizaje interactivo, compuesto por talleres de trabajo, mesas de diálogo y foros para el intercambio de ideas. 

Networking de IMPACTO y oportunidades de Voluntariado "@Social Fair":Feria de Organizaciones para generar redes de IMPACTO y atracción de voluntarios.  

Esta es una iniciativa colaborativa entre organizaciones, personas e ideales. ¡Nos une la pasión y la motivación por crear un mejor planeta, actuando local y compartiendo globalmente!



¿A quiénes buscamos? Inversionistas de IMPACTO.Un inversionista de impacto promueve iniciativas emprendedoras que junto con la creación de riqueza y empleo se plantean deliberadamente la producción de un beneficio para la sociedad. 

Meta: $5000 El objetivo de la meta es financiar 7ma y 8va Edición del Social Shot Costa Rica,  las cuales se estarán llevando a cabo en Marzo y Septiembre 2016.




 Las recompensas están basadas en conocimiento, con el objetivo de promover emprendimientos de alto valor agregado y potencial de crecimiento, lo cuales los estarán impartiendo actores claves del ecosistema nacional. (Felipe Castro Truque, Alejandro Egea, Melissa Monge, Leandro Camacho, Daniel Carranza, Juan Carlos Arce, Juan Carlos Martí, entre muchos otros más). 
 Todos los fondos recaudados* se utilizarán para las próximas dos ediciones del 2016. *Una vez recaudado el 100% de la meta los fondos extras serán destinados a la creación de un fondo de capital semilla para emprendedores sociales. 
    Impacto Cada dólar genera IMPACTO. El emprendimiento social es una prueba mas de cómo la investigación es una herramienta al servicio del conocimiento y del conocimiento para la acción. Confiamos en que esta innovadora vía de resolver las problemáticas sociales amplíe y profundice en el futuro una extraordinaria importancia estratégica en el desarrollo económico y progreso social de las naciones.   ¿En qué contribuye esta iniciativa al planeta?En un momento de cambio como el actual , de replanteamientos, de pensar en profundidad y sin dramatismo sobre por qué las cosas no han funcionado como esperábamos, constituye una gran oportunidad para que al mismo tiempo que creamos valor económico también generemos valor social.  

El Equipo: (100% VOLUNTARIOS)Somos un equipo de voluntarios multidisciplinario; diseñadores, comunicadores, financieros, economistas, abogados, electrónicos, ingenieros, futboleros, aventureros, apasionados, comprometidos y disruptores.  Gran experiencia en Banca de Inversión, Capital de Riesgo, Emprendimientos Tecnológicos, Fracasos e Innovaciones Sociales.


 Líderes:~Lourdes Brizuela (Directora RSC, Laureate International Universities)~Felipe Castro Truque (Fundador Centro de Intercambio de Conocimientos)~Leandro Camacho (Co-fundador GoPass)~Alejandro Egea (Director de Inversiones Grupo QT)***Todo el proceso de la campaña será compartido y de libre acceso  en la plataforma de aprendizaje colaborativa WikiCrowd.org

story:
We sold everything we owned to move to Haiti to live as volunteer missionaries.  Of everyone we met, none were more needy or more amazing than the people of the poor fishing village near the river in Montrouis.  

These fishermen and destitute families have one thing that's keeps them going.  They hope that their kids will get to go to school.  Of all of these determined fishermen, there is one that rises head and shoulders above the rest.  His name is Carrenard.  His small stature and meek demeanor belie his ability to rise above his circumstances.  He could leave the fishing village but chooses to stay to fight for a destitute little school that he knows represents hope for the next generation of his village.

The parents are too poor to pay for the school.  Carrenard had some people helping pay the teachers salaries but they can't help him this year.  Our little ministry would pay for them but we are using all of our resources paying for our child sponsorship program.

Carrenard called me begging me to help.  He has 12 employees that we will be paying their families' only income.  We will be creating an opportunity to educate over 150 children and giving hope to a whole village.  These are not faces on TV for us.  These are our friends and we are determined to get their children the basic opportunity to a decent education.  

In the spring, we will be leading a team of contributors down to meet the teachers and students and take supplies.  This is a chance to form long term relationships with people that live in one of the poorest communities on earth.

Don't miss the chance to get involved.  You can read eight years of backstory on our blog at www.Reeveslife.com or like the Facebook page at New Vision Ministries.

Where's the Money Going?

We try to pay the teachers an above average salary of $150 per month each.

The remaining $2000 will buy supplies the school needs.

Any money extra that is collected will go to finish construction on the school building and to buy more benches for the class rooms.

If we actually raised $7500 more, we will restart the school feeding program and offer a nutritious meal everyday to all of the students and teachers.

story:
The Burnham Education Scholarship Trust [BEST] pays homage to Linden Forbes Sampson Burnham, Founder Leader of the People’s National Congress and Guyana’s first Executive President. He served as Guyana’s first Minister of Education in 1953. He was 30-years old! President Burnham was a man of extraordinary intelligence and a grand visionary. He won the British Guiana scholarship in 1942, at age 19! He earned his Bachelor of Arts degree in 1944, at age 21! Then, in 1948, he earned his Bachelor of Laws degree and was admitted to the London Bar. He was 25-years old! The BEST awards support children who exemplify President Burnham.



Since 2012, with your support, the Burnham Education Scholarship Trust [BEST] has provided hundreds of grade six students with financial awards to purchase books, uniforms, meals and to assist with transportation. Our awards are renewed every year throughout the students’ enrollment at secondary school. Your continued support will ensure that even more students will benefit from our program.

story:
Thank you for your generous support! Please check http://havenforhumanity.org for the latest news and updates from Haven! Email us at contact@havenforhumanity.org







**We are currently in the process of incorporating our project as an official non-profit educational facility. Your contributions are tax deductible!**

INTRODUCTION

So far, we have tried to fund this project ourselves, but with recent hard economic times and our family emergency issues of the past year, we are hoping that there are people out there who share our vision of a sustainable and harmonious future, and are willing to help us complete our goals here in upstate NY.


OUR MISSION

To demonstrate how living in harmony with Nature can provide an abundance of health and happiness, and also the same comfort and luxury of our modern era, while eliminating many unnecessary side-effects.


STOP SURVIVING, BEGIN THRIVING

Does being human really require us waking up before dawn to get ready for a job? Have anxiety, fear, stress, and fatigue become a daily part of the "human condition"? Do disease and old-age go hand-in-hand now? These are some of the many questions we asked ourselves before starting this project; after we had lost many friends and relatives to cancer, diabetes, depression and other horrors, and realized that we too, were on the same path.

After careful study we discovered that a human being’s “needs” are relatively easy to fulfill and the means for them are readily available in Nature all around us - Nature, that we, humans, seem to separate ourselves from. However, there seemed to exist no clear model or road-map to follow for someone looking to reconnect, and thus the project began.


WHAT IF THERE WAS ANOTHER WAY?

In light of the suffering, disease, stress, lies, and fear in the world today, we are attempting to create a new model for humanity to follow, which looks at our feelings as tools for self-improvement, instead of obstacles to overcome. We are not attempting to separate ourselves from common society, but rather, illustrate how a new model for living within it, can provide the confidence, security, and peace that we all seek, without the stresses that normally come along with it.

How great would it feel to wake up on your own time EVERY morning, feeling not only refreshed and well-rested, but actually excited about taking on your day? What if you could have all the same utilities you have now, but without spending money on them every month? Can you imagine eating fresh produce that has ripened on the plant with all of the flavor and nutrients that nature intended us to have, without ever stepping foot in a grocery store or even leaving your own home?

Progress in technology and forward-thinking has taken us to a place today, where judicious application of available tools and technology enables us to achieve the integration with Nature that we are seeking, and end the struggle to overcome Her at every turn.

WHAT WE'RE DOING

For the past 4 years my family and I have been working hard to build our new home as well as our living, off-the-grid, self-sustainable, aquaponic, bioenergy, greenhouse facility. Whew, that is a mouthful!

My family and I have carefully researched and employed the most cutting-edge designs developed by NASA engineers in order to create a facility smart enough to be built for the International Space Station and yet at the same time easily and efficiently sustain human life. 

Above is a photo of the "Island One", the very same facility that our bio-energy greenhouse was designed after. Notice the rings of algae and the fragmented parabolic reflector surrounding it; these are the very same tools that we will be employing here in Livingston Manor.

The 60 foot diameter greenhouse is designed with room for over 600 organic and aquaponic fruit and vegetable plants, a host of fresh-water organic fish, gourmet mushroom logs, fresh-water organic clams, and hundreds of gallons of fresh organic compost.

The large moat on the interior of the greenhouse contains large amounts of organic matter and algae which will not only act as nutrients for plant growth and fish food, but will also be collected in an anaerobic digester and turned into natural gas. This gas will be used to run a generator as well as any natural gas appliances, allowing for near complete self-sufficiency.

When our project is complete enough, we hope to open our doors as an educational facility to teach interested people about the many different ways we will be utilizing nature to provide as many comforts for ourselves as we can, such as clean water, sustainable electricity, fresh organic produce, and much more!

This is hopefully the beginning of a global network of self-sustainable, living eco-sanctuaries! The money we are asking for will allow us to realize our vision for the future here on our property, at least for the 2015 warm season. To be completely honest, our dreams and visions are endless and we plan on spending the rest of our lives adding to this sanctuary, so this is a never ending campaign.



2015 OBJECTIVES

  • Complete aquaponic bioenergy greenhouse system setup and startup - $25,000

    • Remove six, 55gal. Compost bins and replace with two new, 220gal. heavy duty bins

    • Clean large pile of pea gravel for growing media

    • Fill over 600 net-pots with pea gravel and place in open spaces in aquaponic system

    • Complete balancing and leveling of water flow in aquaponics system

    • Complete setup of anaerobic digester

    • Fill digester with biomass and begin natural gas production

    • Wash greenhouse windows and repair winter damage

    • Complete fragmented parabolic reflector surrounding greenhouse

    • Plant first crops of 2015

    • Build 4 or more trellis designs for variety of growth in greenhouse

    • Collect mass amounts of organic compost

    • Create and implement biodynamic fertilizer solutions

    • Stock central fish pond

    • Stock fresh water clams

    • Stock top gutter system with legumes (nitrogen-fixing plants)

  • Complete construction of wooden geodesic dome and connecting facility - $50,000

    • Wooden floor above cellar

    • Wooden framework for breezeway

    • Wooden framework for geodesic central residence dome

    • Sheathing/plywood for wooden roof and walls

    • Install windows / seal roof

    • Paint everything in white Thermoshield elastomeric roofing paint

    • Insulate using spray-in foam insulation

    • Install cedar wood interior panels

    • Furnish home with homemade furniture sourced from wood on our property

  • Approx. 1500ft2 south-facing “hot-house” outdoor permaculture garden - $5,000

    • Erect framework for greenhouse covering

    • Dig trenches for grow areas

    • Prepare raised beds

    • Design layout process

    • Prepare covering to extend seasons

  • Continue land grading and install leech field - $15,000

    • Road and landscaping around garage

    • Possible road construction for family domes

  • Begin edible landscaping in existing 2 acre clearing - $5,000

    • Permaculture design

    • Plant fruit trees

    • Plant berry bushes

    • Inoculate mushroom logs

    • Begin permaculture gardens

    • Beehives

  • Begin edible forest campaign - $5,000

    • Clean / beautify forest

    • Setup walking / ATV trails

    • Bring home-made compost and fertilizer to enhance growth of forest

    • Trim, prune, and clean up already existing edible plants to enhance growth

    • Slowly remove inedible plants and trees from forest and replace with edibles


FUTURE OBJECTIVES

  • Build personal family living domes

  • Dome stables for horses and other large animals

  • Indoor / outdoor exercise / yoga dome

  • Water tower / viewing tower

  • Private guest domes / bungalows

  • Dome gazebo /outdoor shade area

  • Tropical greenhouse dome

  • Doghouse dome for our meat-eating friends

  • Myco-culture (mushroom) dome

  • Vermi-culture (worm) dome

  • Bee Haven dome

  • Outdoor compost structure

  • 6x6 utility ATV

  • Tractor/bulldozer/backhoe


HOPES AND DREAMS

  • Self-healing and rebalancing classes
  • Sustainability retreats
  • Back-to-nature retreats
  • Guided tours
  • Music and art presentations
  • Classroom field trips
  • Raw-vegan "cooking" classes
  • Life coaching
  • Healthy local organic food truck
  • Guided meditations
  • Humanity classes
  • Sell produce at local farmer's markets
  • And more and more and more!

PHILOSOPHY

Our goal - 
Has now become, to integrate ourselves back into the natural life and world that we have denied ourselves of for our entire lives, and to illustrate the freedom, power, and creativity that this lifestyle and philosophy provides.

Why? -
To assist our government, as well as the rest of the world, by taking the fear out of the self-sustainable lifestyle and empowering and inspiring people to take their lives into their own hands by creatively using their time to directly better their own lives - when more people become self-sufficient, there will be less stress on governments and the private sectors to provide jobs, and once again high-quality, hand-made products and services will be available to the public.

Influences –

  • Organic Food and Agriculture
  • Tachyon Energy Products
  • Reiki Energy
  • Yoga Philosophy and Practice
  • Dr. Douglas Graham’s Philosophy, Raw-Veganism
  • Zen Buddhism, Alan Watts
  • Rudolph Steiner’s Philosophy (Anthroposophy), Biodynamics
  • Dr. Sebi’s philosophy, the Mucousless Diet
  • Matrix Energetics, Quantum Mechanics
  • Wilhelm Reich, Functionalism
  • Entrepreneurship
  • Abraham-Hicks
  • Shen-Ku
  • Sri Yukteswar’s Holy Science
  • Ancient Secret of the Flower of Life
  • Messages From Water
  • And Many, Many More!

Abraham-Hicks
Shen-Ku
Sri Yukteswar’s Holy Science
Ancient Secret of the Flower of Life
Messages From Water
And Many, Many More!

story:
“What could our lives and our children’s lives be like if our days and nights were as immersed in nature as they are in technology?” - 

Richard Louv, Last Child in the Woods: Saving Our Children from Nature-Deficit Disorder


OUR MISSION
Langley Forest School is dedicated to fostering self-discovery and environmental awareness by allowing children to reconnect with nature through play and place-based, holistic learning experiences. 

Our mission is to reconnect children with our ever changing environment, while creating a base of knowledge surrounding the importance of community and sustainability. Our village-minded school meets a child's needs for self-esteem and leadership skills, in addition to meeting a community need for alternative early learning options.

OUR CORE VALUES

Play-based learning
We believe that children should be allowed to develop at their own pace and to the fullest of their ability.​ We believe that by having choice in play, they learn and grow in their own unique way.​ This develops important skills that lay the foundations for reading, writing and mathematics, problem-solving and decision-making, social and emotional growth and many other skills needed throughout their lives.

Environmental Sustainability
We believe that it is our responsibility to care for and protect our environment. We believe that this desire to preserve our natural spaces begins by developing our innate curiosities and nurturing our bodies by spending as much time outside as possible. Our aim is to create a learning environment that captivates little minds without overwhelming or over stimulating them.

Parent Involvement
We believe that parent involvement in preschool fosters a child’s sense of self-worth and security, and strengthens parenting skills. We value the importance of family and community in our children’s development. As the parents and teacher work together to build trust and confidence in the children, a strong future is gained for your child and our community at large.

Community Involvement
We believe in the importance of family and active participation in the community. Monthly field trips, family days and activities that include siblings and participation in community events are a few of the ways that we make this part of our program a reality for our children.

WHY FOREST SCHOOL?
We believe that today's children are spending less time outside and more time indoors engaged in technology-driven activities. 

We believe that as parents and educators, it is our responsibility to steer our children away from this "nature-deficit-disorder" (LOUV, 2005).

Since launching our forest school pilot program in September 2014, enrolment has more than doubled and interest in our school continues to grow. As we enter our second year, we anticipate that our student body will once again grow exponentially when we open the forest to our first Kindergarten class. 


BENEFITS OF FOREST SCHOOL

  • Improves environmental, physical, emotional and mental health
  • Develops fine and gross motor skills
  • Increases understanding of and appreciation for nature
  • Augments ecological literacy
  • Makes additional resources available for managing difficult behaviours
  • Accommodates multiple learning styles
  • Affordable and community-enhancing way to deal with school space issues
  • Promotes safe risk-taking, and reduces harmful and hazardous behaviours
  • Creates sustainable and healthy communities
  • Encourages problem-solving skills
  • Improves communication skills
  • Creates engaged and passionate learners
  • Motivates engaged and passionate educators
  • Supports creative and imaginative thinking
  • Empowers learners
  • Boosts self-esteem
  • Increases “school readiness” (when children transition into traditional school environments)
  • Provides greater concentration skills
  • Students experience fewer sick days


HOW YOU CAN HELP
For the past 46 years, Langley Forest School (previously known as Happy Hours Parent Participation Preschool) has been run by a group of dedicated and passionate volunteer parents, with funding stemming almost entirely from the tireless efforts of our families. 

Our 3 part Indiegogo Campaign will help us raise 100% of our $100,000 goal. However, there is still so much more work to do before we reach our final goal allowing us to form a complete Preschool to Grade 7 outdoor school in our community. 

Campaign 1.0 will bring much needed funds to:

  • Build small shelters
  • Hire teachers and staff
  • Provide relevant teacher and staff training
  • Establish scholarships
  • Provide financial assistance to increase our accessibility to all students
  • Acquire additional resources to meet the demands of student growth

Your donations, from $1 to $25,000, will ensure that our goals are met. Donations of $100 or more will receive a charitable donation receipt for tax purposes.

YOUR FUNDING AT WORK

  • Marketing (brochures, advertising, promotional booths at Summer markets and festivals)
  • Teacher and assistant salaries
  • Administrative wages
  • Training and professional development
  • Outdoor rain suits for the children and backup inclement weather clothing
  • Equipment (tents, outdoor tools, stationery and wilderness First Aid kits)


PERKS FOR YOU

All funders will receive recognition on our website donor page.

$5 :: Discoverer

  • A tremendous amount of gratitude!

$25 :: Believer
  • A special digital Thank You from the children of Langley Forest School

$50 :: Advocate
  • A special digital Thank You from the children of Langley Forest School
  • Recognition of your support via our Facebook page

$100 :: Crusador
  • A special digital Thank You from the children of Langley Forest School
  • A limited edition Langley Forest School t-shirt
  • Recognition of your support via our Facebook page

$250 :: Arborist
  • A special digital Thank You from the children of Langley Forest School
  • A limited edition Langley Forest School t-shirt
  • 5 trees planted in your honour via Tree Canada
  • Recognition of your support via our Facebook page

$500 :: Creator
  • A special digital Thank You from the children of Langley Forest School
  • A limited edition Langley Forest School t-shirt
  • 10 trees planted in your honour via Tree Canada
  • Two complimentary tickets to our 2016 Gala
  • Recognition of your support via our Facebook, Instagram and Twitter accounts

$1000 :: Scholar
  • A special digital Thank You from the children of Langley Forest School
  • A limited edition Langley Forest School t-shirt
  • 15 trees planted in your honour via Tree Canada
  • Two complimentary tickets to our 2016 Gala
  • Recognition of your support via our Facebook, Instagram and Twitter accounts

$5000 :: Visionary
  • A special digital Thank You from the children of Langley Forest School
  • A limited edition Langley Forest School t-shirt
  • 30 trees planted in your honour via Tree Canada
  • Two complimentary tickets to our 2016 Gala
  • Recognition of your support via our Facebook, Instagram and Twitter accounts

$10,000 :: Mountaineer
  • A 3-4 day remote backcountry lodge experience at Purcell Mountain Lodge. Fully catered, and fully guided while taking in stunning views of Mount Sir Donald in Roger's Pass
  • A special digital Thank You from the children of Langley Forest School
  • A limited edition Langley Forest School t-shirt
  • 50 trees planted in your honour via Tree Canada
  • Two complimentary tickets to our 2016 Gala
  • Recognition of your support via our Facebook, Instagram and Twitter accounts

$25,000 :: Summiteer
  • A 3-4 day remote backcountry lodge experience at Purcell Mountain Lodge. Fully catered, and fully guided while taking in stunning views of Mount Sir Donald in Roger's Pass
  • A 1 year full scholarship in your name will be given to one student for the 2015-16 school year
  • A special digital Thank You from the children of Langley Forest School
  • A limited edition Langley Forest School t-shirt
  • 100 trees planted in your honour via Tree Canada
  • Two complimentary tickets to our 2016 Gala
  • Recognition of your support via our Facebook, Instagram and Twitter accounts

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
As a non-profit organization we understand that sometimes donating just isn't possible. However, you can still help! Please help us get the word out about our phenomenal school: 

  • LIKE our Facebook page
  • FOLLOW us on Twitter
  • FOLLOW us on Instagram

story:
What will you help us to achieve?

At school we always hated maths and constiently struggled with it, it never engaged us. Yet wouldn’t it be lovely if you could learn the subjects most kids find boring in a physical and creative way? 

We want to deliver 64 practical 'Literacy & Maths through Photography' workshops to children in 16 primary schools in Brixton, South London. 500 children from different economic and ethnic backgrounds will benefit from the project in the 1st year.

Using photography as an integral tool this project aims to support the inclusive development of literacy, speech and language and maths in all children irrespective of their learning and linguistic abilities. 

Our campaign and why it's important to us?

Building on the success of a 3 month pilot project that we carried out in Spring 2014, we have received initial funding from a local charity to deliver a programme of workshops using photography to support literacy and maths in primary schools in Lambeth, south London, over 3 years.  We need to secure match funding to make this happen!

Learning through photography encourages children to explore their world as they photograph scenes from their daily lives. Their photos become catalysts for oral and written expression, and family learning. 

The project will take place in schools where there are high levels of children living under the poverty line where many children start school having come from a language poor environment. Many others are newly arrived to UK with little or no English; over 50 languages are spoken in some schools. Best practice in the teaching of English as an Additional Language or to children with a low vocabulary, shows that practical lessons using a range of prompts – words, pictures and sounds makes a significant difference to the speed of language acquisition.

Fotosynthesis will build 8 pop-up photo darkrooms in schools and introduce children to the magic of pinhole photography. Each child will complete a photographic treasure hunt, discover and develop their own stories and pictures. In addition, 16 teachers will receive training allowing them to continue to work with new students on future projects. 8 Family learning activities will bring children, teachers and parents to works together and learn from each other, giving parents new creative skills to support their children’s literacy and numeracy at home. 


The children will build confidence in letter shape recognition, systems of measurement, symmetry, geometry, statistics and creative writing through visual learning inside and outside the classroom.  

Why our campaign is important to us?

We are Fotosynthesis, a photography organisation focusing on visual communication and educational outreach. We believe that visual arts, digital storytelling and self-advocacy are tools for social change and that age, gender, disability and nationality should not be a barrier to equality and diversity in education. Learning through photography encourages children to explore their world as they photograph scenes from their daily lives. Their photos become catalysts for oral and written expression, and family learning. 

We have put this project together with the Brixton Learning Collaborative and the Windmill Cluster of Schools; 2 groups of 21 schools in Brixton, South London, that are working together through educational partnerships.

Following a pilot that we carried out last year, children said:

“Shapes are all around us” 

“I found it enjoyable, it made me want a camera of my own”

“It is fascinating. I wish all teachers in our schools could be trained," - St Luke’s Primary School, Year 4 Teacher.

 "I learnt to find the centre of a square."- Pupil at St Jude’s Primary School.

“The children were able to apply measuring skills in practical contexts. The use of photography was highly effective in encouraging/consolidating the language of measure. The children were able to recognise angles in everyday life. They are now more able to visualise the length of a metre and apply this successfully in other activities. Children are now more confident and more able to apply use of measure in an everyday context.” Olivia Tadrous, Hill Mead Primary School, Year 4 Teacher.

What we need & What you get:

We have been awarded £14,070 by the Walcot Foundation for the 1st year, this will cover the cost of workshop leaders and basic photographic equipment but there is a funding shortfall and we need to raise £6,000 match funding to cover all costs.

With your support we will be able to provide

  • Assistant Facilitators: To make sure every child benefits fully from the experience and no child is left behind
  • Digital Cameras: Although children will be expected to share, we do not have enough cameras to ensure that every child will has enough time to feel confident using one
  • Equipment for Pop-up Darkrooms: Equipment to allow each of the children the opportunity to develop their own photographs

What if we raise more than our target amount?

The more money we raise the more broadly we can share this ground breaking opportunity by delivering more teacher trainings to school outside of the clusters or organise events and workshops to reach out more children and parents. Or we could buy rewards for the children who complete their treasure hunts!

The Perks!

Postcards: An original design to send to a friend. (Some of the images on the postcards have been taken with a box and created by children using shapes to make words!)

Cyanotype solar paper: Why not try sunprint? The perfect education tool that allows people to learn about composition, negative/positive and the physics of light – all in a fun, safe and playful way. Simple and fun to use Solar Paper, doesn’t require any chemicals or darkroom conditions.

Project Books: a great souvenir of your donation and a resource to use with young children to have fun learning

Pinhole camera making workshop: a day of activity and learning for anyone aged 6 – 99!  – a great present for a friend, a treat for yourself, an inspiring day for a young person. These workshops will take place in London. Children under 10 will be under the responsibility of their adult parent/tutor.

Printmaking workshops: Have you heard of photogravure, gum printing, kallitype or salt printing? Then Peter Moseley ( see photo below )must be familiar to you. If not, check him out! A Kallitype workshop with him at Fusion Arts Studio in Kingston Upon Thames, UK, will open your eyes to the exciting world of analogue photography and printmaking!  

Other Ways You Can Help?

Can't contribute financially? You can help us in other ways:

  • Ask friends and family to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Volunteer for this project!
  • Donate perks to help us raise more funds
  • Donate rewards that we could give to the children who complete their treasure hunts!

And that's all there is to it, thank you for your support!

story:
ABOUT THIS PROJECT

Artist Martin Munoz came to the United States 40 years ago without knowing a word of English. Today at 74 years of age he is sending 20,000 books back to his home province of Mendoza to create an English Library completely out of recycled books he has gathered from his Catskill Mountain (Upstate New York) home. 

By spending nearly his entire savings, and with the support from his relatives the books are now en route to Alvear Argentina. This campaign serves to help him gain capital to buy a property to establish an English Library/Art Center in Alvear Argentina.


Who put this together?

Hi, Otto Ohle. I am a student studying within the New Media department at Purchase College. I have been documenting Martin's story as a NYC legend, outsider artist, and his perseverance and struggle to create this library in a documentary photography book and film titled, "The Llama Man". 

I am documenting this story, however all donations we receive will go towards making this library possible.

Martin really needs your help. In his words, "This is a way to show the world a side of America they don't see in the media". Please help share this project and help influence new ways of creating harmony on earth. 

The money you contribute completely towards making this Library possible. I am prepared to help and document this story as it unfolds.

WHY WE NEED HELP - 

THIS PROJECT IS TOO BIG FOR ONE PERSON

 By hand and by himself Martin loaded a truck  container with 20,000 books which is now on its way to Chile via boat, and then must be transported to Argentina via truck.

His plan now is to travel to Alvear and find a home for these books. He doesn't have much money to put a down payment on a property or rent a building. We are asking for donations in exchange for his artworks and other interactive perks.

It is outrageous to have such a generous deed to humanity fall on one person. If we as humans work together to support Martin's effort, the story could inspire lives across the globe to make the world a better place.

WHAT WE WILL USE THE MONEY TOWARDS

$2,000 - Travel and living expenses to document this story as it unfolds.

$5,000-$8,000 - It is unclear how much it will be to have the books transported from the port in Chile to Alvear Argentina. We will need to rent a truck and hire a driver to do this job. 

$15,000  We are asking for startup money to find a home for these books. Funds will be used  towards putting a down payment on a property and buying a structure such as a yurt. 

The Impact

This is a creative and useful way to recycle books. As English is the second language to the world,  this library has the potential to expand possibilities for those in Argentina with access . Martin hopes to work with the community to create an exchange program and  have American students teach English and art classes in the library.

These books all are used books that Martin collected in New York State and City. Martin didn't know any English when he first came to NY, and claims that books are what taught him the language, and helped him become independent in the USA. 

*Together, we can all make a difference, Martin shouldn't have to do it alone.

This story of dedication and perseverance will also be documented in a multimedia book/documentary film entitled "The Llama Man"

Risks & Challenges

If we don't raise this money, the journey will simply be a lot more difficult to establish a home for these books. 

We are prepared to travel to Argentina and speak to the mayor of Alvear, as well as the Director of Culture of Alvear, other Art Centers, and of course the local people to work with the community to establish and English Library with English and Art classes for the townspeople. 

Martin is also willing to sacrifice his apartment in the city of Mendoza in order to establish a building for the library in the city of Alvear.

Other Ways You Can Help

First and foremost we are in need of capital to get this project off the ground. If you are not in a position to make a financial contribution, please share this story with those around you who may be interested or able to help.
Would you like to send books, computer equipment, come and make a bookshelf, or meet us down there? Please, with any questions, concerns, or inquires please contact us at

thellamamandoc@gmail.com
story_txt:
ABOUT THIS PROJECT Artist Martin Munoz came to the United States 40 years ago without knowing a word of English. Today at 74 years of age he is sending 20,000 books back to his home province of Mendoza to create an English Library completely out of recycled books he has gathered from his Catskill Mountain (Upstate New York) home. 
By spending nearly his entire savings, and with the support from his relatives the books are now en route to Alvear Argentina. This campaign serves to help him gain capital to buy a property to establish an English Library/Art Center in Alvear Argentina.

Who put this together?
Hi,  Otto Ohle. I am a student studying within the New Media department at Purchase College. I have been documenting Martin's story as a NYC legend, outsider artist, and his perseverance and struggle to create this library in a documentary photography book and film titled, "The Llama Man". 
I am documenting this story, however all donations we receive will go towards making this library possible.
Martin really needs your help. In his words, "This is a way to show the world a side of America they don't see in the media". Please help share this project and help influence new ways of creating harmony on earth. 
The money you contribute completely towards making this Library possible. I am prepared to help and document this story as it unfolds.   WHY WE NEED HELP - 

THIS PROJECT IS TOO BIG FOR ONE PERSON  By hand and by himself Martin loaded a truck  container with 20,000 books which is now on its way to Chile via boat, and then must be transported to Argentina via truck.
His plan now is to travel to Alvear and find a home for these books. He doesn't have much money to put a down payment on a property or rent a building. We are asking for donations in exchange for his artworks and other interactive perks.
It is outrageous to have such a generous deed to humanity fall on one person. If we as humans work together to support Martin's effort, the story could inspire lives across the globe to make the world a better place.


WHAT WE WILL USE THE MONEY TOWARDS


$2,000 - Travel and living expenses to document this story as it unfolds.
$5,000-$8,000 - It is unclear how much it will be to have the books transported from the port in Chile to Alvear Argentina. We will need to rent a truck and hire a driver to do this job. 
$15,000  We are asking for startup money to find a home for these books. Funds will be used  towards putting a down payment on a property and buying a structure such as a yurt. 
    The Impact This is a creative and useful way to recycle books. As English is the second language to the world,  this library has the potential to expand possibilities for those in Argentina with access . Martin hopes to work with the community to create an exchange program and  have American students teach English and art classes in the library.
These books all are used books that Martin collected in New York State and City. Martin didn't know any English when he first came to NY, and claims that books are what taught him the language, and helped him become independent in the USA. 
*Together, we can all make a difference, Martin shouldn't have to do it alone.
This story of dedication and perseverance will also be documented in a multimedia book/documentary film entitled "The Llama Man"
    Risks & Challenges If we don't raise this money, the journey will simply be a lot more difficult to establish a home for these books. 
We are prepared to travel to Argentina and speak to the mayor of Alvear, as well as the Director of Culture of Alvear, other Art Centers, and of course the local people to work with the community to establish and English Library with English and Art classes for the townspeople. 
Martin is also willing to sacrifice his apartment in the city of Mendoza in order to establish a building for the library in the city of Alvear.
    Other Ways You Can Help
First and foremost we are in need of capital to get this project off the ground. If you are not in a position to make a financial contribution, please share this story with those around you who may be interested or able to help.
Would you like to send books, computer equipment, come and make a bookshelf, or meet us down there? Please, with any questions, concerns, or inquires please contact us at
thellamamandoc@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

GaelFest 2015 is a family oriented festival which aims to be the preeminent annual North American festival celebrating all aspects of traditional Irish culture through music, dance, language, food, and Irish sports.

The festival is scheduled for Saturday, June 13th, 2015 at the German Masonic Park in Tappan, NY. Thousands of Irish and Irish-Americans will be there to celebrate a culture rich in heritage and tradition.

Proceeds from the festival will go to support the preservation and promotion of traditional Irish cultural programs throughout the United States through underwriting the efforts of local, regional and national individuals, groups and organizations by the GaelFEST Cultural Alliance (GaelFEST Inc.) a 501(c)3 candidate organization.

Come join us for what will surely be an outstanding annual event with the finest Irish and Irish-American musicians, singers, dancers and sporting events.  We will be presenting the best in regional, national and international musical talent, ceili and step dancing, hurling and Gaelic football exhibitions, children's activities and entertainment, crafts and artworks, vendors, food and beverage and so much more!


What We Need & What You Get

A world class event is in need of a world class fundraiser to cover advance costs, support the festivals planning and execution and ensure a successful event.

We have formulated a detailed festival budget for 2015 aimed at making the most out of donated time, services and materials while simultaneously limiting advance and fixed cost commitments to an absolute minimum. 

There are however, certain financial commitments that need to be made in advance in order to plan and undertake an event of this scale. 

The purpose of this campaign is to underwrite the advance costs and cover the fixed financial commitment components of our budget as listed below to help ensure that the event is successful and we have the best possible foundation upon which to build this event into the premiere Irish focused festival in North America.

Budget Commitments

  1. Marketing and Advertisements - $20,000
  2. Entertainment Booking Commitments - $15,000
  3. Stage, Sound and Festival Grounds Contracts - $5,000
  4. Legal Fees and Insurance - $5,000
  5. Public Safety, Traffic Control and Security - $5,000

This is your chance to underwrite your heritage and traditions!  In return for your generosity we have a nice selection of "thank you swag"!  There is something for everyone ranging from our undying gratitude to autographed commemorative items and culminating with special VIP experiences including meet and greets with the performers and an exclusive post festival reception and session.

Plus, you'll be first on the list to know about the 2016 festival which will be expanding to a two day event with even more opportunities and excitement for our loyal supporters.


The Bigger Picture

Admittedly, we are living in a bit of a golden age for Irish music and dance between an abundance of young energetic musicians and groups from both sides of the Atlantic and the popularity of entertainment juggernauts such as Riverdance, Celtic Thunder, Celtic Women, LOTD and many more it has been a wonderful decade or so to be a fan of Irish music and dance.  Dance classes are full in many locations, curls bouncing and brightly colored dresses twirling, music classes are available in quite a few US metropolitan areas and we are producing world champions.  Everything seems to be going swimmingly so why the need? What's the urgency?

While there has indeed been been a resurgence since the mid 1980's focused on traditional Irish culture here in the US it has mainly been focused on music and step dance and has been centered around the traditional bastions of Irish immigration (Boston, NY, Philadelphia, Baltimore, Chicago, etc...).  Step away from the neighborhoods of Crum Lynne, Breezy Point, Pearl River, and Mount Greenwood and it can be difficult if not impossible to find opportunities for lessons and when you do they can be cost prohibitive in today's tight economics.  Also, even in those very Irish-American communities there is an abundance of competition for children's interest and attention.  The cultural traditions need to continually be made relevant for each generation incorporating the "new and the now" while remaining true to the spirit, form, traditions and expression of the past.  And it must be accessible and affordable to anyone who has an interest.

There is also so much more to our heritage than just music and dance.  An Ghaeilge, the Irish language, is one of the oldest European languages in existence, it should be taught and preserved here as well as in Ireland.  The sports of Hurling and Gaelic Football are two of the most exciting, energetic and under-appreciated sports in the world and deserving of both a wider audience and active participants!  Our poetry, literature and dramatic arts are some of the finest expressions of the human experience in all its glory, humor, and despair and should continue to be studied, performed and expanded upon by a new generation of voices.  The list goes on and on.

Finally, even still today the true nature of our culture and heritage continues to labor under the weight of misconception, the broad-stroked color of cliché, and the ugliness, damage and mean-spirited slander of stereotypes.

The GaelFest Cultural Alliance is dedicated to supporting individuals and organizations who share our mission of keeping our true heritage alive and vibrant and accessible as well as those who keep it relevant and meaningful for new generations and who defend it's true meaning and significance. 

GaelFest, as an event, is intended to become the preeminent venue for showcasing this rich heritage to a wider audience and will serve as the primary fundraising event to build an endowment fund allowing for the support of our mission through grants, scholarships and similar underwriting based upon both merit and need.

We need your help to get off the ground!  Please consider all the enjoyment and enrichment you have received from your heritage and make a donation.  We are proud to be both American and Irish and draw inspiration and nourishment from both.

Get behind the movement and become a charter supporter.  Any amount will help and be gratefully appreciated!

Other Ways to Help

We realize that some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help or get involved.  We are a 100% volunteer organization and we are looking to start a movement not just an event.  You can help in both of those areas regardless of your financial ability.

  • Please help us get the word out about GaelFest and this fundraising campaign!
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to send this to your family, friends and social networks. 
  • Encourage your friends and relations to make a donation in memory of a family member or ancestor who brought your bloodline to these shores, their memory is part of our collective Irish-American heritage!
  • Consider becoming a volunteer for GaelFest either in an organizing capacity or on the day of the event.  You can contact us at volunteers@gaelfest.com
  • If you have a skill or a trade that you can donate (web design, social media, marketing, graphic design, communications, public relations, project managrment, etc...) and would like to be involved, please contact us at volunteers@gaelfest.com
  • Last but not least, we can use your encouragement, good wishes and positive energy as we head on down this road together.  "Like" us and send us a message on our Facebook Page showing your pride in your heritage and tell us how our shared culture has influenced your life!

Whatever your contribution or support , we say "Go raibh míle maith agat!"  Not just a hearty "Thank You" but more literally .........

"May you have a thousand good things!"

story:
The Youth Group

Our youngest members have been through so much, they have  experienced the atrocities of war, loss of their families and spent time in refugee camps during their long journeys to the UK. Their lives here have not been easy in the UK either. Many of them are destitute, not allowed to work, and they are under constant stress from the Home Office. 

But they are hopeful and optimistic about their future and have big dreams, as all young people have. They love their time spent together and many of them have found a family in Migrants Organise. 

Our Big Day Out

Migrants Organise would like to send a group of young asylum seekers and refugees on a small trip  to North Norfolk, to a wellbeing retreat and place of sanctuary called the Grange. Throughout the trip, they will cook together and share each other's stories, go on nice walks around, learn about permaculture and the amazing work the people at the farm do for refugees. They will also work on their poems and creative writing with the help of our friends from The English Pen. 

 The trip, will help them build confidence, and improve physical and mental wellbeing. This trip would be for 2 days, for up to 16 young asylum seekers, It is planned to take place mid July 2016. 

Help us in our mission to empower these young people to take control of their lives!
