story:
Who Are We?

Still Standing  - We are a Mozambican platform with interests in Sports, Culture and Publishing. 

Focused on training the individual, we believe that a multi-disciplinary teaching is the way to achieve Sustainable Education.

Always in partnership with the Mozambican Committee of Mini-basketball we intend to: 

  • Inspire children and youngsters; 
  • Shape conscious citizens;
  • Propagate knowledge and respect for Nature;
  • Promote a reading culture; 
  • Through sports (basketball), pass values such as:
  1. ​Respect;
  2. Character;
  3. Friendship;
  4. Team Work;
  5. Positive Attitude;
  6. Leadership;
  7. Integrity and
  8. Healthy Habits.
  • Promote respect for Cultural Identity; 
  • Search an inclusive and equitable society.

 

We have the privilege to actively participate in an important phase of development of the Human Being, on their mental and physical abilities, and their preparation to take responsibilities, and we do it with pride to ensure that we will have built a better Society and a better World for tomorrow.

 

How do We Operate? 

Mozambique, being an underdeveloped country, cannot seclude itself from high rates of illiteracy.

The main factors for these high rates are children dropping out of school at very early stages to be introduced into the (informal) labour market and thus contribute for the family’s income; high population growth that creates a huge gap between the few existing teachers for a large number of students; poor education quality.

The current education is not restricted to scientific queries, technological and economic development. It is closely related to Values ​​and the way we observe and understand a world in constant change. 

Basic education (1st / 7th grade - compulsory education) assumes capital importance because it may be the only time when children come into contact with the "tools" that will them live with the current reality.

Hence our focus on the age group from 6-12, by creating a mini-basketball nuclei in primary schools and neighbourhoods (mainly peripheral). 

We have allied mini-basketball to the environmental conservation and preservation and diversified activities as a way to provide more stimulus to the children, provide them with minds full of dreams, colours, hope and positive energy. 

In October 2015, we had the first activity within a conservation area - Niassa National Reserve - which we baptized as (in Ajaua dialect) "Kuzengwa Kwa Umi" - (translated to) "The Joy Of Life". It is an action model which we intend to implement in remote areas and / or difficult access, in particular in environmental conservation areas.

In Mozambican schools, particularly public, is very unusual to encounter the incorporation of playfulness, the use of libraries and other information tools. 

Therefore, it is urgent to reframe the role of the School as the first training agent to create a Model Citizen.

 

Why do we need help? 

Mozambique is going through an economic crisis and it tends to worsen. 

The economic agents are retracted or closing down operations, and the difficult process of raising sponsorship for these activities has become even more complicated. 

Despite all the adversity, we believe that this is the time that the mini-basketball movement should show all of its strength. 

It has been 10 years with some achievements gained with great sacrifice. The movement cannot stop. 

For the second half of this year (until August 2017) we intend, among many other activities, to extend the "Joy Of Life" to the Gorongosa National Park, the village of Mangundze, and consolidate the Niassa experience, where we left equipment for the children to continue practicing.

Our biggest challenge is to open four new centres with various integrated activities in 4 primary schools in Maputo - an experience that can be our base of action for the coming years. 

It is a continuous journey and we know that we cannot continue alone, regardless of our commitment and dedication. 

All of the raised funds will be used in the implementation of the activities mentioned below (logistics, staff, materials, etc.). 

This is our Dream and our Passion. So we urge you for support, in whichever way possible. 

Please do Share our campaign with friends.

 

Activities: 

Counterparts

If we are able to achieve our set goal, we intend on rewarding every supporter, the best way we can. And so we have set up support packages in the following order*:

  • $50 USD 

Expression of gratitude on the Still Standing website (after it has been created);

  • $100 USD 

1 portrait from the selection of the 10 best photos which will be taken during the various activities (delivered until February 2017);

  • $500 USD 

Special thanks - individual or company name – in 1 of the summary films; 

2 portraits from the selection of the 10 best photos which will be taken during the various activities (delivered until February 2017);

  • $1000 USD

4 portraits from the selection of the 10 best photos which will be taken during the various activities (delivered until February 2017);

Special thanks - individual or company name - in 2 of the summary films; 

  • $2500 USD

10 portraits from the 10 best selected photos which will be taken during the various activities (delivered until February 2017);

1 print from the collaborating artists;

Special thanks - individual or company name - in 4 of the summary films;

Company logo, if applicable, in the promotional material (T-shirts, web-based posters) on 3 activities.

 

* - The delivery of the rewards is conditioned to the locations reached by our local logistics service providers in Mozambique.

 

Please contact us:

stillstandingmoz@gmail.com

 

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZlKcXEBqQmKDg...

 

Siku ni Siku - One day at a Time!!!

Greetings!

My name Alexander Khoroshavin, and I am living in a grim and cold country called Russia. I am a 4 year student  in Herzen State Pedagogical University of Russia of IT faculty. And despite all difficulties with my professors I convinced them that an educational game is an absolutely awesome project for my graduate thesis. Yes this game not jsut a game, but also my graduate work, so I spend all my time to make this game as perfect as possible. The main aim of this game is to teach everybody, who interested in programming, how to program. Simple, isn't it. I am a big lover of games. I played thousthands of them, and because of it I know how to create a really interesting game with story, characters and atmosphere. And,as I said above, I am studying in a Pedagogical University, so I understand how to combine a real gameplay and educational information. Algotica combines all common principles of programming, such as: simple commands, conditions, loops, assigment and object-oriented programming. If you don't know what these words mean than you are in the right place! 

Why do I need support?

Well, it's kinda sad to say that I even do not have money to buy Steam developer account to publish the game in Steam when it will be completed.
And it costs only 100$. So... why do I need more? 
Well, I will be able to contribute the game not only via Steam store but also via Google Play, App Store and many other markets. 

The problem is that I am the only developer, artist, 3-d modeler and a composer of this game. And I'm not sure that this venture will bring me some support, because I am using crowdfunding for the first time.Still if I get support I will use all money to improve all aspects of the game (new audio equipment for recording music and sound or a drawing tablet to improve graphics aspect of the game). 

I am sure that I won't leave this development uncompleted, because, it is my thesis work and I am responsible for it. 







Release Date 

The game will be realeased in summer 2016.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to find out more information about Algotica you can read these articles that I wrote:
Indie DB Algotica - article #1
Indie DB Algotica - article #2
Indie DB Algotica - article #3
Indie DB Algotica - article #4

You can download the demo of the game, and test it. 
Linux:        

Windows: 

OS X:         

If you have any ideas or you've found bugs just write me back: alexgoodwin63@gmail.com

story:
CLIQUEZ ICI POUR LIRE EN FRANÇAIS


Oreteti is a project which documents critically important Maasai oral traditions and historical botanical uses and customs. 

My name is Lucie Hubert. In 2012 I have met Kenny Matampash ole Meritey, one of the highest and most distinguished representatives of the Maasai people of Kenya. Kenny asked me to participate in a beautiful project: documenting and preserving the Maasai culture  and traditions. 

Since the Maasai use plants for purposes that touch every aspect of their life, Kenny decided to start his project documenting these plants. We named it Oreteti which is one of the most sacred trees of Maasai land.

The uniqueness of this project is that it originates from the Maasai community itself. All Oreteti publication content and data will be dually published in both Maa and English language. An important goal of Oreteti is to preserve the Maasai legacy for future generations as well as providing a contemporary view of the Maasai civilization.  

Due to the pressures of the modern world, the cultural traditions and practices of the Maasai are vanishing. The plight of the Maasai has also amplified the necessity and urgency to document these precious traditions. 

The Maasai are a pastoralist people whose territory stretches on both sides of the borders between Kenya and Tanzania. At present, the population approximates 900.000 people. The Maasai represent one of the most famous indigenous groups of East Africa. They live nomadically  and semi-nomadically with their herds of cattle. They are well known for their hospitality and democratic community which blends a spiritual dimension and relationship with their environment. As other primary people, they are consciously aware and respectful of the earth and cosmos and feel responsible for maintaining a balanced world. 

Overall and in spite of modern life's pressures, the Maasai people have been able to  maintain this traditional pastoralist approach, and (semi) nomadic cultural identity. However their community is increasingly forced to situate in one location which is impacting their nomadic way of living.  As a result, the children are also attending schools where they are taught in Swahili and English and Maasai parents no longer have the ability to teach the Maa language and tradition.

That is why documenting this vanishing knowledge is so important. The project is also meant to give to the world a more coherent image of the Maasai values and  to transmit  their vision about their relation to nature and cosmos, and preservation of the natural resources.


Background research for the Oreteti project took place in Southern Kenya in August of  2015. A four person team travelled during a whole month though the Maasai land, from Kajiado to Oloitokitok en from Loita to Maasai Mara, meeting Maasai botanists and elders, gathering photos, taking notes and conducting  interviews. To date, this research has been made possible thanks to funding from the French foundation Fondation Denis Guichard.

Now we need your help to continue our work. Your contributions will support further research, the production, lay out and  printing of  an encyclopedia in Maa and English. This encyclopedia will overview approximately 100 edible, medicinal, veterinary and ceremonial Maasai plants and trees which support the life of the Maasai people. About 250 color illustrated pages will be made exclusively available as a result of this project. We hope to publish it in the spring of 2017. We are very thankful for all contributions!

Kenny Matampash ole Meritey: initiator of the project. Executive director of the NGO Neighbours Initiative Alliance. Has been through all the stages of Maasai initiation. Studied Democracy and Governance in Europe and North America. Regularly contributes to the UN workgroup and the World Bank on indigenous people and pastoral ecology. Received two honorary awards : HSC from the President of Kenya and an Honorary Doctorate from Capetown University.

Kone Romero Matampash: logistic assistant and driver. Student at Eldoret Agricultural University.

Lucie Hubert: writer and researcher for the project. Has worked as a journalist at Radio Nederland (Africa department). Co-organized meetings of representatives of native people and scientists for the Fondation Denis-Guichard. She is also a phytotherapist.

Elza Kortenoever: photographer and research assistant for the project. Master of History at the University of Amsterdam. 

—————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————
FRANÇAIS

Oreteti est un projet destiné à documenter la tradition orale Maasaï à travers l’usage, la valeur et la signification des plantes. 

L’Oreteti est l’un des grands arbres sacrés du peuple Maasaï.

Je m’appelle Lucie Hubert. En 2012 j’ai rencontré Kenny Matampash ole Meritey, l’un des porte-parole les plus importants du peuple Maasaï au Kenya. Kenny m’a demandé de participer à un projet d’envergure : documenter sa culture afin de la préserver. C’est la première fois dans l’histoire des Maasaï qu’une initiative visant à recueillir et transcrire leurs savoirs traditionnels voit le jour au sein même de leur communauté. 

Parce que les Maasaï utilisent les plantes dans toutes les dimensions de leur vie, Kenny a décidé de commencer par l'étude de celles-ci.

Oreteti a pour but la transmission de cette connaissance aux jeunes générations Maasaï. Il donnera également au reste du monde une image plus complète et cohérente de la culture Maasaï que celle qui est généralement véhiculée. Il transmettra la vision Maasaï de la relation entre les humains, la nature et le cosmos, ainsi que la nécessité vitale de préserver les ressources naturelles. Les données seront publiées en langue maa et en langue anglaise.

Les valeurs culturelles du peuple Maasaï sont en train de disparaître à cause des pressions du monde moderne. Il est aujourd’hui urgent de les documenter et de les transcrire. Les Maasaï sont un peuple de pasteurs dont le territoire s’étend de chaque côté de la frontière entre le Kenya et la Tanzanie. Ils sont environ 900 000. C’est l’une des ethnies les plus connues de l’Afrique de l’Est. Ils mènent une vie nomade ou semi-nomade, entourés de leur cheptel de vaches et de petit bétail et ils sont connus pour leur sens de l’hospitalité et leur organisation démocratique fondée sur une dimension spirituelle des relations sociales à l’environnement. À l’instar des autres peuples premiers, ils se savent reliés à la terre et au cosmos et se sentent responsables du maintien de l’équilibre du monde et de la protection de la nature.

Les Maasaï ont su jusqu’à présent préserver en grande partie leur mode de vie traditionnel et leur identité culturelle. Mais aujourd’hui leur culture est en danger pour deux raisons:

- le rétrécissement de leurs terres, par la vente ou les expropriations, qui a pour conséquence la fin du nomadisme ;

- l’obligation de la scolarisation en langues swahili et anglaise pour les enfants Maasaï, ce qui entraîne la désintégration de la tradition orale en langue maa. Or on sait que toute langue maternelle est porteuse de concepts culturels spécifiques à un peuple et donc uniques. Si la langue maa disparaît, disparaissent avec elles les valeurs éthiques et culturelles des Maasaï.

Les premières recherches pour le projet ont eu lieu en août 2015. Notre petite équipe de quatre personnes a sillonné le pays Maasaï au sud du Kenya pendant un mois, de Kajiado à Oloitokitok et de Loïta au Maasai Mara. Nous avons rencontré des botanistes Maasaï et des Anciens, nous avons pris des notes, fait des photos et filmé des interviews. Cette recherche a pu se faire grâce au soutien de la Fondation Denis Guichard (France).

À présent nous avons besoin de votre aide financière pour la transcription, la traduction et la publication des données que nous avons recueillies.

Vos contributions aideront à payer : la poursuite des recherches, la transcription des données, la traduction en maa, la mise en page et l’impression de l’encyclopédie des plantes Maasaï en langue maa et anglaise. Cette encyclopédie décrira une centaine de plantes et arbres du pays Maasaï avec leurs différents usages dans la vie et la culture de ce peuple. Elle comprendra environ 250 pages et de nombreuses photos en couleur. Nous espérons la publier au printemps 2017.

D'avance un  grand merci pour votre contribution !

Kenny Matampash ole Meritey: Membre de la communauté Maasaï, il est l’initiateur du projet. A reçu les enseignements complets de la tradition Maasaï. Directeur de l’ONG Neighbours Initiative Alliance. A étudié 'Democracy and Governance' en Europe et aux États-Unis. Contribue régulièrement aux sessions du Groupe de travail de l’ONU et à la Banque Mondiale sur les Peuples autochtones et  l’écologie pastorale. A reçu deux distinctions : HSC du Président du Kenya et le titre de docteur Honoris Causa de l’Université de Capetown (Afrique du Sud).

Lucie Hubert: Écrivain, phytothérapeute et homéopathe. A effectué la recherche pour ce projet. A travaillé à Radio Nederland (section Afrique) en tant que speaker et journaliste et participé à l’organisation de rencontres internationales entre scientifiques et peuples premiers pour la Fondation Denis Guichard.

Kone Romero Matampash: Assistant logistique et chauffeur. Étudiant à l’université d’Agriculture d’Eldoret (Kenya).

Elza Kortenoever: Photographe et assistante de recherche. Maîtrise d’histoire à l’Université d’Amsterdam.

story:
Short Summary

I'm Raúl Parada Medina and I'm studying a PhD degree at the Universitat Pompeu Fabra in Barcelona, Spain.  Since I was a child I felt curiosity about inventions and other discoveries. Therefore, I had the necessity of discovering from where things start. Thus, I prepare myself along all this year in a career to become a scientist and research new topics which can make a difference to society. This point between continue or not my scientist career can be determined on attending the main conference of my background. I would say, this conference will open me the door to that research path I was dreaming of since my young curiosity. I have already missed the opportunity to attend the same conference when I was accepted last year because financial reasons. Furthermore, it is well-known that Spain's investment in research has been decresing yearly. That fact, forces early researchers to move abroad or stop their careers.

What We Need & What You Get

The registration fee for the conference has a cost of $995 and the expenses because the airplane tickets, accommodation and transportation inside the city will sum $2000. I’m going to invest all the funds to start my research career on the topic I was working the last four years. I will do as much as networking possible with other researchers and industrial collaborators. In return for your generous donation to this cause, I will send you my deepest gratitude and I will provide you of items of the work I’ll present at the conference. Since I’m from Barcelona, I will give you a tour around the city and bringing you to the best local places if you come for vacations, business, etc.  

The Impact

The assistance to the conference may not generate a direct impact on you; however, it does to me by initiating a junior research career on a current topic as ambient assistance living environment to elder people. That fact will help to the increasing section of the population, the elder people. That means, easing their daily tasks inside their homes improving services involving their health and security.

Other Ways You Can Help

In case you cannot collaborate with this initiative financially. You can still help me by sharing my case to your friends. Even the smallest help, supposes a highest chance to assist to the conference.

story:
Our Story

The goal of our campaign is to help build a state-of-the-art 3D simulation development lab in Maryland to enable kids who are interested in programming and digital design to earn industry certifications & provide scholarships towards interactive STEM-related careers.

Your contribution will directly help support the funding needed to fully-operate STEMBright year-round as well as provide necessary materials needed for hardware, software, licenses and professional certifications. This type of educational curriculum, set in a fun and encouraging environment, is essential to cultivating creative and innovative skill development in computer science.

With the help of our strategic partners and through the generosity of individuals like you, STEMBright Studios is prepared to offer annual internships to young professionals who want to learn how to become the makers of tomorrow. STEMBright is unique, in that provides a tiered level of professionals who train our college interns. In return, our college interns mentor and teach our middle-high school students. This educational ecosystem allows for STEMBright to directly provide annual scholarships to college students while also providing senior capstone experiences for high school seniors in the form of apprenticeships. STEMBright summer camps and afterschool programs will provide Maryland's youth the opportunity to directly learn STEM principles from professionals and become proficient in applying cutting-edge technologies in 3D modeling, programming, 3D printing, Virtual Reality, user design, digital art, video game and simulation development.

Help us meet our goal by donating or sharing this campaign. Together we can help support a cooperative career pathway for generations of youth to develop into tomorrow's leaders in computer science, art, and technology.

  • We are Professors, Teachers, College Students, and Industry Professionals who are passionate about educating our youth in developing simulations & video games. Our team includes programmers and designers who have worked in the US Military to AAA video game industry, as well as taught video game development inside the classroom. 
  • Our goal is to build STEMBright Studios, an interactive development lab in Sandy Spring, Maryland to provide innovative programs that foster the knowledge and professional skill development towards careers in simulation, business, visual design and digital entertainment.
  • STEMBright Studios provides afterschool programs in interactive development, certification training, we host Game Designer's Camp in the summer, provide monthly game developer meet-ups, host gallery and gaming showcase events, and run STEAM-based competitions.
  • Students will become proficient using professional design tools in Adobe CSS, Autodesk, Unity, Unreal, Z Brush and develop virtual reality simulations with Oculus Rift.
  • Our staff of certified trained instructors provide the opportunity for students to earn industry certifications in Adobe, Autodesk, Unity and many more. 


The Impact of your support

We believe every kid should have access to the tools of innovation, like 3D printers and design software, regardless of income or status. Everyone should have the opportunity to experiment, learn, and grow. Your financial support of this campaign will help us make that a reality for generations for our youth in Maryland. 

Every young person who enters the simulation development lab will take inspiration and creativity back to their community and their peers. Programs like this are often kids' first introduction to design and engineering concepts not regularly taught in school. We hope to help inspire the next generation of great inventors, artists, scientists, designers, engineers and makers. Thank you for supporting  such an amazing, unique opportunity to build a collaborative ecosystem here in Maryland.


What We Offer

Our popular Game Designer’s Camp and STEMBright afterschool programs develop the skills necessary to pursue careers in designing interactive media and simulation development. 

Game Designer’s Camp and STEMBright afterschool programs offer the following:

  • The fundamentals of computer programming
  • 3-D Modeling and Animation
  • Usability Design
  • Simulation and Game Development
  • Adobe CSS, Autodesk and Unity 3D Certification Training
  • The application of simulation to education and workforce training
  • Immersive design for mobile, console and virtual reality systems
  • Internship program for highschool and college students

Program Tracks:

  • Technical Art: If you want to build your skill sets with 3-D modeling and animation and with integrating them into game engines, this track prepares you to become a technical artist who works with programmers and artists. The track focuses on 3-D skills and visual artistic design.
  • Level Design: This area of specialization is ideal for you if you want to improve your scripting and logic in preparation for a career as a level designer, who creates the interactive architecture for segments of a game. 

Along with each of the program tracks, STEMBright Studios provides monthly Networking-Speaker Series and Project Support workshops in which students can work on their projects with the dedicated support of industry professionals and STEMBright studio staff.

The Perks!

$10: The Sidekick -Exclusive Logo Decal

$25: The Supporter - Large Coffee Mug with Logo Decal

$50: The Architect - Your name/company name will be listed in our Credits of our 1st Published Video Game. Large Coffee Mug with Logo Decal.

$75: The Guardian - Limited Edition Signed Artwork (Quantity of 50)               Your name/Company name in Credits of 1st Published Video Game.                       

$150: The Patron - Limited T-Shirt, Coffee Mug, and Decal.                                Your name/Company name in Credits of 1st Published Video Game.

$300: The Scholar -Original 2D Comissioned Artwork. Personal Letter from our Studio. Includes your name engraved on Studio Scholar Plaque. Your name/Company name in Credits of 1st Published Video Game *Optional: Contribute your own idea for an easter egg to be designed in our 1st Published Video Game

$600: The Benefactor - 2-HR Adobe CS Workshop (Photoshop, Illustrator, DW) Original 2D Comissioned Artwork. Includes your name engraved on Studio Benefactor Plaque. Includes Personal Letter from our Studio. Your name/Company name in Credits of 1st Published Video Game *Optional: Contribute your own idea for an easter egg to be designed in our 1st Published Video Game

$1,000: The Hero - 4-HR Virtual Reality Workshop with the HTC Vive and the New Oculus Rift (CV). Original 2D Comissioned Artwork. Includes your name engraved on Studio Sponsor Plaque. Includes Personal Letter from our Studio. Your name/Company name in Credits of 1st Published Video Game. *Optional: Contribute your own idea for an easter egg to be designed in our 1st Published Video Game

$2,500: The Sponsor - Original 3D Comissioned Print Artwork. 4-HR Virtual Reality Workshop with the HTC Vive and the New Oculus Rift (CV). Includes your name engraved on Studio Sponsor Plaque. Includes Personal Letter from our Studio. Your name/Company name in Credits of 1st Published Video Game. *Optional: Contribute your own idea for an easter egg to be designed in our 1st Published Video Game

$5,000: The Partner: Exclusive 3D-Printed game character from our 1st Published Video Game. Early access to a beta-version of our 1st Published Video Game.  Original 2D Comissioned Artwork. Original 3D Comissioned Print Artwork. Includes your name engraved on Studio Partner Plaque. Also includes Personal Letter from our Studio. *Optional: Contribute your own idea for an easter egg to be designed in our 1st Published Video Game

Find our Campaign On:

Facebook: www.facebook.com/stembrightcenter

Website: www.STEMBright.org

annual internships to young professionals who want to learn how to become the
makers of tomorrow. STEMBright is unique, in that provides a tiered level of professionals who train our college interns. In return, our college interns mentor and teach our middle-high school students. This educational ecosystem allows for STEMBright to directly provide annual scholarships to college students while also providing senior capstone experiences for high school seniors in the form of apprenticeships. STEMBright summer camps and afterschool programs will provide
Maryland's youth the opportunity to directly learn STEM principles
from professionals and become proficient in applying
cutting-edge technologies in 3D modeling, programming, 3D printing, Virtual Reality,
user design, digital art, video game and simulation development.
Help us meet our goal by donating or sharing this
campaign. Together we can help support a cooperative career pathway for
generations of youth to develop into tomorrow's leaders in computer science,
art, and technology.

We are
     Professors, Teachers, College Students, and Industry Professionals
     who are passionate about educating our youth in developing simulations
     & video games. Our team includes programmers and designers who have
     worked in the US Military to AAA video game industry, as well as taught video game
     development inside the classroom. 
Our
     goal is to build STEMBright Studios, an interactive development lab in Sandy
     Spring, Maryland to provide innovative programs that foster the knowledge
     and professional skill development towards careers in simulation,
     business, visual design and digital entertainment.
STEMBright
     Studios provides afterschool programs in interactive development, certification
     training, we host Game Designer's Camp in the summer,
     provide monthly game developer meet-ups, host gallery and
     gaming showcase events, and run STEAM-based competitions.
Students
     will become proficient using professional design tools in Adobe CSS,
     Autodesk, Unity, Unreal, Z Brush and develop virtual reality
     simulations with Oculus Rift.
Our
     staff of certified trained instructors provide the opportunity for
     students to earn industry certifications in Adobe, Autodesk, Unity and many more. 


The Impact of your support
We believe every kid should have access to the tools of
innovation, like 3D printers and design software, regardless of income or
status. Everyone should have the opportunity to experiment, learn, and grow.
Your financial support of this campaign will help us make that a reality for generations for our youth in Maryland. 
Every young person who enters the
simulation development lab will take inspiration and creativity back
to their community and their peers. Programs like this are often kids' first
introduction to design and engineering concepts not regularly taught in school.
We hope to help inspire the next generation of great inventors,
artists, scientists, designers, engineers and makers. Thank you for supporting  such an amazing, unique opportunity to build a collaborative ecosystem here in Maryland.

What
We Offer
Our popular Game Designer’s Camp and STEMBright afterschool programs
develop the skills necessary to pursue careers in designing interactive media
and simulation development. 
Game Designer’s Camp and STEMBright afterschool programs
offer the following:

The
     fundamentals of computer programming
3-D
     Modeling and Animation
Usability
     Design
Simulation
     and Game Development
Adobe
     CSS, Autodesk and Unity 3D Certification Training
The
     application of simulation to education and workforce training
Immersive
     design for mobile, console and virtual reality systems
Internship program for highschool and college students

Program Tracks:

Technical
     Art: If you want to build your skill sets with 3-D modeling and
     animation and with integrating them into game engines, this track prepares
     you to become a technical artist who works with programmers and artists.
     The track focuses on 3-D skills and visual artistic design.
Level
     Design: This area of specialization is ideal for you if you want
     to improve your scripting and logic in preparation for a career as a level
     designer, who creates the interactive architecture for segments of a
     game. 

Along with each of the program tracks, STEMBright
Studios provides monthly Networking-Speaker Series and Project Support workshops in which students can work on
their projects with the dedicated support of industry professionals and STEMBright
studio staff.
The Perks!
$10: The Sidekick -Exclusive Logo Decal

$25: The Supporter - Large
Coffee Mug with Logo Decal
$50: The Architect - Your name/company name will be listed in our Credits of our 1st Published Video Game. Large Coffee Mug with Logo Decal.
$75: The Guardian - Limited Edition Signed Artwork (Quantity of 50)               Your name/Company name in Credits of 1st Published Video Game.                       
$150: The Patron - Limited T-Shirt, Coffee Mug, and Decal.                                Your name/Company name in Credits of 1st Published Video Game.
$300: The Scholar -Original 2D Comissioned Artwork. Personal Letter from our Studio. Includes your name engraved on Studio
Scholar Plaque. Your name/Company name in Credits of 1st Published Video Game *Optional: Contribute your own idea for an easter egg to be designed in our 1st Published Video Game
$600: The Benefactor - 2-HR
Adobe CS Workshop (Photoshop, Illustrator, DW) Original 2D Comissioned Artwork. Includes your name engraved
on Studio Benefactor Plaque. Includes Personal Letter from our Studio. Your name/Company name in Credits of 1st Published Video Game *Optional: Contribute your own idea for an easter egg to be designed in our 1st Published Video Game
$1,000: The Hero - 4-HR
Virtual Reality Workshop with the HTC Vive and the New Oculus Rift (CV). Original 2D Comissioned Artwork. Includes your name
engraved on Studio Sponsor Plaque. Includes Personal Letter from our Studio. Your name/Company name in Credits of 1st Published Video Game. *Optional: Contribute your own idea for an easter egg to be designed in our 1st Published Video Game
$2,500: The Sponsor - Original 3D Comissioned Print Artwork. 4-HR Virtual Reality Workshop with the HTC Vive and the New Oculus Rift (CV). Includes your name engraved on Studio Sponsor Plaque. Includes Personal Letter from our Studio. Your name/Company name in Credits of 1st Published Video Game. *Optional: Contribute your own idea for an easter egg to be designed in our 1st Published Video Game
$5,000: The Partner: Exclusive 3D-Printed game character from our 1st Published Video Game. Early access to a beta-version of our 1st Published Video Game.  Original 2D Comissioned Artwork. Original 3D Comissioned Print Artwork. Includes your name engraved on Studio
Partner Plaque. Also includes Personal Letter from our Studio. *Optional: Contribute your own idea for an easter egg to be designed in our 1st Published Video Game
Find our Campaign On:
Facebook: www.facebook.com/stembrightcenter
Website: www.STEMBright.org

story:
Welcome to the AOO SCHOOL in Siem Reap, Cambodia! 

The school was established in 2010 in Veal Village close to Siem Reap in Cambodia by local village volunteers and authorities to help orphans and poor children to improve their education.

In June 2016 our school collapsed during a strong storm. Luckily this happened at the weekend so children were not in the classroom. A small outdoor classroom is remaining, but during the rainy season it is hard to study outside.

So we need your help to re-build a roof for our classroom and to fix electricity so that children have protection from rain and storms during their studies.

Our goal is $1000 which is enough to cover expenses for basic construction and electricity. We are going to bring updates showing our progress during reconstruction as it happens.

AOO school is helping our local children to learn English which is enables them to be better qualified. Our activity contributes to the development of Cambodia through education and the reduction of poverty in rural areas. Beside English classes our school provides classes in Chinese language, computer skills and Taekwondo. The classes at AOO school are taught by both English speaking locals and foreign volunteers that kindly contribute their free time to help.

Mr Seung Pisey is the principal of the school and he has been a teacher of biology before. He has his own 3 kids and he believes that education is important for a successful life and that poor children deserve the same right of education as rich children. These kids are worth it! They are incredible smart and they deserve the opportunity to learn and grow into the kind of people who will shape Cambodia's future.

So we kindly invite you to get involved.

Additionally, for everyone making a donation of $100 or more, we'll include your name on an dedication plaque that is to be installed in the new school.

If you can help with a donation of any amount, it will be hugely appreciated. 

You can help out in other ways as well:

Please get the word out by sharing this page on Facebook, Twitter or GooglePlus. You can find share buttons up above.

Thank you so much to everyone who will be part of our campaign. For the incredible blessing you will be to our children.

Angkor orphan organization (AOO) school

 Learn more at: http://aoocambodia.org

story:
The Cognitive Initiative

The Cognitive Initiative is a volunteer tutoring program designed by The Benab Foundation, a social enterprise in Guyana. The program focuses on Math, English and critical thinking, working with disadvantaged students. Over its three years of operation it has helped over 250 students from ages 12 to 14. This summer we hope to expand to over 450.  

Every dollar donated gives another child the opportunity to attend the program! Donate today! If you can't you can still play a part by spreading the word about the Cognitive Initiative.

For more information on our program, visit our Facebook page by clicking here or please see a longer description of The Cognitive Initiative and it's history below.

 

The Cognitive Initiative


English and Mathematics have consistently proved difficult subject areas for Guyana’s Secondary High Schools, with national pass rates hovering well below 50%. On the other hand, students from the historically most successful schools, such as Queen’s College or the Bishops High School, have had a much more positive experience. Is there any way to link these two groups of students so that this success can be shared?

The Cognitive Initiative does this as it is modeled after a successful Pratham initiative in India, where well-performing students taught their less-fortunate peers. This showed impressive gains in learning for students in the program while, being volunteer driven, costs remained low. Further, as our volunteers are drawn from high schools, we host this program during the summer, when they are free to help.

Our program also provides important implicit benefits as, according to the paper “Arresting the Summer Slide,” by Swarthmore College student Steve McFarlan, it could also address summer learning loss. This phenomenon, where low income students lose learning time over the summer because their higher income peers are comparatively engaged in more useful activities (like summer camps etc.), is responsible for much of the learning difference between both groups, and is relevant because many poorly performing schools in Guyana are populated with low income students. Our summer program thus also serves as a great way to fight this continued learning gap.

There have been three editions of the Cognitive Initiative, improving hundreds of students’ algebra and grammar skills. Our students show sharp improvements in their scores and high knowledge retention rates by the end of the program and as a result we will continue to build out and expand it with each passing year. The Cognitive Initiative is a simple, cost effective program that is making strides toward improving education in Guyana for all.

Yours,

Elson Browne-Low, Co-founder

Robo Matheson, Co-founder

story:
PLEASE SEE THE GALLERY FOR IMAGES


Short Summary

Joseph Melvin Madeo was born February 2, 1985, in San Francisco, CA. He grew up in Sequim, WA. A gifted artist from a young age, Joe had his first art show in elementary school. After graduating from Sequim High School, he attended The Art Institute of Seattle with the help of several scholarships. He was awarded best portfolio of his graduating class.

Joe followed his heart & dreams and moved to New York where he went on to become a jack of all trades, finding success in fashion design, custom bike building, carpentry, and most notably fine art. A true optimist and visionary, Joe set his mind to something and did it. His positive attitude and mischievous demeanor remained even up to the very end of his life. Joe passed away March 20, 2014 after a 4 year battle with cancer. Joe made the most of his short time on earth. Those of us lucky enough to have know Joe will always remember him and his amazing talent.

In his memory, I am organizing (with the blessing of Joe's family and loved ones) a memorial scholarship campaign. The money raised will be used for the sole purpose of awarding scholarships to students from an arts school in Bronx, New York.  I am the Principal there.  If you would like to learn more about the school, please see www.ccbxhsm.org.

It is our hope that we will raise enough money so that the scholarship can live on indefinitely and become self supporting.  Until then there will be an annual drive.

Depending on the amount raised, scholarships will be awarded in a range of $500 to $1,500.  These will be awarded to candidates that meet the following criteria:

  • Enrolled in a 4 year college for the 2016-2017 school year
  • Have a GPA of 2.0 or higher
  • Have  demonstrated financial need*
  • Complete an application and essay that describes the impact of the arts on their lives.

*Students who are within reach of college but are less than $5,000 away from enrollment are given preference


PLEASE SEE THE GALLERY FOR IMAGES OF PRINTS!


What We Need & What You Get

WE NEED YOUR MONEY TO KEEP THE ARTS ALIVE!

The Impact

Help a New York City art student attend college! Every year, my school has students who are less than $5,000 away from college.  Yes, I've had students not go to college for as little as $1,500.  Isn't it worth helping?

Risks & Challenges

The only risks and challenges are collecting enough money.

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN if you contribute, and even if you cannot. You can help us TREMENDOUSLY by posting a link to this scholarship drive on your Facebook page, on your Twitter, and all of your social media!

story:
My Story

My name is Justin and I humbly ask for your help to further my yoga studies at Kula Yoga Teacher Training in New York.

I have practiced yoga for well over 10 years - when I first put on a yoga DVD at home and yoga'd along. I didn't really know what was going on, but I certainly enjoyed it! Eventually I managed to gather the courage to attend my first class! And I haven't looked back since!

In a particularly tumultuous time in life I leaned quite heavily on yoga to help navigate my way. One unique teacher saw my struggle and spoke with me about my intense desire to go deeper in my yoga practice and study. Subsequently, I found my way to Ashtanga Yoga -which has opened up my body, mind, spirit and most importantly, my heart - to the powers of yoga.

I have always had a passion for teaching. Through the years I have taught acting and performance - an opportunity to help people find truth and authenticity on stage. In yoga, we explore that same authenticity. By turning inward we examine the vast terrain of our inner selves and expose the good, the bad and the ugly - learning to work with whatever arises with compassion and grace. 

In attending this particular training program, I will have the opportunity to study with master teachers - including Nikki Vilella and Alex Auder! Beyond asana (posture) we will receive a thorough training in alignment and adjustments, sanskrit and chanting, and the opportunity to develop our own creative yogic voice. We will remove ourselves to the beautiful North Fork Yoga Shala on the north tip of Long Island New York to allow ourselves to focus on this important study. It is an intense training program that will go far in augmenting the knowledge I have already gained in my years of personal practice and study.

One big lesson I've learned through the years is that I can't do it all on my own. I bow to you and ask for your help in accomplishing my dream of becoming a certified Yoga Alliance teacher. Any donations received will go towards alleviating the cost of tuition and travel and help me to focus my time and attention on soaking up as much knowledge as I possibly can.

What I need...

The total tuition of the Kula Teacher Training is $3500 - however, I am not asking for you to pay for my training completely -that's crazy! I am asking for help though! My goal is to raise $2500 in order to alleviate the stress of banking the total tuition by the training start date on August 13th. With your added extra help, I will be able to pay for multiple train tickets (the training takes place over 9 days and 5 weekends), as well as course study materials and supplies, food and housing. Here's the break down

  • Tuition cost $3500
  • travel/train tickets $650 (estimated)
  • housing $500 (estimated)
  • books $100
  • 30 yoga classes $175 (required for the training)
  • Total cost = $4,925

Anything raised beyond my stated goal will of course be applied to alleviate the remaining expenses.

How you can help!

  • Donate now!
  • Spread the word! Share this campaign with any one you know who loves yoga. Use your Facebook. Your Instagram. Your Twitter! Your Youtube! Your SnapChat!  Help me by sharing my campagin! Anywhere and everywhere counts! (and it's no wonder we need a little peace and solace in this world!). 
  • Send me all your positive vibes and good cheer! 

The Impact

The world needs yoga teachers now more than ever! 

While there are outstanding yoga studios in Philadelphia, none offered me the opportunity to study so in-depth in a traditional fashion. By attending Kula I hope to bring back a world-class education in yoga and share it with the Philadelphia yoga (and artistic) community.

My hope is to be able to teach through a variety of means - beyond the studio system.

One very tangible goal is to be able to provide my fellow theatrical friends and artists the opportunity to take practice! As artists, our jobs often require late nights either on stage in performance or rehearsal, or at the serving or bartending jobs that supplement our income and allow us to practice our art. I hope to find a location that will allow me to create a class that caters to the artist class providing a mid-morning start time at a reasonable price. 

I hope to eventually be able to offer yoga to a new generation of practitioners as well. To bring yoga into local area middle schools and high schools - not only as a means of physical exercise, but in an effort to encourage mindfulness.

And in a very personal way, I hope to deepen my own practice and continue to cultivate my own personal transformation in order to better help guide others on their path.

Thank you for your time and attention to my campaign! Go easy and be well!

J

story:
City Wild Camp: Explore the true nature of Philadelphia


City Wild is a unique summer camp experience for curious kids aged 10–13 that offers off-the-beaten-path adventures and behind-the-scenes excursions to explore nature in urban Philadelphia.


Land Health Institute was founded in 2013 to explore the deep connection between the land and the communities that inhabit it. Our philosophy is grounded in the belief that healthy land is at the root of healthy communities. 


By providing urban children with the contact with nature they so badly need, we want to help kids forge that important bond and connect with nature for the rest of their lives. 

What We Need: Scholarship Fund

We want to provide this experience for those who need it most: kids from the heart of Philadelphia who most lack this important contact with nature.

That's why we are looking to build a scholarship fund for spots in City Wild camp and change more lives with the beauty of nature. 
We need your help to provide one full-scholarship and two half-scholarships for each of the four camp sessions. 
Each two-week camp session costs $990 per camper, and for each additional $1000 that we raise beyond our goal, we can provide another camper with a spot.


Our Camp

After a successful two-week run last year, we are excited to offer City Wild through Miquon Day Camp this year to expand into a full 8 week program. Miquon Day Camp has a rich history providing amazing summer experiences to generations of kids. By joining forces we can leverage both of our organizations' love for nature and discovery create a truly unique and unparalleled experience.

During City Wild, kids will explore Philly’s hidden gems, learn about the astounding natural systems at work within the city and explore most of the eclectic mix of neighborhoods that make up Philadelphia over four sessions: 
Session 1 - Art and Architecture: From Gritty to Sublime
Session 2 - Growing Stuff in the City and Beyond
Session 3 - Talking Trash: Our Garbage and Waste
Session 4 - City Water: Creeks, Rivers and Pipes 

Spots are still available for your own children, so don't hesitate to contact us for more information!



City Wild: Explore the True Nature of Philadelphia
story_txt:
City Wild Camp: Explore the true nature of Philadelphia








City Wild is a unique summer camp experience for
curious kids aged 10–13 that offers off-the-beaten-path
adventures and behind-the-scenes excursions to explore
nature in urban Philadelphia.

Land Health Institute was founded in 2013 to explore the deep connection between the land and the communities that inhabit it. Our philosophy is grounded in the belief that healthy land is at the root of healthy communities. 

By providing urban children with the contact with nature
they so badly need, we want to help kids forge that
important bond and connect with nature for the rest of
their lives. 





What We Need: Scholarship Fund

We want to provide this experience for those who need it most: kids from the heart of Philadelphia who most lack this important contact with nature.

That's why we are looking to build a scholarship fund for spots in City Wild camp and change more lives with the beauty of nature. 

We need your help to provide one full-scholarship and two half-scholarships for each of the four camp sessions. 
Each two-week camp session costs $990 per camper, and for each additional $1000 that we raise beyond our goal, we can provide another camper with a spot.

Our Camp
After a successful two-week run last year, we are excited to offer City Wild through Miquon Day Camp this year to expand into a full 8 week program. Miquon Day Camp has a rich history providing amazing summer experiences to generations of kids. By joining forces we can leverage both of our organizations' love for nature and discovery create a truly unique and unparalleled experience.
During City Wild, kids will explore Philly’s hidden gems, learn about the astounding
natural systems at work within the
city and explore most of the eclectic mix of
neighborhoods that make up Philadelphia over four sessions: Session 1 - Art and Architecture: From Gritty to SublimeSession 2 - Growing Stuff in the City and BeyondSession 3 - Talking Trash: Our Garbage and WasteSession 4 - City Water: Creeks, Rivers and Pipes 
Spots are still available for your own children, so don't hesitate to contact us for more information!










City Wild: Explore the True Nature of Philadelphia

story:
First, what our Sat is capable of:

Electromagnetic Radiation: we have an electro-magnetometer, capable of detecting variations in electromagnetic radiation.

Ionized radiation: we have a scintillation counter, that enables us to measure the various radiation in our satellites environment.  This is significant as it enables us to detect high energy particles, radiation, and other phenomenon.

Cameras: we will use two cameras with parabolic lenses, giving us a clear 360 degree view around our satellite.

Our instruments will allow us to scientifically verify visual anomalies with correlated radiation.  This adds to the burden of proof required for extra-ordinary claims.

Our Team:

Costs:

We have already raised $30,000 USD previously, and this has paid for the building of our CubeSat and our Launch.
Data will cost $3000+ / month, and we will be in orbit up to three months.  This is why we are raising funds.  Anything raised above our goal will go towards future launches, and this may turn into a yearly mission.

We need another $8000 USD Minimum for the 3 month data costs of our CubeSat.

Mission Objectives

  • Build a 2U CubeSat to search for anomalies in Low Earth Orbit

  • Must be capable of receiving command and transmitting telemetry and mission data down.

  • Experiments include:

    • Real-time magnetometer observations

    • Real-time geiger counter observations

    • On-orbit HD image capture of surrounding Low Earth Orbit

      • Capable of taking images in 5 second increments

      • Transmitting images down and release images to public raw(untampered/unedited)

      • Capable of coarse pointing accuracy
      • Global Shutter for capturing moving objects

LT Command and Data Handler/Electrical Power System Board

  • 32-bit AVR flash microcontroller featuring 512KB Flash, 68KB SRAM

    • Running OpenSAT FreeRTOS, lightweight multitasking architecture

  • Redundant µSD storage (2x 8GB)

  • Real Time Clock

  • On-board Temperature Sensor

  • 4x External Temperature Sensor(user mountable)

  • External(from µController) On-board Watchdog

  • USB Bootloader

  • Virtual USB for easy Debugging

  • On-board Inertial Measurement Unit - Magnetometer, Gyroscope, Accelerometer

  • Compatible with CMOS(UART) camera(TBD)

  • Compatibility with Lippert Technologies, LLC Flight Radio/Educational Radio

  • Compatibility with NSL: NearSpace Launch Inc. Eyestar Duplex Modem

  • Compatibility with Lippert Technologies, LLC OpenSat Educational Payload Board

  • Compatibility with Lippert Technologies, LLC Magnetorquer Board

  • Compatible with PC-104 mechanical Interface

LT Battery Pack

  • Li-Ion Battery Pack

  • Utilizes four 18650 series battery cells

  • 10000 mAh Capacity

  • ~7.4 V voltage Range

  • Temperature Sensors

  • Compatible with Lippert Technologies, LLC Command and Data Handler/Electrical Power System

  • Compatible with PC-104 mechanical interface

LT Magnetorquer Board

  • 3-axis magnetic torque rod system

  • 3-axis magnetometer

  • Coarse Control Pointing

  • Three actuators; two torque rods and one air core torquer

  • Current Sensors for each torquers

  • Telemetry over I2C

  • Detumble up to 3U

  • Direct analog control of actuators with direct PWM signal

  • Compatible with PC-104 mechanical interface

  • Compatible with Lippert Technologies, LLC Command and Data Handler/Electrical Power System

LT 1U Flight Solar Panel

  • 22% cell efficiency

  • Coarse Sun Sensor -ADC

  • Temperature Sensor

  • Protection Diodes

  • Voltage: ~12v

  • Current: 104mA

  • Power: ~ 1250 mW peak

  • Compatible with Lippert Technologies, LLC 1U, 2U,3U Chassis

LT Flight Imager Payload Board

  • BeagleBone Black header connector

  • BeagleBone Black with 8GB SD card included

  • Geiger Counter

  • 3MP CMOS Sensor Color Camera

    • 35mm lens/F1.9

    • Camera Mount included

    • 25.8 fps

    • Global Shutter for capturing moving objects

    • Rolling Shutter for low-noise, high-contrast images

    • Near InfraRed version with twice the infrared sensitivity

  • OpenSat Payload Software Package

    • JPEG Compression

  • Compatible with PC-104 mechanical interface

LT 2U Flight Chassis

  • AL 6061

  • Tight Tolerances TBD

  • Detachable Side Panels

  • Kill-switch mechanism

  • PC-104 compatible

  • 94mm x 94mm PCBs

  • Compatible with NSL’s Eyestar Duplex Modem

Now, on disclosure:

For the past 70 years, the topic of extraterrestrial intelligent beings and UFO's has been controversial, if not ridiculed.  Despite many sightings and events, government, military and media have made a strong attempt to discredit the idea of extraterrestrial "aliens".  And in the face of their apparent "disbelief" of the topic, the same military and governments have spent huge amounts of money secretly studying these "ridiculous" UFO's and aliens. Thanks to freedom of information, and the actions of many with first hand experience, thousands of documents, witness testimony and data have surfaced, making the ridicule posed on ufology by media and governments seem staged and forced, with a very secret intent.

To name a few reasons why this topic is important, and why it must be subjected to rigorous scientific study:

1) Countries are beginning to release highly classified documents proving their governments interest in aliens and UFO's.

2) Hundreds of highly credible witnesses have come forward with testimony that at least some UFO's are verifiable alien technology.  These witnesses

include a former Canadian Defense Minister, numerous astronauts, high ranking US military officials, pilots, ... Well, I could go on and on, but instead

I will provide a few links for those of you interested in learning more:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Center_for_the_Study_of_Extraterrestrial_Intelligence

http://www.siriusdisclosure.com/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7vyVe-6YdUk

http://www.citizenhearing.org/

https://www.youtube.com/user/CitizenHearing

What our project aims to do, is to use a low orbit satellite, controlled by us individuals, to study potential objects that emit high energy radiation.

Maybe we'll get data readings and pictures of solar-flare caused auroras.  Maybe we'll capture images of some very interesting meteors.  And maybe we'll actually capture a verifiable craft.  All we can do is try, and by doing this our way, we can open-source the data to you, the individuals.

Perks:

Name (get your name written on the CubeSat): $25

Data (real-time data - visual / radiation): $250

Data (get login benefits and real time data): $500

 

Join the Team (sit with us and build the CubeSat): $1000

story:
JOIN OUR MOVEMENT TO HELP ENHANCE LITERACY FOR EVERY CHILD ACROSS AMERICA

    


OUR MISSION
Our mission is to ensure that every child across America has an opportunity to maximize their literacy rates and strengthen relationships among teachers, parents and children. We offer workshops for parents, teachers and children to help make this possible.

                               


Our team is committed to making these programs affordable and accessible to teachers and schools across America, with a focus on low-income communities. Your generous contributions will go towards the creation of more workshops and the design/development of a new mobile App that is described in more detail towards the end of this campaign description.

                                           

      

THE BRIGHT START STORY

Raising student achievement to higher levels and closing student achievement gaps are priorities in all schools, all economic levels and all areas: urban, rural, and suburban communities.

A Growing Problem

According to a 2015 research study by the WSJ, over 44% of students (K-12) in the US do not meet minimal literacy requirements. The study revealed that more than 30% of all high school students do not graduate due to literacy problems. This disenchantment with reading & writing leads to increased dropout rates, behavioral learning problems and low test scores. 

A Solution

 Bright Start trains parents, teachers and administrators on how to strategically engage with each other - with the goal of increasing collaboration to positively affect the education of children and to help make literacy a reality for every child. 

                               


Specifically, Bright Start provides proprietary workshops for parents and teachers. We began with workshops conducted at local California schools starting in 1995. Today, we have expanded our program into 25 school districts in more than 10 states including larger DMA's such as  Texas, Colorado, Washington, Michigan, and Illinois. 

             

 Most recently, we signed an agreement with the International Youth Education Association (IYEA), out of Beijing, to provide Professional Development and other services in China.

What makes Bright Start different is our level of involvement and commitment to develop literacy. Bright Start is dedicated to providing resources and curriculum to parents/teachers, and to work hard to ensure that they make a lasting difference in student's life.

                    


PARENT AND TEACHER WORKSHOPS

Teacher Workshops

This workshop helps teachers learn strategies for developing positive relationships with parents. By fine tuning these skills, teachers are better positioned to get parents involved and increase the academic success of their students. The workshops also provide strategies for becoming a better teacher in the classroom and plans for how to make their classroom a positive learning environment where students can experience enhanced success. 

                                 


Parent Workshops

A series of interactive workshops enable parents to support the school’s instructional program and form a cohesive relationship with their child’s teachers. Workshops also strengthen parent/child communication leading to greater literacy development through effective parenting skills. Parent Workshops foster a holistic approach to a child’s learning. A few examples of workshop activities include - Parents learn how to analyze their child's strengths and weaknesses, build self-esteem in their child, strengthen their child's problem solving ability and how to help them foster a strong bond between them and their children.

                        


     

Our Team



How You Can Help Increase Literacy Rates for Children Across America

How you can help enhance student learning in the classroom and at home and get kids excited about learning Math, Science, Music, Art and English?

Your donations will help achieve these goals with the ultimate outcome of a bright start for every child and the promise of literacy for every child in America.

                      

 

 Demand for our programs is surging. We are asking for your help with our expansion program. Bright Start seeks to grow its teacher/parent to become a national resource. Additionally, Bright Start’s idea is to supplement its workshops with the development of a revolutionary mobile application.

This mobile App [Jump Start] is NOT yet designed or developed as we are pending funding.  The image shown below and the images within the campaign video are just rough mock-ups intended to illustrate examples of the App capabilities.

                         


Once complete, the mobile App will  offer a menu of interactive learning activities for parents and kids K-12. Jump Start is engineered to help parents be actively engaged in their children’s education outside the classroom. Based on the educational learning goals set forth for your child, parents can seamlessly select and customize activity games centered around Science, Math, English, Art and Music. The activities are carefully engineered to provide an immersive and interactive learning experience. These activities also strengthen the educational alliance between parents and their children. The App can be purchased on the App store or Google Play for $3.00 and can be used on any android or iPhone, tablet or watch.

The Investment

The funding goal is $225,000. Each dollar donated will go towards the following investment/developments:

  • Hiring two account managers who will be responsible for developing relationships with new school districts, and incorporating the Bright Start teacher/parent workshops in schools (grades Pre-K to 12) across the U.S.
  • A new App designed to enhance the relationship between parent and child through customized learning lessons centered around themes including math, art, reading and science.
A national educational campaign designed to:
  • Generate awareness of the Bright Start Workshops
  • Generate word-of-mouth “buzz” about Bright Start
  •  Increase consideration and sign-ups  among parents/teachers of the Bright Start Workshops
  • Build awareness and generate downloads and usage of the Jump Start App

This campaign will contribute significantly to make literacy a reality for every child and equip parents to be educational leaders at home. 

Any partial funding will be applied to developing new workshops in schools and developing the Jump Start App.

Your contribution will truly make a huge difference in the world. For every new workshop we create and for every new App download, we will strengthen literacy for children, which will increase their chances of success in life.

Other ways you can help!

We would greatly appreciate your support in helping us create some buzz by sharing this campaign with friends and family. 

Simply use one or more of the social media share tools located at the top of this page to pass along the word to your friends & family on Facebook, Twitter and other social media platforms.

Please feel free to reach out to Bright Start CEO, Gary Surdam with any questions/comments or ideas you may have to get involved. His contact information is gary@brightstartfamilyliteracy.com

Risk Factors

Although we believe that each of our workshops, and in particular our App, offer unique benefits to parents, teachers and students, there are no absolute guarantee that any of these products will achieve widespread acceptance by the market. We are confident these risk factors are extremely minimal, but believe it’s important to address in the spirit of full transparency. 

Thank you for your support.
Join the Movement.
Donate Today.

story:
With a motto of "Service Above Self," Wauseon Rotary's goal since  1962 is to have a positive impact in our community.  Our next project is focused on enriching the lives of children in our schools.  Currently, we are working closely with the local school system to support specific educational projects.  Some of our pending projects include:

  • Financial backing for the schools food bank to ensure that all students of need receive the nutrition that they require.  The food bank provides food with no questions asked to numerous local families.  Food insecurity exists in 17.2 million households in America.
  • Implement a program that educates parents on the importance of proper stimulation in infants and toddlers.  A significant portion of a person's intellectual capacity is determined in his/hers first 36 months of life.
  • Fund a school store at elementary level that will assist students with learning business practices.  From making change, to ordering and managing inventory, marketing, and price determination, our goal is to help students merge real life experiences with basic math skills.
  • To provide a rewards program to acknowledge and encourage students to come to school, do the right things, make good choices, and provide examples of excellent behavior.  In the typical school environment, a significant portion of time and resources is often directed towards students of high academic and behavioral need.  We want to help recognize students for everything from good grades to proper behavior and attitude.

story:
Point Alpha - Protecting and maintaining a cornerstone of German-American history

After the war, the world is divided in two blocs: the western democracies, led by the United States, and the socialist countries, led by the USSR, face each other as enemies. The front line runs right through a divided Germany. At the Observation Post Alpha (“Point Alpha”), the Americans expect the invasion of the Eastern Bloc’s troops. Because this — the Fulda Gap — is the westernmost tip of the Soviet area of control.

Point Alpha Foundation documents this confrontation and its consequences at the authentic site. This US observation post, preserved in its original form, the GDR border installations with the patrol track and Wiesenfeld Tower, a command and control tower of the GDR border troops, make the threat palpable. Several permanent exhibitions in the House on the Border and in the US camp, the Path of Hope, flanked by sculptures, and Point Alpha Academy make this site a unique place of learning.

View from the former watchtower at the Point Alpha US Camp


Expansion of the exhibition in the US camp

The permanent exhibition now installed in the US camp illustrates the development of the US observation point since its founding against the background of the historical and political aspects of the Cold War. In the planned extension, a new perspective will be added to the presentation at the former OP Alpha; one that focuses on the topic of „daily life“ and military/ civilian cooperation at the regional level. It will be titled: „OP Alpha and the Germans - German-American Daily Life in the Shadow of the Cold War.” In addition to the military presence of the American soldiers, it will also scientifically study the daily interactions and cooperation between Americans and Germans in the Fulda / Bad Hersfeld region in the shadow of the Iron Curtain, as well as explain and illustrate this story in the expanded exhibition. Using the new permanent exhibition in the House on the Border as a model, the new exhibition will include stories from witnesses from Germany as well as, and especially, from the USA. These stories will point out how well the US Army was integrated into German reality and the daily life of the German population. Objects of German and American origin and media such as old private films will complete the presentation and create a unique German-American cornerstone in the educational concept of this extraordinary learning site of history.

                            The layout for the new exhibition in one of the two former barracks


We need your support

The former US observation post Point Alpha „On Freedom‘s Frontier“, in which American soldiers performed their duty for over 40 years and which was only saved from being demolished after 1990 by citizens from the region, who were aware of its historical value, is a unique testimony of post-war German-American history. The interstate Point Alpha Foundation has assumed responsibility for maintaining this historical site - at the former border between freedom and repression - for subsequent generations in order to sustain the memory of the American contribution to the security of the Federal Republic of Germany. Please help us to create a German-American place of remembrance, based on our duty to our common history: Help us to finance our new exhibition and the work done by our foundation.

story:
NEPAL PEDE SOCORRO 

Campanha de arrecadação de donativos em dinheiro, para ajudar a reconstruir orfanatos e escolas nas comunidades pobres de Kathmandu e comunidades rurais afetadas pelo recente terremoto.

No sábado dia  25 de Abril, um devastador terremoto medindo 7,8 graus de magnitude atingiu o Nepal com efeitos devastadores, onde o número de mortos  já passa de 4000 e o de feridos 7500 pessoas.

(https://br.noticias.yahoo.com/terremoto-nepal-deixa-2-200-mortos-121306090--finance.html)

A Presente Situação

O objetivo desta campanha em particular é para oferecer ajuda imediata às vítimas dessa catástrofe em Kathmandu e nas regiões acessíveis e vizinhas da capital.

As áreas centrais da capital onde nossa organização atua continuamente, oferecendo suporte a orfanatos e escolas, bem como a  escolas nas vilas vizinhas onde também atuamos, foram danificadas e houve vítimas - com mortos e feridos. Até o presente é impossível totalizar esses números, uma vez que é impossível acessar muitas dessas áreas pois as estradas estão danificadas e interditadas. 

Muitas das atividades emergenciais estão concentradas na capital, onde existe o maior número de pessoas e por isso houve maior número de vítimas. 

Mas temos ESPERANÇA que, através desta campanha, possamos apoiar diretamente as áreas centrais danificadas, disponibilizar verbas para ajudarmos as pessoas nas vilas nos arredores da capital, além de  auxiliar os grupos de resgate que estão atuando no campo de base da montanha Everest.

A Organização Himalayan Aid 

A Himalayan Aid é uma Organização Não-Governamental instituída e documentada, que trabalha exclusivamente nas regiões do Himalaia, no Nepal e Tibet  para fornecer soluções de pesquisas, documentação e extenso programa que abordam as questões Tibetanas . Os dados colhidos em nossas pesquisas são usados ​​para construir e implementar soluções de assistência em comunidades específicas, para todos os grupos dessas regiões.

Nossos projetos de campo incluem  a implementação de saneamento básico, a  educação sobre higiene em parceria com a construção de instalações de água e saneamento básico nas áreas rurais do Nepal. 

Nosso programa "UM DE CADA VEZ" fornece assistência às camadas mais pobres de Kathmandu, financiando orfanatos e provendo-os de materiais educativos e outros recursos, trabalhando na prevenção do tráfico de crianças.

A Himalayan Aid irá usar todos os recursos captados para apoiar as regiões centrais mais afetadas e disponibilizar verbas para trabalhos emergenciais nas vilas que possam ser acessadas. 

Torna-se importante e urgente prevenir outro desastre, tomando precauções  contra as epidemias.

Para isso necessitamos disponibilizar verbas para comprar equipamentos e medicamentos de primeiros socorros, alimentos e água potável.

Assim evitaremos que as doenças comuns após eventos como esse, tais como a cólera, difteria, hepatite e tétano não se tornem endêmicas, que possamos reduzir o número de vítimas e minimizar as sequelas.

Esperamos que dentro de alguns dias já possamos iniciar nossos trabalhos de reconstrução dos orfanatos, escolas e casas que foram danificadas durante essa tragédia. Sua contribuição é muito importante para nós da Himalayanaid.org, uma vez que necessitaremos de comprar materiais de  construção e ferramentas adequadas para auxiliar na reconstrução da região. Sua contribuição irá ajudar-nos a amenizar a dor e a tristeza trazida por essa fatalidade sofrida por esse povo tão amável e hospitaleiro.

As fotos são dos nossos projetos implementados nos orfanatos e escolas em kathmandu e regiões vizinhas, bem como de nossas obras de saneamento básico. 

Outras formas de ajuda ao Nepal

Se preferir doar diretamente para o Nepal, existe um grande número de organizações humanitárias competentes que fazem trabalhos extraordinários, assim como existem outras campanhas que foram feitas especificamente para ajudar as vítimas desta catástrofe tais como a campanha montada pela CNN e pela PRI no link:http://cnn.it/1GiX17Zehttp://bit.ly/1GjrqTm. Todos eles merecem também o seu apoio. Outras alternativas são a Cruz Vermelha internacional, que está trabalhando diretamente com a Cruz Vermelha local no Nepal no link:https://www.redcross.org/combined-donate?donationProdId=prod9150029&retrieveData=1&flow=oc1e também a ong Care no link:https://www.care.org.au/

Agora é hora de recomeçar e reconstruir o que foi perdido. Faça parte deste projeto contribuindo e sendo a voz daqueles que agora se encontram silenciados.

Antecipadamente agradecemos a sua contribuição.

(A Fraternidade é a demonstração da nobreza de sentimentos e característica que distingue um Ser Humano - O que é capaz de sentir empatia e querer minimizar o sofrimento dos atingidos por flagelos e fatalidades.)
