FUN * GAMES * FITNESS * FILM * LANGUAGE * ACTING * SINGING * DANCEARTS & CRAFTS * CHARM & ETIQUETTE * 2013 & 2014 After School Art Programs (photos below)     
        
   In 2014 all of this has been possible due to our talented and dedicated Sr. Staff (above)  Jr. Staff & Summer Youth Employment Program Interns Range in ages 14 yrs. old and up (below)
 







What We Need - Project Budget

Without a paid full-time grants writer, we have fallen short of our fiscal goal. We are seeking a $2,500 or more in funds to assist us with our needs.  This will allow us to provide service of our One Day Arts Boot Camps ("IMAGINE") to be hosted for The National Center for Children and Families (NCCF) community of homeless residents, disadvantaged and abused victims and the area students. 

FUNDING IS NEEDED FOR THE FOLLOWING:

Ø.  Insurance 
Ø.  Supplies: uniform shirts for
staff and students; art and classroom supplies  (notebooks, pens, printer ink,
paper, pencils, paint, brushes, canvas, fabric, etc.)
Ø.  Technical equipment (camera,
printer, ink cartridges,  consumable replacement parts etc.)
Ø.  Literature: written materials
(printed handouts, banner and  workshop materials). 


If we don't reach our goal, we will use whatever funds collected in one of the above areas.  If we're fortunate enough to exceed our goal we will be able to use those funds to invite more attendees to the our Youth in the Arts Day "IMAGINE" (One Day Boot Camp). 


PLEASE DON'T DENY OUR CHANCE TO CONTINUE SHARING OUR TALENTS, KNOWLEDGE AND GIFTS ESPECIALLY, WITH TODAY'S YOUTH!!!!!
We want to complete our fundraising within two months to prepare.

Remember the "Art of Giving" can heal, thrill and send love and care to others! 
Use one of the perks below for yourself, a friend or to "Pass it Forward"


   
Other Ways You Can HelpWell, since you've made it this far, thanks for reading! Whether you are able or 
unable to back us financially, you can also, help us by sharing this 
page on Facebook or Twitter! 

(Photos below are from our After School Art Programs)

story:
We believe that every child should experience the world beyond the classroom as an essential part of learning and personal development and that is why we are making this one of our Key Priorities at Botley C of E Primary School in Hampshire.

The school is a small village school with just over 300 pupils ranging in age from 4 to 12 (school years Reception to Y6). We work together as a school community to ensure success for all our children and that they are fully equipped with the skills they will need to function effectively in the fast changing society in which they will find themselves, enabling them to live a fulfilled and enjoyable adult life.

This crowd funding campaign has been launched by the Friends of Botley School, the PTA (Parent Teacher Association) at the school. As a registered charity, all of our fundraising efforts are pumped straight back in to providing the children with educational resources and activities. There are so many items no longer covered by government budgets for schools that we, as the PTA, donate huge amounts to the school every year to fund school trips, library books, SEN resources, IT, sports equipment and art resources to name a mere few.

The school really feel that by enhancing and improving our outdated outdoor education areas, we can offer our pupils the chance to study outside and bring with it the whole host of excitement and learning that comes with this opportunity.

The plan is this... to have installed in the school grounds a 6m round Finman Outdoor Classroom with electric supply, along with improvements to the existing sensory garden, access pathways, and the potential to include some school 'allotments' and growing spaces.

Recent studies have highlighted some benefits of outdoor learning for young children:

  • higher levels of conversational language.
  • greater independence.
  • improved health and sleeping patterns.
  • greater physical competence and agility.
  • improved time focus on activities and more concentration.
  • a greater understanding of nature and the environment.
  • improved social skills, involvement and initiative.

The outdoor environment has massive potential for providing learning opportunities. We are extremely fortunate to be set in large grounds which could be used to enhance our educational provision. We don't want to offer this as a short term thing- we want to invest in a  lasting environment for future pupils too.
However, this comes at an estimated cost of £15,000 and by funding this large amount (nearly what we would raise in a whole year!) would take away from other items much needed by the school. We as the PTA have agreed to fund this on principal but do not want this to be at the detriment of the pupils when the end result would be such a benefit.

We are therefore turning to the crowd funding community to appeal to those who would like to donate towards the cost of the construction to benefit a fantastic and successful  semi-rural school, in order to improve education for the pupils.

You will note that we have only put a portion of the amount required as our goal as we don't want to be greedy! However, we will willingly accept more than our target and be rest assured that every penny we raise would go straight in to the project which we anticipate to have in place by the end of the year.

If you can spare anything, however small, please do donate and know that it will be improving a child's education now and for the future.

Please also share this to any friends, family and contacts you feel may be interested in our campaign! More details on the PTA of Botley C of E Primary School can be found at www.botleyfobs.co.uk.

story:
Goal: raise $5000 to organize a summer Camp for Tibetan college students in Tibet


“I want to see Tibetans become entrepreneurs, doctors, dentists, teachers, lawyers and be viable competitors in this rapidly changing economic landscape.”
                                                        - Tamdin Wangdu, founder of Tibetan Village Project

Tibetan Village Project scholarship program supports Tibetan college students through one-on-one sponsorship. Yarkyi, a summer camp to be held in Tibet this summer, is an opportunity for these students and their sponsors who wish to travel to Tibet to engage in a meaningful educational and cultural learning experience. In July 2015, seven sponsors from the United States will be traveling to Tibet for two weeks on a Conscious Journeys trip. TVP’s scholarship program currently supports 86 Tibetan students through one-on-one sponsorship. Given the dire need and priority to increase access to education for Tibetan youth living on the plateau, TVP’s goal is to increase our sponsored scholarships to 100 over the next three years. 

What We Need

We need to raise $5,000 by July 1st to cover students travel costs between their schools and the campsite in Kham, as well as food, lodging and program materials and supplies. Sponsors who are traveling to Tibet cover their own travel expenses, support students with their annual tuition and contribute to the summer camp as much as they can. If we exceed our fundraising goal, funds will be used to cover students medical needs and other out-of-pocket costs that may prevent students from completing their education. 


What You Get 

- Photo and story of a student 
- Tibet Gift Bag ($75 value)
- Video of the summer camp 
- A lifetime friend in Tibet

“When we support one Tibetan student, we uplift an entire village.  Knowledge is transferred and new opportunities arise for all. Education is the gift that we can give that will take nothing away from us in return.  If I give you my car, I no longer have my car.  When I give you the gift of literacy, both you and I can read.” 

-Sarah Schumann, TVP Scholarship Program Chair


The Impact

The summer camp is where sponsors and students will meet, share about their lives and culture and inspire each other through service to others. We hope this camp will not only inspire students to complete their education but serve as an inspiration and mentoring experience for other students. Upon completion of the summer camp, you will receive photos and stories of students whose lives have been positively impacted by your contributions.


Tibetan Village Project

Tibetan Village Project (TVP) is a Colorado-based nonprofit organization that envisions thriving communities on the Tibetan plateau by promoting education and entrepreneurship as a vehicle to address social and environmental challenges. The organization was founded in 2001 by Tamdin Wangdu to fund a medical clinic in Drikung, a mountain village in Tibet, after he lost his father. Several years later, TVP has expanded its program to other villages to support more clinics, schools and community projects.

story:
United Against Ebola is an initiative of the Global Shapers Community to bring awarness to the Ebola epidemic. As part of the campaingn, the Global Shapers Hubs in the affetcted area are leading a fundraising campaign to provide educational support to over 3600 children orphaned by the Ebola epidemic in the three severely affected West African countries of Liberia, Sierra Leone and Guinea. 

The Global Shapers Community is a network of hubs developed and led by young people who are exceptional in their potential, their achievements and their drive to make a contribution to their communities. The Global Shapers Community is an initiative of World Economic Forum.

Background:

Over a year ago, when Ebola virus disease reached the shores of West Africa through Guinea, no one could have predicted or fathomed the extent of its devastation. And the world was slow to act. Till date the impact has been overwhelming: nearly nine thousand people have lost their lives; over twenty two thousand cases have been recorded, and over 3600 children have been orphaned.

As Global Shapers, we recognized that if post-Ebola recovery effort is not initiated, it will affect Ebola survivors, especially children who became orphans as a direct result of the Ebola epidemic.

Ebola Orphans-the vulnerable group

In late October 2014, at the peak of the Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) epidemic, three years old Omu and two of her sisters lost their single parent mother and grandmother to the EVD. Omu who also became infected with EVD is an Ebola survivor as well as an Ebola orphan. She suffers from social stigma and discrimination, abandonment, lacks access to basic social services of health, shelter, food, clothes and education.

The Ebola virus orphaned over 3600 children in West Africa. Like Omu these children are left with no immediate family members, remain internally displaced and depend on community handouts and support. Now that school is said to be opening, Omu and her two sisters have no plans of going. Omu's only wish right now is "to go to school and start doing what we used to do when mama was alive”.

Join the Monrovia and Sierra Leone Hubs to provide emotional and educational support to children orphaned by Ebola  in the three most affected West African countries. 

Your kind donation will go a long way in helping communities worst hit by Ebola to rebuild and heal. No amount is too small.

Thank you in advance for your contribution and for spreading the word.

story:
www.pxp0.com/p4p0overview

P4P0 is a locally hosted music project to inspire and encourage creativity in young Ethiopians. An added bonus is that this project creates incredible unique mixes, tracks, and sounds - we offer these to you in return for your financial support!

Why does it need your support?

  1. 1We are taking state-of-the-art music equipment to Ethiopia, and we want to leave it there. But the Ethiopian government charge 80% tax on every imported device. If 4 people buy the £40 package - we can leave on device in Addis for young people to continue learning.
  2. The local team of 4 are working every Saturday on workshops and gigs. We want to pay them a small wage for their time to encourage sustainability. If 2 people buy the £100 package, we can pay each team member £1.9 per hour.
  3. Live showcasing events are essential to encourage a sense of ownership. They also strengthen the electronic music scene. If 3 people buy the £40 package we can hire a sound system for the gigs.

What is it?

Mikael Seifu and Endeguena Mulu are producers of Ethiopiyawi Electronica, an electronically produced sound currently coming from Ethiopia. Working together with Markos, Agar and PXP0, they will host a project to encourage creativity and inspiration in young Ethiopians.

Every Saturday for 3 months, 20 young people will attend workshops, panel discussions and events to learn about electronic music. Attendees will be from two brackets of society: those with laptops and those without, and they will work in pairs to develop friendships and support networks.

SUBSCRIBE NOW

story:
Thank you to everyone who supported our last fundraising effort. Your gifts have laid a good foundation for us. Our efforts were disrupted somewhat by the recent news events in Kenya as we took time to decide if we would move forward with this trip.  Those affected by the tragedy are in our prayers.  After much consideration, we have decided to go to Nairobi as planned.

While we did not make our goal in the last campaign, the donations given have laid a good foundation for this trip.  We're now launching a 'lightning round' with the goal of raising $4,500 in the next 10 days.  Reaching this goal will get allow us to purchase airfare for this trip. New Indigogo 'Lightining Round' campaign site: igg.me/at/KEAP2015

story:
Prevent Child Abuse America & Sigma Delta Tau

Sigma Delta Tau has been empowering families through Prevent Child Abuse America (PCAA) for over a quarter of a century. Each SigDelt chapter conducts an annual service project, educational program, and a major fund-raising event to benefit the prevention of child abuse. Over $250,000 was donated to PCAA in 2013-14 to prevent the abuse and neglect of our nation’s children, bringing our total contributions to over $1.7 million!

PCAA has introduced the pinwheel as the national symbol for child abuse and neglect prevention. The pinwheel represents PCAA’s efforts to change the way our nation thinks about prevention, focusing on community activities and public policies. Over one million pinwheels have been displayed since the inception of PCAA’s new pinwheel campaign.

PCAA has introduced the pinwheel as the national symbol for child abuse and neglect prevention. The pinwheel represents PCAA’s efforts to change the way our nation thinks about prevention, focusing on community activities and public policies. Over one million pinwheels have been displayed since the inception of PCAA’s new pinwheel campaign.

story:
The universe is full of colors. When we are fortunate enough to appreciate them, we can see more than 30,000 colors. And we cannot only see them, as we are also guided by them. They help us communicate and understand the world around us.

Still, we all know someone that suffers from some kind of visual impairment that prevents him to make a partial or total apprehension of color. Even if we don't, it's not hard to imagine how it feels.

Visually impaired people are not only blind people, but also color blind, partially sighted, with cataracts, glaucoma, or low vision. People who deal with obstacles everyday.

Actually, it's pretty easy to think about the number of simple daily tasks we perform that require visual sense and color recognition.

Choosing an outfit, going to school, driving, working, using public transportation, taking pills or eating. Basically, living.

As kids, we learn to play with colored cubes, to paint blue skies and white clouds and to eat all those green vegetables.

So, if you are not able to see colors, how do you do all these basic things?

One of two: you avoid them, or you are always dependent of someone. Both are frustrating and demotivating.

Unless you find a way to exploit what you have. Under normal circumstances, when you are visually impaired you still can hear, taste, smell and FEEL.

We believe that color is for everyone, that's why we created a change-making code that empowers the visually impaired to be able to identify colors through the combination of colors and shapes, which they can FEEL thanks to a relief in the shapes.

It's about inclusion, changing society and bringing quality of life to those who just see the world in a different way.

Using it, we believe we can improve the visually impaired daily tasks, stop discrimination and change the paradigm.



Feelipa Color Code is a universal and inclusive code that associates colors to globally recognized geometric shapes that are applied in relief to several surfaces and contexts, so it can be FELT, when cannot be SEEN. This way, it is approachable to ALL the visually impaired.

It's logical. We use the square for red, the triangle for yellow and the circle for blue. 



Black, white and grey are represented by horizontal lines.


  


Taking this as the basis, we combine shapes and lines to get other colors and the tints and shades.




Pretty easy, right?

For now, there are 24 different colors but we are thinking about developing a few more.



Worldwide, there are 285 million visually impaired. 39 million are totally blind. The other 246 million people suffer from visual disorders as color blindness, amblyopia, glaucoma, cataracts or low vision.

80% of the cases of visual impairment can be prevented or cured. We are here to improve the lives of the remaining 20%.




Feelipa Color Code than can be applied in all areas.

Stationery, technology, clothing, labels, furniture, medicine, software, signage, transports, books, toys, food industry, maps or inks.
 


It's a whole new language. That EVERYONE is able to understand.



We already tested Feelipa Color Code with an incredible group of visually impaired children that proved the code is easy to get used to.

It allows them to know colors as they play and learn and enables them to paint blue skies, red apples and yellow shiny suns. Like all children should be able to do.

Since it is a logical code that uses global concepts, we are sure that, regardless of the age, people get quickly comfortable with the way colors and shapes get together to create a universal new language.




We are an ambitious, enthusiastic and determined team that believes that design is a way to enhance people’s abilities and bring them together.

Filipa Nogueira Pires created the code in 2011 as a result of her research to make color accessible to all people, particularly to those who have some kind of impairment.

The investigation was carried in partnership with the Helen Keller Center (an integration school for students with visual impairment) where the code was tested with a group of children that helped adjust and validate it.

We are now looking to improve the code, not only spreading it around the world so it can reach everyone, but also looking for new applications, games and ways to generate more colors and utilities.



Our code is now a reality that can improve millions of lives all over the world. But for everyone to get it, we need everybody to share it.

We are responsible for each other. With your help spreading Feelipa Color Code, we believe that we can substantially improve the lives of visually impaired people, making them more independent and self-reliant.

It is up to YOU to make a difference. We dare to believe that if we all share Feelipa Color Code, we will make a change in society.



Feelipa Color Code is totally FREE to the end user.



First of all, your sharing is even more important than your money. Our main goal is to spread Feelipa Color Code worldwide, so it can reach as many people as possible. First, we want to implement it on schools, so all visually impaired children can have access to colors, as all the other kids do.

Your contribution will help us develop a teaching methodology for the implementation of Feelipa, not only in the programmatic contents but also in the everyday school life.

The development of the methodology will be carried out in partnership with an educational institution in Lisbon, Portugal — our home town. It will rely on the guidance of educators, teachers, special education assistants and psychologists.

We are aware that the correct implementation of Feelipa and a more enhanced methodology will require learning materials to support it. These materials will be designed as a result of the development of the methodology.

With only $150 you can be one of our Education Ambassadors and help Feelipa Color Code reach a school of your choice. And with only 1 share you are helping someone that is not fortunate enough to see colors as they really are.



We have lots of great perks for our supporters but we believe the biggest reward is to be part of a long-term plan to improve millions of lives all around the world.












One of our many ideas for Feelipa Color Code is to implement it in as many companies as we can, so in the course of time the code will be everywhere. Our color code will create economic and social value to your business and is an important step in your company's social responsibility path. If you want your company to be a part of this project, just CONTACT US.



Using our code is totally free to the end user. But you still have to pay for the applications like the Feelipa Color Code stickers, the learning cards or other games we have in store. They are ideal for your cousin. You can apply the stickers in his toys, his colored pencils, clothes and lots of other stuff.


We design to include. We create to change. Join us to FEEL.

www.feelipa.com

color is for everyone, that's why we created a change-making code that empowers
the visually impaired to be able to identify colors through the combination of
colors and shapes, which they can FEEL thanks to a relief in the shapes.
It's about
inclusion, changing society and bringing quality of life to those who just see the world in a different way. 
Using it, we
believe we can improve the visually impaired daily tasks, stop discrimination
and change the paradigm.




Feelipa Color Code
is a universal and inclusive code that associates colors to globally recognized
geometric shapes that are applied in relief to several surfaces and contexts, so
it can be FELT, when cannot be SEEN. This way, it is approachable to ALL the visually
impaired.
It's logical. We use the
square for red, the triangle for yellow and the circle for blue. 





Black, white
and grey are represented by horizontal lines.


  
Taking
this as the basis, we combine shapes and lines to get other colors and the tints
and shades.


Pretty easy, right? 
For now, there
are 24 different colors but we are thinking about developing a few more.Worldwide,
there are 285 million visually impaired. 39 million are totally blind. The
other 246 million people suffer from visual disorders as color blindness, amblyopia,
glaucoma, cataracts or low vision. 
80% of the
cases of visual impairment can be prevented or cured. We are here to improve
the lives of the remaining 20%.


Feelipa Color
Code than can be applied in all areas.
Stationery, technology, clothing, labels, furniture,
medicine, software, signage, transports, books, toys, food industry, maps or
inks. 






It's a whole
new language. That EVERYONE is able to understand.





We already
tested Feelipa Color Code with an incredible group of visually impaired children
that proved the code is easy to get used to. 
It allows them
to know colors as they play and learn and enables them to paint blue skies, red
apples and yellow shiny suns. Like all children should be able to do.
Since it is a
logical code that uses global concepts, we are sure that, regardless of the
age, people get quickly comfortable with the way colors and shapes get together
to create a universal new language.








We are an ambitious, enthusiastic
and determined team that believes that design is a way to enhance people’s
abilities and bring them together. 
Filipa Nogueira Pires created the
code in 2011 as a result of her research to make color accessible to all
people, particularly to those who have some kind of impairment. 
The investigation was carried in
partnership with the Helen Keller Center (an integration school for students
with visual impairment) where the code was tested with a group of children that
helped adjust and validate it.
We
are now looking to improve the code, not only spreading it around the world so
it can reach everyone, but also looking for new applications, games and ways to
generate more colors and utilities.



Our code is now
a reality that can improve millions of lives all over the world. But for
everyone to get it, we need everybody to share it.
We are
responsible for each other. With your help spreading Feelipa Color Code, we
believe that we can substantially improve the lives of visually impaired
people, making them more independent and self-reliant.
It is up to YOU
to make a difference. We dare to believe that if we all share Feelipa Color
Code, we will make a change in society. 




Feelipa Color
Code is totally FREE to the end user. 






First of all, your sharing is even more important than your money. Our main goal is to spread Feelipa Color Code worldwide, so it can reach as many people as possible. First, we want to implement it on schools, so all visually impaired children can have access to colors, as all the other kids do.
Your contribution will help us develop a teaching methodology for the implementation of Feelipa, not only in the programmatic contents but also in the everyday school life.
The development of the methodology will be carried out in partnership with an educational institution in Lisbon, Portugal — our home town. It will rely on the guidance of educators, teachers, special education assistants and psychologists.
We are aware that the correct implementation of Feelipa and a more enhanced methodology will require learning materials to support it. These materials will be designed as a result of the development of the methodology.
With only $150 you can be one of our Education Ambassadors and help Feelipa Color Code reach a school of your choice. And with only 1 share you are helping someone that is not fortunate enough to see colors as they really are.




We
have lots of great perks for our supporters but we believe the biggest reward
is to be part of a long-term plan to improve millions of lives all around the
world.

























One
of our many ideas for Feelipa Color Code is to implement it in as many
companies as we can, so in the course of time the code will be everywhere. Our
color code will create economic and social value to your business and is an
important step in your company's social responsibility path. If you want your
company to be a part of this project, just CONTACT US.





Using
our code is totally free to the end user. But you still have to pay for the
applications like the Feelipa Color Code stickers, the learning cards
or other games we have in store. They are ideal for your cousin. You can apply
the stickers in his toys, his colored pencils, clothes and lots of other stuff.


We design to include. We create to change. Join us to FEEL.

www.feelipa.com

story:
My name is Caroline De Chavigny, author of the book When Angels Die.  As a survivor of sexual assault, this is my true story of life after rape.   The rebuilding of a life while dealing with nightmares and flashbacks, mind-numbing fear, pain, the burning, boiling anger and an intense hatred is shown in great detail.  This book also portrays living with PTSD, attempted suicides and finally, the therapy that saved my entire family.  

     When Angels Die was originally written as a form of self-help therapy.  After receiving such wonderful reviews online and news of how this book has helped many people, I was inspired to start a campaign.  I wish to raise funds so that I can donate as many copies as possible to those who need the help and guidance in making the transition from being a crime victim to being a strong Survivor.  For more information, I invite you to visit my website www.CarolinedeChavigny.com
    

My goal is:

       My goal is to help as many Survivors as possible; therefore, to donate as many books as possible.


AFTER GOAL IS REACHED: 

     I plan on either personally delivering the books or shipping them to the shelter/organization.  I will keep this section updated periodically.  

All can contribute by sharing this campaign on your social media sites or refer a friend to contribute.

story:
HOA SUA SCHOOL

Hoa Sua is a vocational training school in the hospitality sector seeking the training and employability of disadvantaged youth, namely orphans and street childrenraised by charity organizations, to encourage their insertion on the labour market.

Hoa Sua is a successful worldwide Humanitarianism example  of social economy and professional integration for disadvantaged youth who, without such opportunities, would fair poorly on the job market.

Approximately 90% of graduates find work in international hotels and restaurants, and more than 6,000 underprivileged youth have received career training and have found a job.

Who are we? 

IMS, Intercultural Management Semester, Paris - France, was created in 2001 by ICD International Business School. This year again, French students would like to get involved into a project which unify the group.

Our commitment is to help achieving Hoa Sua goal: help to reduce the poverty in Vietnam and allow the emplo-ability and the training of the Vietnamese disavantaged and disable youth and ophans living on the street in the worst living conditions conceivable. 

To achieve that goal we decide to set up an international fund-raising as well as sending one or several interns at the school to provide them our skills and knowledges about communication, marketing and management.

Donate could be the opportunity for you to participate together to the culmination of this dream and to be part of a such admirable project.

story:
Every year, over 12,000 babies are injured at birth and the result is called a brachial plexus injury.  This injury affects the complex set of nerves in our neck called the brachial plexus.  When these nerves are injured, the result is full to partial paralysis of the affected arm, fingers, hands and shoulder.  For many, this is a lifelong disability.

Brachial plexus injuries can also be the cause of a motorcycle or car accident, and in sports it is called "burners" or "stingers". 

The United Brachial Plexus Network hosts a camp at the YMCA Trout Lodge in Potosi, Missouri for families affected by these injures.  Families from around the world join us as we learn more about the injury from brachial plexus specialists, support each other as families, and grow as individuals.  Camp is July 31-August 3, 2015.

Unfortunately, there are many families that can not afford the travel costs to attend camp.  The funds from this campaign will be used solely to provide scholarships to assist with travel costs, so every child that has a brachial plexus injury can come and see that they are not alone.

story:
I am Lamarana Jalloh,am 22 years old student living in Freetown,Sierra Leone. I love space exploration since I was seven,it's been my greatest dream in life.
I recently completed secondary school education in 2012, and since then I have been trying all means possible to go to a better science university abroad,to study aeronautics.

I have being learning about space exploration history for quite a while and all my efforts have been concentrated to achieve it by going abroad where conditions are favorable.
Why this matters to me so much is that my endless love and passion for space exploration is great and I believe the future in the search of knowledge of our planet and universe as a whole is important to the human race,I would like to be part of this wonderful search of knowledge as it has been my greatest pleasure to learn and explore our universe.
- My generous supporters,family and friends who I may know or not know,I would like to take this wonderful opportunity to sincerely promise you that the support you will give me will be spent truly for the cause which I asked for. The money  will  be spent on my university tuition fees for the academic course to the university and by so doing I will be doing my degree course in  information science and computer engineering,which will hopefully leads to my dreams of being a scientist.

I believe indiegogo with their amazing platform will definitely help to make it easier and successful for that to happen.

-My dear generous friends and colleagues,I desperately need your support to help make this dream a reality,I have gone through so much personal setbacks and societal challenges after I dropout of school three years ago,because of fees and basic needs  needed for my learning,and I thought all was over, but I never despair. Last year I regain the courage to continue my dream and I strongly believe together with your wonderful support we will make it and I will greatly appreciate every single effort on your side towards me.

story:
In Jesus Name

Easter, the most Blessed time of the Christian year, is upon  us.  It is a time, when we celebrate the Risen Christ, and share our bounty and blessing with our families.

I would like to provide Christians with an opportunity to join forces by passing a digital collection plate, to share some of our bounty with the hungry and homeless families and children of Gaza.

  • My name is Judy Mallay
  • I have contact with residents of Gaza who work to help the poor in the community.  One of the organizers received special recognition and a small award from the other members, just this past month.
  • Receiving food means the difference between hunger, malnutrition, or maintaining health for the most needy who are living in the open, making fires on the ground.  
  • I have independently sent my own personal contributions to the hungry of Gaza several times;  as much as I could afford.
  • This appeal provides Christians an opportunity to donate any amount, ANY AMOUNT, and not have to individually pay to send it by Western Union.  
100%  of ALL FUNDS RECEIVED FROM INDIEGOGO WILL BE FORWARDED TO GAZA FOR FOOD FOR THE POOR
Indiegogo has a fee, which they will deduct and then forward the remainder to this Campaign.  The ONLY expense we will have, is the cost of the Perks we have to thank you for contributing.  Then,100% of what we receive, will be forwarded to the poor of Gaza, for food.  Every dollar.


What We Need & What You Get

  • We have a short campaign, as we want to get funds and put them into action during the Easter season.  Our campaign will end on April 26, 2015, the Fourth Sunday of Easter. 
  • There are two Christian churches in Gaza.  They struggle to help all the poor in their communities, no matter what race, religion or beliefs they hold. - This was the example given to us by Jesus.  
  • We will make contact with the two churches and offer to give a donation of 50% of the total Campaign receipts to each one.   
  • In the unlikely event that we cannot make contact with the two specific churches, we will give all of the money to recognized community organizers with a proven track record, including photo evidence, of working with and providing for the poorest in the community.
  • Our goal is to raise $12,000.  With Indigogo fees, and the cost of PERKS and money transfers,  we will have at least $11,000 to share between the two Christian churches of Gaza - IF we meet our GOAL.
  •  The Latin Catholic Church / Holy Family School, and,  the Church of Saint Porphyrius, an Orthodox Christian church.  - $5500 to each.


WHAT WOULD JESUS DO?

In the time of Jesus, there was political turmoil and conflicts in the land, just as there is today.  Jesus message was to help the poor and the needy, the oppressed, the suffering and the sick.  

Jesus did not align himself with the big power brokers of any affiliation; he cared about the poor, the needy, the sick and the oppressed; the people with no power and no voice.

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Esa5SOZDCi0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

The two Christian churches in Gaza work under unimaginable conditions of overwhelming poverty, and constant physical risk. 

 Can you find room in your heart to share with them the cost of eggs, and milk and bread during this special Easter season?


PERKS? 

Do we have Perks?

YES, we have some wonderful perks.  Take a look. 


QUESTION?

WHEN will we contact the two churches who will receive the funds from this campaignÉ

ANSWER:  WHEN WE REACH $2,500.    

We do not want to contact needy people and offer to help, and later, if you do not support this campaign, we would have to tell them, there is no help.  That just doesn't feel like a good thing to do.
When we have reached $2,500. we will contact both churches AND PROVIDE AN UPDATE HERE.  At that time we could let them know that at least $1,000 each will be sent.  
IF THIS CAMPAIGN ENDS WITH ANY AMOUNT, no matter how small, the funds WILL DEFINITELY, 100% be forwarded.  

WE WILL PROVIDE A FULLY TIMELY UPDATE HERE


Speedy Transfer of Funds QUESTION 

Western Union money transfer is a safe, reliable way to transfer the funds to Gaza.  I have transferred my own donation, several times this way.  The recipient always collects the money the same day; or the next morning if I send late in the day.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your family and friends.  Your participation will make a real difference.  You can multiply that good work many times if your friends and family participate.  

Please share with them, this opportunity to bring Eggs, Milk and Bread during Easter to the hungry, desperate people of Gaza.

  • You can quickly share this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Google +, and more, using the Indiegogo share tools

PLEASE HELP SHARE THE JOY OF EASTER EGGS BY DONATING FOR EGGS, MILK, AND BREAD FOR THE POOR


Learn More:
Please view these articles for a better understanding of the need, and the response of the two Christian Churches in Gaza:

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/israel/10986779/Gaza-churches-open-doors-to-refugees-from-Israel-offensive.html

A British artist recently made his way into Gaza, and this is the documentary he made:

https://youtu.be/kgzyOAqwHjI


Food For Thought

(A Christian minister blogged about his visit to Gaza, helping to feed the hungry)

FOOD FOR THOUGHT

Friday 7th was a long, but this time, satisfying day. Through CMG (Christian Mission to Gaza) Pastor Hanna raises money to buy food to take to those most in need. And there are so many folk in desperate need in Gaza. For those in the refugee camps (70% of population) without work there is a small amount of benefit paid by the UN. Sadly, it is not enough for a family to survive on.

﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿
Delivering food parcels
 The food parcels, worth about £50, are very well received. People who know of families in the worst conditions contact Gaza Baptist Church and they try to help if they can. The families are contacted first to ask if they would like a food parcel. They all say 'yes'. The operation is run by a wonderful man called Atif. He is a Muslim and a good friend of Hanna's. He is a dear, warm human being. I liked him instantly. He was a close friend of Rami, who was martyred for his faith. Hanna calls him 'A man of peace'. So together with a Muslim driver, Hanna and I went with Atif to deliver parcels to 10 families. If you believe the stereotypes of Muslims in the media such an entourage should be impossible in a place like Gaza. But it isn't, because there are people of peace in both Christianity and Islam. And Hanna is happy to work with anyone who wants the best for his people.

The homes we visited were both tragic and wonderful. Every home showed some signs of severe deprivation: leaking roofs (corrugated sheets), rat infestation, broken-down cookers and washing machines, no hot water, little in the way of furnishings. Yet the spirit of the people was unbroken. These are strong, resilient people. Proud people. And there was the children. Thousands of them! About 8 plus in most homes. And they were just terrific. Like children everywhere they play and laugh and want your attention - attention I was happy to give them. I kept getting the blame for us running late because I was playing with the children! 


One of the families who received a food parcel

﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿I quickly found a way to talk to the teenagers. Football! The boys all love football. When I said 'Messi?' I would be greeted with a chorus of approval and comments of 'Barcelona!' or 'Real Madrid!' One group of lads circled around me and one boy had a Barcelona shirt on with 'Messi' written on the back. I said to him, 'You are Messi!' They all laughed. Another boy pointed at me and said, 'You Ronaldo!' I shook my head and pointed at my tummy. They fell on the floor in stitches!
Atif wanted to welcome me into his home so our last call was to his home in Beach Camp, which is, as the name suggests, at the beach! He made us some lovely Turkish coffee, which was delicious and just what I needed. 

Fishermen mending their nets on Gaza Beach

At the end of the day I was exhausted and exhilarated. Many things had made me feel so sad but, even although it was just in a very small way, we had helped and encouraged a number of forgotten people. CMG doesn't just give out food. We found many homes with broken appliances and leaking roofs. Atif made careful notes. Appliances will be fixed or replaced and roofs will be mended. In a small measure the kingdom of God had come just a little bit closer to the suffering poor of Hanna's beloved Gaza.

BLOGGED BY:  http://iwillbeamazedifthisallgoessmoothly.blogs...

And Hanna is happy to work with anyone who wants the best for his people.The homes we visited were both tragic and wonderful. Every home showed some signs of severe deprivation: leaking roofs (corrugated sheets), rat infestation, broken-down cookers and washing machines, no hot water, little in the way of furnishings. Yet the spirit of the people was unbroken. These are strong, resilient people. Proud people. And there was the children. Thousands of them! About 8 plus in most homes. And they were just terrific. Like children everywhere they play and laugh and want your attention - attention I was happy to give them. I kept getting the blame for us running late because I was playing with the children! 



One of the families who received a food parcel

﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿I quickly found a way to talk to the teenagers. Football! The boys all love football. When I said 'Messi?' I would be greeted with a chorus of approval and comments of 'Barcelona!' or 'Real Madrid!' One group of lads circled around me and one boy had a Barcelona shirt on with 'Messi' written on the back. I said to him, 'You are Messi!' They all laughed. Another boy pointed at me and said, 'You Ronaldo!' I shook my head and pointed at my tummy. They fell on the floor in stitches!Atif wanted to welcome me into his home so our last call was to his home in Beach Camp, which is, as the name suggests, at the beach! He made us some lovely Turkish coffee, which was delicious and just what I needed. 

Fishermen mending their nets on Gaza Beach

At the end of the day I was exhausted and exhilarated. Many things had made me feel so sad but, even although it was just in a very small way, we had helped and encouraged a number of forgotten people. CMG doesn't just give out food. We found many homes with broken appliances and leaking roofs. Atif made careful notes. Appliances will be fixed or replaced and roofs will be mended. In a small measure the kingdom of God had come just a little bit closer to the suffering poor of Hanna's beloved Gaza.
BLOGGED BY:  http://iwillbeamazedifthisallgoessmoothly.blogs...
campaign_city: $500 USD sent to Rafah on May 31, Palestine, State of

story:
Francois was just told his esophagi cancer is incurable, We are raising funds for a community dinner for him and is six year old daughter, so she can have a little help starting in live, since the only treatment they can offer him , is to ease the pain. Is live expectancy is now on a timer, and we hope to raise enough funds for Marie-loup to be able to have a kickstart in life.






Souper bénéfice samedi le 4 avril 2015 à partir de 17 hrs pm à l' Érablière St-Étienne , avec groupe de musique sur place voir le souper traiteur Bolduc sera afficher sous peu, 3 prix de présence à remettre et coût de participation 50 $ par personne.

Dans le but de ramasser des fonds pour réaliser son plus grand désire, d'offrir la chance à son enfant , d avoir une meilleure vie et une sécurité lors du grand départ de son père et permettra a la famille, qui devra s'occuper et prendre la relève de Marielou d'avoir une plus grande autonomie. Voilà le plus grand désir d'un ami d'enfance qui nous-aient très cher!

François Auger atteint du cancer de l’œsophage et père d'une petite fille de six ans au nom de Marie -loup. Qui lutte contre son cancer depuis plus d'un an, Mais malheureusement suite à d'autre complications, il lui ont annoncé ,à notre grande tristesse que sa maladie est devenue incurable et donneront, des traitements pour alléger et retarder le cancer qui était la solution ultime et unique à lui offrir pour prolonger sa durée de vie indéterminée.

A tous ceux et celles qui prennent cette histoire à cœur ( parenté, amis,connaissance, nous vous invitons à venir nous rejoindre et nous rassembler pour cet événement qui permettra à notre ami,père de famille d'atténuer sont inquiétude envers l'avenir de son enfant, assouplir sa souffrance qu'il vie pour cet instant et vivre un moment inoubliable avec nous.


Pour ceux et celles qui désire seulement donner une contribution sans participé à l'événement ou donner un don supplémentaires et payer votre admission au souper. Communiquer avec l'organisateur d'événements kevin demers 418 440 7770 pour information ou par Facebook, kdwaiters@hotmail.com

Soupe aux pois
Fèves au lard
Œufs brouillés
Crêpe au beurre d’érable
Jambon maison cuit au sirop d’érable
Bacon
Saucisse maison
Grillades (oreilles de crisse)
Pâté à la viande
Méchoui au porc
Bœuf bourguignon
Pommes de terre rissolées
Ketchup Hein z et maison
Salade de chou crémeuse
Plateau de fruits
Pain et beurre
Dessert : Pudding à l’érable
Café et thé

Souper bénéfice pour François Auger

Endroit : Érablière St-Étienne
185 Route St-André
St-Étienne

Date : 4 avril 2015

Heure d’arrivée : 17 heures
Souper servi : 18 heures
Animation souper: Carl Morais
(Pour ceux et celles qui connaissent bien François, souvenez des anecdotes, car vous serez appelé à les raconter)
Groupe de musique : 21 heures (Soirée dansante) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YjmdmTgW7lk

Bar disponible

Prix de présence : 3 prix




Frais d’admission :
50$ par personne.
Enfants: 0 à 5 ans 4,00$
6 à 10 ans 10,50$
10 ans et plus 30.00$

20$ de don pour MariLou (fille de François)

Mode de paiement:

Le dépôt devra être au montant de 50,30$ étant donné que Paypal conserve 0,30$ par transaction.)

- Par chèque à l'attention de l'organisateur soit Kevin Demers et l'envoyer à l'adresse mentionné au bas de ce message. ou

 Merci de payer le plus tôt possible, ne pas attendre la date limite.

story:
Education can and should prepare our children for the opportunities and challenges of the future. Our children can and should become lifelong readers and have a thirst for learning. 

True Learning Cooperative will use Inquiry-based learning and Mindfulness techniques to activate curiosity and willingness to learn.



True Learning Cooperative will use guided discovery to deliver a self-paced literature and arts-based curriculum for students in grades K-12.  We will use proven innovative educational methods that work efficiently, and respond to individual needs and differences.

We believe that schools should serve their families, that children should have choices in how they invest their time and be engaged in their learning. 

All children want to feel accepted, want to feel safe, want to believe their ideas are valued and be treated as individuals with rights. 

Educators should foster mutual trust and positive interactions between students and adults, and seek cooperation from students rather than relying on punitive or fear-based control measures.

Educators should create supportive, self paced, goal-oriented, and challenging learning environments that are flexible in meeting individual needs. 

Schools should cultivate resiliency, effective communication, conflict resolution, and identifying and managing emotions.

Schools should encourage healthy diet and exercise, on campus and in the community. TLC will offer and encourage participation in yoga as a means of empowering children to teach themselves and enjoy what they are learning. Yoga also creates natural bonds among students, children, parents and the community at large. Students become teachers, teachers become students and the community joins in the process.

Guided Discovery Fosters True Learning

  • Creates a cooperative social learning structure.
  • Offers the freedom to be creative, innovative and to engage critical thinking.
  • Initiates challenging investigations.
  • Facilitates discussions.
  • Engages students through performance and creative arts.
  • Allows intensive engagement and learning by reflection.
  • Encourages students to analyze, interpret, and predict.
  • Encourages independence, cooperation and productivity.
  • Encourages students to work at their own pace to accomplish goals.
  • Boosts intrinsic motivation, essential for true learning.


We want to make sure our students get enough physical activity, sleep, dinners with their family, time for friends, explore side interests and enjoy reading for pleasure. We want to encourage children to learn how to maintain some balance in their lives and enjoy a rich and wonderful childhood.

How We Will Serve Our Families:

  • We feel homework is anti-family, and ours will consist mostly of reading.
  • TLC will NOT be subject to state and district required testing, and many other dictates.
  • TLC will NOT "teach to the tests" or be driven by Common Core Standards alone.
  • Our tiered instruction will allow students to be challenged at their own levels and paces.
  • Students will pursue art, music, dance, creative writing and drama, as well as traditional subjects.
  • Our plan will accommodate both gifted and challenged.
  • We will enjoy a flexible daily schedule. 
  • We will offer flexible vacation options so that families can enjoy time off together. 



How Will TLC Provide a Different Experience?

TLC will provide a positive learning environment in which children can define who they are and who they want to be.

TLC will work to achieve mutual trust between students and adults.  Student behaviors are affected by the behaviors of the adults around them.

We will seek cooperation from students, rather than relying on control measures. We will affect behavior by addressing student motivations and our own behaviors.

Our education plan will reduce the motivation to cheat. Methods other than rewards and punishments will be utilized as punishment does not motivate improved behavior.

Students will play an active and thoughtful role in shaping our rules of behavior. Children deserve representation and the right to participate in decisions affecting them.

We will work with students on a human level that stimulates intellectual, artistic, and technical originality.  Students will treat others as they want to be treated and will develop appropriate strategies to use when interacting with others.

Children need practice making choices.  Actions have consequences.  Students will be responsible for their behaviors and will reflect on the effects their actions have on others.

The secret to success is the ability to make the right choices.  Listing pros and cons, identifying and evaluating options, and weighing facts carefully are methods that will be introduced and modeled.

We Will Stand Firm on Tolerance.

Bullying will not be tolerated.

We will work to increase the self esteem of all students, which will soothe the unheard needs of those who bully.  We will require all students to understand and sign a contract specifying that bullying behavior will not be tolerated.

We believe that by offering a way to bring bullying behavior to a public venue through our People's Court, its power will be lessened.  We will not tolerate berating, will work with students to understand why they have a need to insult and then help them to learn productive behaviors.


To learn more about our self governing features visit:  http://www.truelearningcoop.org/Education-Program.php  

Learn more about:
True Learning Cooperative, K-12 Private School 

Meet Tony Messina, President

Meet Angie Sills, Director

Meet Carroll Hauptle, Director 

Meet Wendi Pittman, Early Education Director

Students Who Learn Differently

Students with learning challenges will have unique opportunities to focus on who they are and how they learn. We will ensure that all students, especially those with learning challenges, focus on their abilities. 

TLC will welcome families who seek alternatives to relying on medications and those who want to work towards discontinuing medication for their child(ren). TLC will provide support, a conducive environment and dietary choices appropriate for children with learning challenges.


TOGETHER,
WE can begin changing lives and our nation's education choices!


We need funds to make True Learning Cooperative a reality for area families, to show that our plan is a feasible business model that can be replicated and to spawn a revolution in education reform!

We have our progressive literature and arts based education plan. We have developed plans to convert three office suites into our campus, and continue to evaluate other possibilities in our area. We want our campus to be large enough to to serve 282 students.

In Florida, charter schools are funded and controlled by the county districts and are restricted by many of the same constraints as public schools. 

Private schools are not accredited or certified by the state. However the states does have standards for the schools receiving scholarships. TLC will accept scholarships and will be in compliance with the state to do so.



Where will your money be invested?

    $50,000     Renovations for Our Campus and First Year of Rent

True Learning Cooperative will also be funded by tuition and state scholarships. These funds will pay for teachers' salaries and administration.

We will also earn revenue by offering yoga classes and healthy beverages and snacks during non-school hours and summer camps to meet the needs and interests of our area's older students.

Yes, TLC is a For-Profit Venture.  

We believe that an investor-based for-profit school can succeed and be more innovative than a non-profit school.  We will charge the amount the state pays for scholarships for tuition, and many of our students will be on scholarships. We will supplement tuition with yoga classes, workshops on health and nutrition, and our sales of juices and smoothies.

We are focused on efficiency and logic. As we grow and prosper, so will our educational programming, and the benefits we can provide to the community and its families.

JOIN US!  With YOUR SUPPORT, WE will prove our education model raises achievement, and accomplishes our every goal. True Learning Cooperative will illustrate how to create a successful school that serves its students and its families, Today, Tomorrow and Beyond. 

THIS IS NOT AN ENTIRELY NEW IDEA! 

Progressive private schools are changing the educational landscape by advancing the ideas that students should play an active role in shaping their own futures, should have voices and choices, and utilize self-governing.



PLEASE visit and share our website, www.TrueLearningCoop.org



~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

For $20 

Change Your Life

Learn How to Gain Cooperation from Everyone in Your Life, including your children.

Succinct guide of positive discipline tools to help you change how you deal with children and adults.  Easy, painless. Start with two or three each week, or jump in with both feet.

Educator and Parent Versions available. Please specify.

Document will be emailed and you can embark on your family's new, peaceful life.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

For $60 

TLC I Am Doing Something About Education! T-Shirts

Your very own TLC Quality T-Shirt  AND “Change Your Life.” On Front “I Am Doing Something To Change Education!” On Back will be TLC’s Logo. You will choose your size after our campaign closes.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

For $100 

Limited Edition Print

"Ole Woman in Wheelbarrow" Limited Edition Print AND a TLC Drawstring Bag.  One of 282 Hand-signed and numbered by the artist, Angie Sills. Printed on 100% Cotton Rag.  Approx. 11 x 14"

Pointillism. Perfect for Home or Office.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

For $150 

Spanish River Grill Gift Certificate valued at $100. 

ONLY ONE.  

Located on East Third Avenue in New Smyrna Beach. 
Scrumptious offerings with a modern approach to Latino cuisine.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

For $150-$275 

Big Cat Rescue of Tampa, Florida

Even an animal that has powerful muscles, sharp teeth, and deadly claws sometimes needs rescuing! Take a Day Tour of Big Cat Rescue to see the home of nearly 90 wild cats of 12 different species including tigers, lions, leopards and more that have been saved from abuse, abandonment, and neglect. Find out how they are given the care and shelter they deserve. On this 1.5 hour walking tour, don't be surprised if your heart fills with joy as you watch these playful kitties romping and socializing in their new furever home!

Big Cat Rescue is the world's largest accredited sanctuary dedicated to caring for cats and ending the captive big cat trade.

Tickets should be redeemed within one year of receipt. Reservations are required. Booking information will be provided on the ticket.



Two Tickets  $150 Four Tickets $275

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

For $200

Individual Learning Consultation

Is your child not making progress in his or her current education situation? Do you or your child’s teachers have concerns?  Would you like help from sources outside your child’s current school?  We will spend time getting to know your child, assessing his or her strengths and weaknesses, offering referrals to specialists when warranted, and offering advice and options.   

Approx. 2 hours. Includes follow-up call.

When Your Child is Enrolled in TLC, We Will Credit You $100!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

For $200
You Will Greet Us Each Day!

We will ship a blank tile to you, you paint it and send it back to us.  We will have it fired and install it in our lobby to greet us each day!  We would like to have an ocean theme. You also have the option of letting us find a child to create your tile.




~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

For $225
Tree Trek Adventure Park, Orlando, Florida

Orlando's premiere aerial adventure course featuring zip lines, nets, Tarzan swings and other fun obstacles for every age and ability. Orlando Tree Trek's color coded courses become progressively more difficult and are designed to challenge both the mind and body. Prepare yourself for the ultimate family adventure and explore Orlando like never before!



Two Adult Tickets $225 
Four Adult Tickets $375
Two Adult and Two Children’s Tickets $360

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

For $500
Career Exploration for Ages 13 & Up

Let us help your child decide what career paths to explore.  We will provide Aptitude Testing, and Identification of Strengths, Weaknesses, and Interests.

We will guide your child through their research of their career and college options. Having a clear path can be a motivator for indifferent students Approx. 5 hours.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

For $1000 

College Prep for Ages 16 & Up

Navigating the college admissions process is a daunting experience.  We will provide assistance and guidance with your child’s college selection and applications.  We will help navigate through your acceptance process. Benefit from our experience.  Includes instruction on writing essays and financial aid support. Approx. 10 hours.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

For $5700 

TLC Research Scholarships

An investment of $5700 would create a scholarship fund, named after you, to help a child who learns differently attend, who otherwise could not, for one year.  We want to discover how successful we are with our plan and philosophy, compare and publish our results.  

$5700 is the cost for one year's tuition at TLC. If you would like to learn more about our plan and the supporting research, visit our website.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Have more to give? Become a Building Fund Donor - range of donations from $50,000 to $350,000 or more - we will fly you and a companion to our opening festivities. You will be our guest of honor.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Thank you for taking a close look at our exciting future.  Please email us with any questions or suggestions. We look forward to hearing from you and having you BE PART OF THE CHANGE!

Contact us by email at truelearning@cfl.rr.com

In Florida, charter schools are funded and controlled by the county districts and are restricted by many of the same constraints as public schools. 


Private schools are not accredited or certified by the state. However the states does have standards for the schools receiving scholarships. TLC will accept scholarships and will be in compliance with the state to do so.


Where will your money be invested?
    $50,000     Renovations for Our Campus and First Year of Rent
True Learning Cooperative will also be funded by tuition and state scholarships. These funds will pay for teachers' salaries and administration.
We will also earn revenue by offering yoga classes and healthy beverages and snacks during non-school hours and summer camps to meet the needs and interests of our area's older students.
Yes, TLC is a For-Profit Venture.  
We believe that an investor-based for-profit school can succeed and be more innovative than a non-profit school.  We will charge the amount the state pays for scholarships for tuition, and many of our students will be on scholarships. We will supplement tuition with yoga classes, workshops on health and nutrition, and our sales of juices and smoothies. 
We are focused on efficiency and logic. As we grow and prosper, so will our educational programming, and the benefits we can provide to the community and its families.
JOIN US!  With YOUR SUPPORT, WE will prove our education model raises achievement, and accomplishes our every goal. True Learning Cooperative will illustrate how to create a successful school that serves its students and its families, Today, Tomorrow and Beyond. 
THIS IS NOT AN ENTIRELY NEW IDEA! 
Progressive private schools are changing the educational landscape by advancing the ideas that students should play an active role in shaping their own futures, should have voices and choices, and utilize self-governing.




PLEASE visit and share our website, www.TrueLearningCoop.org




~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
For $20 
Change Your Life
Learn How to Gain Cooperation from Everyone in Your Life, including your children.
Succinct guide of positive discipline tools to help you change how you deal with children and adults.  Easy, painless. Start with two or three each week, or jump in with both feet. 
Educator and Parent Versions available. Please specify.
Document will be emailed and you can embark on your family's new, peaceful life.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
For $60 
TLC I Am Doing Something About Education! T-Shirts

Your very own TLC Quality T-Shirt  AND “Change Your Life.”
On Front “I Am Doing Something To Change Education!”
On Back will be TLC’s Logo. You will choose your size after our campaign closes.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
For $100 
Limited Edition Print
"Ole Woman in Wheelbarrow" Limited Edition Print AND a TLC Drawstring Bag.  One of 282 Hand-signed and numbered by the artist, Angie Sills. Printed on 100% Cotton Rag.  Approx. 11 x 14"
Pointillism. Perfect for Home or Office.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
For $150 
Spanish River Grill Gift Certificate valued at $100. 
ONLY ONE.  
Located on East Third Avenue in New Smyrna Beach. 
Scrumptious offerings with a modern approach to Latino cuisine.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
For $150-$275 
Big Cat Rescue of Tampa, Florida
Even an animal that has powerful muscles, sharp teeth, and deadly claws sometimes needs rescuing! Take a Day Tour of Big Cat Rescue to see the home of nearly 90 wild cats of 12 different species including tigers, lions, leopards and more that have been saved from abuse, abandonment, and neglect. Find out how they are given the care and shelter they deserve. On this 1.5 hour walking tour, don't be surprised if your heart fills with joy as you watch these playful kitties romping and socializing in their new furever home!
Big Cat Rescue is the world's largest accredited sanctuary dedicated to caring for cats and ending the captive big cat trade. 
Tickets should be redeemed within one year of receipt. Reservations are required. Booking information will be provided on the ticket.



Two Tickets  $150
Four Tickets $275
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
For $200
Individual Learning Consultation
Is your child not making progress in his or her current education situation? Do you or your child’s teachers have concerns?  Would you like help from sources outside your child’s current school?  We will spend time getting to know your child, assessing his or her strengths and weaknesses, offering referrals to specialists when warranted, and offering advice and options.   
Approx. 2 hours. Includes follow-up call.
When Your Child is Enrolled in TLC, We Will Credit You $100!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
For $200You Will Greet Us Each Day!
We will ship a blank tile to you, you paint it and send it back to us.  We will have it fired and install it in our lobby to greet us each day!  We would like to have an ocean theme. You also have the option of letting us find a child to create your tile.




~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
For $225Tree Trek Adventure Park, Orlando, Florida
Orlando's premiere aerial adventure course featuring zip lines, nets, Tarzan swings and other fun obstacles for every age and ability. Orlando Tree Trek's color coded courses become progressively more difficult and are designed to challenge both the mind and body. Prepare yourself for the ultimate family adventure and explore Orlando like never before!



Two Adult Tickets $225 Four Adult Tickets $375
Two Adult and Two Children’s Tickets $360
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
For $500Career Exploration for Ages 13 & Up
Let us help your child decide what career paths to explore.  We will provide Aptitude Testing, and Identification of Strengths, Weaknesses, and Interests.
We will guide your child through their research of their career and college options. Having a clear path can be a motivator for indifferent students
Approx. 5 hours.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
For $1000 
College Prep for Ages 16 & Up
Navigating the college admissions process is a daunting experience.  We will provide assistance and guidance with your child’s college selection and applications.  We will help navigate through your acceptance process. Benefit from our experience.  Includes instruction on writing essays and financial aid support. Approx. 10 hours.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
For $5700 
TLC Research Scholarships
An investment of $5700 would create a scholarship fund, named after you, to help a child who learns differently attend, who otherwise could not, for one year.  We want to discover how successful we are with our plan and philosophy, compare and publish our results.  
$5700 is the cost for one year's tuition at TLC. If you would like to learn more about our plan and the supporting research, visit our website.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Have more to give? Become a Building Fund Donor - range of donations from $50,000 to $350,000 or more - we will fly you and a companion to our opening festivities. You will be our guest of honor.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Thank you for taking a close look at our exciting future.  Please email us with any questions or suggestions. We look forward to hearing from you and having you BE PART OF THE CHANGE!
Contact us by email at truelearning@cfl.rr.com

story:
Summary

Hi, My name's Ivy. I'm a co-founder and the Program Director of Gender Benders -- a grassroots trans* advocacy group in South Carolina.

53 days ago I applied for a spot in the 50th Anniversary Selma to Montgomery Walking Classroom. Every day since we have walked a 5K or more in hopes that we would make it off the waiting list and into classroom. So, when I got our acceptance letter late last week, you can imagine how excited we were!

This is a once in a lifetime opportunity for us! To learn about how people have historically used their bodies to push a movement forward, and how we can honor their legacy in our work today would be invaluable for us as queer Southern organizers. Thanks to our matching grant provided by Campaign for Southern Equality every dollar you donate will be doubled until we reach our goal!!


What We Need & Why

The only problem we have is that we are 22 days away from the trip, and we have to figure out how to fund it. Here's the break down of what we need and why:

Four of us have registered. If we carpool, share a room, and have to buy 2 meals a day we can get the cost of the trip down to $1030. Our friends at Campaign for Southern Equality are sponsoring us with a matching gift of $515.00! That means we're just $515 short of reaching our goal and making this dream a reality.

If we are able to raise the funds to attend we would not only be learning about about the journey to the voting rights act of 1965. We would also be learning about new techniques to incorporate into our our work with the trans*  community in South Carolina. Considering the astronomical number of trans* women of color we have already lost to violence and transphobia this year, I think there is no conversation that is more relevant to our work than the intersections of racial and trans* justice.

Learning about new tools we can bring back to improve our work in these areas would be transformative for Gender Benders.

The Impact

The impact your contribution would make on our work cannot be overstated! We are a 100% volunteer run organization, with very limited resources. Stretching a dollar as far as possible, and support from community members like you is how we're able to continue our work.

Ways You Can Help

Here are a couple ways you can help us reach our goal and have the learning experience of a lifetime:

1) Consider making a donation to our campaign. Every little bit helps!

2) Please share this link via social media and email to your contacts. We can reach this goal, but we can't do it without your help!

3) Already contributed and shared? Like us on facebook and cheer us along!
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Gender-Benders/2...
